LczkswbS74WdTC025pLd3g.text: Krazy Fish is great, and I'm writing this to clarify what the previous reviewer posted. I'd be willing to bet that the "manager" he was talking about "yelling" was K.C. (the owner)....anyone who knows KC knows that he was more than likely just blustering some bullsh-t and acting like the big bad loud guy and the employees were all in on the joke, theres no one who works there who wouls yell for real in front of diners. I don't think the last poster got the joke......its really mellow there

eqQG5BeNwFvvIntjZ5MTDw.text: Great lunch spot.  The salmon fish tacos were really nice, as was the squash casserole.

tipG8dTWL_Iw_Sr-nR0kfw.text: Krazy Fish was outstanding! It sits somewhere between Mexican and Caribbean cuisine. The atmosphere was extremely laid back (think pirate cove-esque). We sat in the tiki bar, an extra outdoor seating area (there are two). My handsome boyfriend had the Neptune Platter, which had a lightly breaded assortment of fried fish AND vegetables. I had the marinated ribeye fajitas. They were amazing! The meat was incredibly tender. The black beans were juicy and the rice well cooked. They even grilled the tortillas. I'm going back for more, but next time I'm getting the fish tacos.

nwK55fuHeKKo_4y0P6b4GQ.text: The 4 - 6 taco happy hour is one of the best deals in town. Every taco I've tried has been great. There are often good drink specials too.

bY_rTqc-9Tq6q5pRxS_c8w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Plaza-Midwood, if not all of Charlotte.  My favorite dish is the tofu-lemongrass tacos, but everything I've had there is good.  I love the casual atmosphere, interesting decorations, decent prices, unique menu items (if you are vegetarian make sure they prepare your dish without fish sauce), friendly staff, community events, easy parking and comfortable patios!  I'm getting hungry just writing this... maybe I'll order takeout for dinner tonight?? :)

gwcVzlxshtqRLadmNL2s3w.text: I wasn't sure what to expect, but the website alone was all the tease I needed.  Fun, casual environment with AMAZING food and service!  I am a seafood snob from MD and was blown away w/ my entree.  The taste was incredible.  Service was over the top.  Great margaritas, too!  Our group also enjoyed being there on a Friday night and got to see live music outside on the patio.  It doesn't get much better than that.  A must go to again!

PmN9OzrXSwQjz1B2Fdzw0g.text: My honey and I decided to check this place out for a Saturday nite dinner. There was a good crowd of patrons. An eclectic menu was cool with us. The food is nicely seasoned and we would return and try some of the other dishes. My only complaint was our server was just okay. Service could have been a notch better.

790XukuuRO_i-6y9WgaMNg.text: Delicious! Went there for the first time and had the BiG Dixie Chicken Sandwich. Prepared with great style. Had the pleasure of finishing my friends pork and blueberry chutney taco.......I've never been a fan of meats n sweets, but they may have made me a believer. Again delicious. I'm going back. You're Welcome!

YEXalc-TEI3mki6OgnuIRw.text: My husband and I went to Krazy Fish during opening week and first weekend night-Friday.  I got the special-Red Curry Shrimp-and my husband got the beef and pork grill.  The portions are tremendous and the sides we got-squash casserole, black bean salad and macaroni-n-cheese were fabulous!  Glass of tasty Malbec was only $6 dollars!   Everyone was nice and it's fun to watch the kitchen run around.  Can't wait for the warm weather and the Tiki Hut patio bar to open in the back!  IF YOU ARE EVER THERE WHEN THEY HAVE THE GREEN THAI MUSSELS YOU MUST HAVE THEM!!!

tKqKU9__VVMPyxtkbR0Jdw.text: Loved the vibe, decor and staff. The menu has a variety of choices for carnivores, pescatarians, vegetarians and vegans alike.   Most unfortunately, the food disappointed. I had high expectations based on other reviews. Maybe we ordered the wrong things but I couldn't tell you if the food was fresh. Most items were overly fried and greasy. The presentation could also use some work. On the lighter side, the lemongrass tofu tacos were good. I'd probably give the place another shot.

YQPD2m_rfXGCtYjfsJmORA.text: I've been here 3 times now. The first time I ordered off the menu and got tempura shrimp tacos. They were delicious! As my side, I got the potato salad. It wasn't your ordinary potato salad; it's more of a cold german potato salad (with vinegar) - which I liked. The second time I went I ordered the lunch special, a sandwich called "Beefona". It was a pork tenderloin sandwich with lettuce, mayo and the awesomely delicious pickled cucumbers. Although the service that day was way too slow, once my meal came out and I got a few bites in, the sandwich helped that the service was slow. The pork was also a bit overcooked, but you know when you're hungry it sometimes just doesn't matter. Besides, it all tasted good anyway! I took the fam last night, dined al fresco and once again decided to try the special on the board. It was a noodle bowl with mushrooms and gravy. It also had carrots and celery. Even though a veggie dish (which I usually don't order), this tasted very good. I suggested that adding red pepper and green onion would have been a good addition to the dish. KC was out of red pepper that day but said it would have been in if he had it.  All in all, my experience has been a 3 for 3 on the food and a 2 for 3 on the service. (BTW, our waitress last night was so friendly and made the dinner enjoyable.)

o3DGPHFferLa3n3A59pxrw.text: Absolutly...awful. Unfortunate because I live near it. It's good for kids who have no taste buds.

BVHTUI3jRxZX7u2g8SMhPA.text: Our first visit to Krazy Fish was a little, well crazy. I will go ahead and say that the food was delicious... but the service was absolutely terrible. Our waiter forgot our appetizer, our salads (that came with our meals), brought me chicken,shrimp and tofu when I asked for just chicken, and also forgot to bring the rice that came with my meal... wow. Even with the terrible service- the food shone through. I had the red curry and it was velvety, spicy, perfection. My husband had the shrimp and grits and enjoyed it- although he said it was a little too spicy (he likes spicy foods) especially with the jalepeno cornbread on the side. Regardless of this first experience- we will be giving it another try- looking forward to some tacos next go round....

nkZL11YnbksPvH-ukWWn_Q.text: Great value, vibe and vegetarian choices. Skip pad Thai and go for the tacos. Great start although still working out the kinks with a big creative menu.

aK7gapD3Rl0HoEt1G4WTDQ.text: I was really excited about trying this place & I was using this as a night to break my diet... I should have stayed home & ate a salad. I ordered the Neptune's platter which was SUPPOSED to be fried fish, calamari & scallops. I got my plate & it had fish (which was fried in small pieces, I thought I would be getting a single piece...), calamari and shrimp... Shrimp? That wasn't even in the description. I asked our waitress where the scallops were. She asked the cook & replied, "Oh we're out of scallops". If I had known that I would not have ordered the dish at all, I was really looking forward to scallops! (one of my favorite foods) That is just bad business not to tell a customer they're out of something and try to replace it with something else. It's kind of like ordering a steak and getting chicken - unacceptable. Besides this mistake the food was overly fried & not very good. The dish had deep fried vegetables (frozen) as a side (deep fried broccoli?) and dry cornbread (not good) The highlight of the meal was probably the ceviche appetizer. My friend got the blackened tuna & was not impressed either (left over half of it at the restaurant) The waitress was friendly & discounted the meal but she should have been aware if they were out of something. A 2 star rating is generous... I won't be rushing back after this experience. There are too many other good restaurants in Charlotte.

ZrezE1zr9iNMaCwHLRrlGA.text: This is the place you have been looking for. Great food, good price and fun

vCzmh_YqA99HTrnTqv3zMQ.text: What happened? I came here once, about a year ago, and LOVED it. Food was good, and inventive. I went back with a group of girlfriends on May 8th, and had a TERRIBLE experience. The restaurant was obviously understaffed- for example- we ordered a couple bottles of wine, the waitress brought them out after about 5 minutes, but then we had to wait another 15  minutes for her to bring glasses and open the bottles! The glasses she brought were filthy, we ended up drinking wine out of pint glasses. That would have been fine if the food had been good, but everyone food was terrible. Tofu was dry and tough, chicken was overcooked, tacos were so greasy they left a puddle on your plate. Not sure I'll be coming back here again- so disappointed.

fr6liN5Nb9mM2Ru0_V6lkg.text: Went on a rainy Thursday for lunch. My brother got the chicken quesadilla and I got the Szechuan Salmon taco with bulgogi sauce and cactus salad. Our food seemed to take quite a while to get out, but at least we felt confident in its freshness. The quesadilla had a lot of meat in it. My salmon taco was very delish. I'm still amused by the combination of Chinese/Korean/Mexican. The cactus salad needed seasoning to me. My brother wasn't too impressed with the decor/cleanliness, and I have to admit, I think they put too much into decorating it and don't pay enough attention to simple sanitation. Their sanitation rating was hidden (I LOOKED for it), our silverware was filmy and overall, it really seemed to be a dive. I don't mind dives, but the concept is to APPEAR grungy, not BE grungy. I think whatever the customer comes into contact with should be CLEAN. I looked up the rating and it's a 95.5 if you're wondering.

jpI25Bxek0GrUk_aM8XASw.text: Wow, so unique!  I just ate here for the first time and I will undoubtedly return.  There are tons of great vegetarian choices.  I had the lemongrass tofu and it was rich in flavor with a hearty portion.  There are at least a dozen more dishes I can't wait to try.  Yum!  I'll be back!

pFO1mucoR9bn5dJqHM6tOQ.text: I had a long debate with myself about whether I should round up or down from my TRUE rating, which is a 3.5.  There were many factors that led to the 4 stars: it's locally owned, amazing concept, and, well, the food was spectacular.    So I got the tempura shrimp tacos, and they were amazing.  I actually turned into a grandma when I bit into them and said to myself, "Oh my, is THAT GOOD!"  But it was!  The shells are chewy and golden, stuffed with crispy fried shrimp, amazingly flavorful coleslaw, and "pink gold" sauce which is very aptly named.    I ordered the squash casserole as a side, but was given the Mac and Cheese, which was totally fine; the waiter brought out the casserole too so I got both but I didn't care for it at all...the mac and cheese, however, was PHENOMENAL.  Slightly spicy, super creamy, it was like something out of a mac and cheese filled dream.  (the best kind of dream)    My only qualm was with the service.  It wasn't bad, not at all.  Our waiter was super attentive and came over many times to check on/chat with us.  Maybe...a little TOO many times.  He was a really sweet dude but it was honestly one of the most awkward experiences I've ever had in a restaurant.  Right after we got our food he walked over, stared at the table, and walked away again without saying a word, and later came over to ask us if we wanted to try the flavored water...after we had already finished our meal.  He also told us a few non-sequitur stories and then recommended a BBQ restaurant in Ballantyne without actually telling us it's name.  He was so sweet, though, so I feel kind of like a monster for saying anything, but I get extremely uncomfortable when strangers talk to me like, in the middle of the day, when I haven't been drinking.  I stammer and can't make eye contact and start to get red-faced and sweaty and it's just not a good look.  But other than that, my Krazy Fish experience was great, and I'll be back for sure.    And you should go.  They're really nice there.

W3t9YjE7ZBC4V05w5V0TaA.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to to Krazy Fish in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. We arrived a little before noon on Good Friday and waited a few minutes to be greeted and seated. The first thing we noticed was the eclectic interior combined with junk art throughout the restaurant, and the musty smell was a turn off. At the waiter's suggestion, we shared the Neptune Platter which included fried fish, shrimp, calamari, scallops, and vegetables and also served with Krazy slaw, Mac n Cheese (our choice) and cornbread. Nuoc Cham (at least, that's what we think it was?) and wasabi tartar dipping sauces were provided.  I don't believe there is any way one person could have eaten this entire meal. It was huge. The fish was tender, the calamari crispy, and the fried vegetables were perfectly cooked with just the right amount of bite, the highlight of the dish. The two negatives of this dish were the Krazy slaw and the cornbread. The slaw had an unidentifiable spice and a "pickled" flavor which made it almost uneatable and the cornbread was very dry. Dora here. I'm not a huge fan of seafood in general, so it takes a lot to win me over. For me, the fish was a bit too fishy, and nothing on the plate really stood out or invited me to come back. Maybe I might've liked the grilled platter more.  I would rate this establishment 3 forks out of 5 for a family friendly restaurant serving good

It's strange and eclectic and looks confusing but go in and give it a try you will not regret it. The service is always great as well.

OMZZWmaSRykE-pqL4uA87w.text: Although the food wasn't bad. The service was not acceptable. Once we were seated it took forever for the server to come get our drink order. And once he did come it took 30 minutes for the drinks to come out and an hour for the food. And on top of that,we had to ask the waiter for our bill after waiting 25 minutes for it! Would not recommend this place.

Rm3DoTs_O3P3Tt0Hz7PA2Q.text: I enjoyed the food and service at Krazy Fish. The staff was attentive and friendly. I dined with four other coworkers around 4:00. We all experienced different meals. All who added the grits as a side were pleased. The wings were flavorful and the portion was large. The shrimp taco was delightfully flavored. I will keep the place on rotation!

8QTkAIilACk00IXrVWSNwQ.text: Let me start off saying that the service at this place was great, which saddens me to give this review, but the food had absolutely no flavor... I got fried scallops, mac and cheese, with the coleslaw; I actually sent back the mac and cheese for the roasted potatoes because it tasted like it came out the box... The roasted potatoes wasn't no better, they were inedible due to the amount of salt! My boyfriend got the seafood creole, and it was also bland... The seafood did taste very fresh, but it was just not seasoned properly. I would not recommend going here because you will be disappointed...

qztME7FTUhD_2iMSHym1xQ.text: Let me preface this by saying the Ceviche Hard Tacos that I ordered weren't half bad. Though I'm a firm believer that hard taco shells should be reserved for late night trips to Taco Bell or for taco night at home with the kids, I applaud Krazy Fish's decision to serve its Ceviche Taco in a hard shell, since ceviche is normally eaten with tortilla chips. The taco is a good idea, but could be executed better.  The shell wasn't made fresh and might even have been store bought and reheated.  It tasted a little too done, just shy of burnt.  The civeche was basically lime marinaded white fish; good, but nothing special. It was served with a creamy avacado/cilantro-based sauce which was quite nice..but I would have preferred some fresh avocado and cilantro in the taco.   The plate cost just under $9 and came with two tacos and one side. I ordered Corn Maque Chou, which I often make at home during the summer when fresh corn is plentiful.  What I got seemed more like canned corn with some chopped green bell pepper thrown in.    I would have loved to try another taco, but I was told they don't mix and match.  The server told me I could order individual tacos for a little bit more, but considering each taco plate cost between $8 and $10, I figured $5 was too much to pay for a taco without knowing whether it was going to be any good or not.   Overall, the food was good enough that I would be willing to return and try one of the other tacos on the menu.  The Szechuan Salmon Tacos sounded interesting.    My biggest beef was with the servers.  I dropped in early on a Friday night, before the crowd arrived.  I'm pretty sure I was one of maybe 5 customers in the entire restaurant.  So all the servers were killing time before the rush.  But they were having loud conversations about drinking and being hung over and throwing up...and these weren't college kids, but adults. (I would assume by appearance, each was hovering around the late 30's or 40's) Now, Krazy Fish isn't fine dining by any stretch, but I expect employees to act professional..even in a dive.  If you are craving a fish taco in Charlotte, do yourself a favor and hit up the vastly superior Cabo Fish Taco in NoDa.

0EUEeElabPoHrWRTM9ugNg.text: So I give our variety of stars.  Mine blackened Mahi special was 2.5 stars.  My husband had the tacos Blacked mahi 4 stars. Salmon and grouper tacos 4.5 -5 stars.  Excellent service and fun atmosphere.

Yq8crQWPxig-fWu5uOAbZA.text: After realizing they were shown in DDD, I've been wanting to give this place a try since I pasted by it several times! Always support local businesses right? (: Called in before ahead for a group of 7, and right when we walked in they already got our table ready! I actually love all the KRAZY decor lol! Started off with the hibiscus drink, it was slightly sweet/salty to my liking. I ordered the blackened mahi tacos & the jalapeno grits(because of all the rave), the mahi was a bit dry and the taco was wayy too overloaded. I tried the salmon taco & it was too salty & over sauced. I also had a bit of the shrimp & grits, it was good everything on it looked really fresh. Buuuut the GRITS though, LOVE! The consistency, flavor, and texture was all perfect. Our server was amazing as well! Service was phenomenal, he was attentive to all our needs & genuine. Overall I feel like whenever I'm in the mood for tacos, Cabo would be the place to hit but I will come back for the banging grits & awesome service !

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blacken Mahi Taco

E75eb2nqwbBIkHIpu_EFpQ.text: Food was pretty good for the price the ambiance is a little low rent but I guess that makes the place trendy. Had the shrimp po'boy and was pleasantly surprised by its great and fresh taste. Particularly I was impressed with the dip (not sure of the name) that comes with the bread and mussels it has a good Cajun kick to it I definitely recommend this place for an inexpensive tasty dining experience.

-NuJeHNyoWCaCofJ-prfDQ.text: Tried this gem tonight after long debate whether I wanted sushi or fish. Boy am I glad I chose fish! The location was decent, on Central Avenue right before it gets "questionable". It was Halloween night and not busy at all..which was fine with me!   When I first saw the building, I noticed the eclectic art surrounding the patio. This art continued as I entered, and was filled throughout the restaurant. It was interesting, because the art looked like it was made up of reclaimed items. Some of which included a mermaid, flamingo, and sailfish. This style wouldn't normally work in any space, but for some reason looked great here and was very inviting!  As I entered, I was greeted right away and then seated. I was given water and asked what else I would be drinking. Unfortunately, I declined since I would be drinking later since it was Halloween! I noticed the menu had a lot of great options, but nothing relatively healthy like I wanted. I was okay with this since it is a Southern style restaurant and "heathy" is sometimes hard to come by. I ended up getting the Southern Fried Shrimp Roti with a side of roasted potatoes. I chose this entree because I am in love with shrimp and the Jamaican curry sauce sounded amazing (yellow curry with peppers, onions, and pumpkin)!   When I received my food, I realized that my eyes were bigger than my stomach. It was so much food and didn't think I could even make a dent in it. While enjoying my meal, the waiter filled my water several times and was very attentive. I thought he did a great job at making me feel comfortable, without coming around too often. As for the food, it was absolutely amazing! it was definitely Southern style and seasoned well done. Great, but not somewhere I could eat all the time, just when I need some comfort food..which is actually far too often. I ended up eating half of my food, and got a box for the rest (I love when this happens).  As I was leaving, I saw a poster with Guy Fryer's face on it. I absolutely love his show and couldn't believe he also tried this restaurant! I wondered what he ate, and I got the idea to google it later when I got home. Story of my life!

XesMBdSUr1ldXY2wCtyb4A.text: If you like fried food you might enjoy this place. For me...not so much. Covered up flavor with salt.   The gumbo was subpar.  The only highlights: the ceviche was pretty good, alike most places, they give you a large portion but it is only white fish so, cheap and middle of the road on flavor. The potato pancakes where really unique and tasty.

gOnMBNR1Saat6H-YE9HCWg.text: I love me some Krazy Fish. It's on my list of places I recommend when friends want to grab a bite or folks are visiting from out of town. It's also one of my go to's for margaritas and happy hour.  I love happy hour here. Half off tacos from 4-6pm M-F = $5 for two tacos and a side!  Tacos are definitely my go to entree here with the Southern Fried Fish option at the top of my list (I usually ask for it blackened instead of fried, unless I'm feeling Southern). I've tried all the other tacos that have seafood in it and am also a fan of the Szechuan Salmon. I'm not a huge fan of the sweet sauces on some of the other tacos (chutney or fruit salsas) because I'm partial to fish tacos being as close to Baja authentic as possible, but that's a personal preference thing.   I've also tried the roti here which is tasty, but not what I was expecting. If you're thinking Indian roti or roti Canai, which I was, it's not that. It's more of a wrap/burrito with a lot of rice and curry (if you choose that). Too starchy for me.   The seafood creole is also tasty and they don't skimp on the seafood either! Fried fish, shrimp, calamari, and scallop over rice in a cajun-style marinara. With a giant chunk of cornbread plopped on the side. And a side. This one is too rich for my blood, but if you've got a hearty appetite, have at it!  In appetizer land, the shrimp curry is my fave - potato cakes and fried shrimp paired with curry is so delicious.  They have a full bar which is real nice because that's where they make their yummy margaritas. After my last class for the last degree I'm ever getting (maybe), my classmates and I went straight to Krazy Fish and drank margaritas. Lots of margaritas. It was a glorious moment. The waitress just kept bringing them!  The wait staff is always so friendly - and knowledgeable about their vast menu. Water cups are always filled, other beverages are always inquired upon, and they're always so quick to bring me sriracha (v. important).  The decor is eclectic and it's located on a random part of Central Ave, so be on the look out when you're headed there. And you should head there, because who doesn't like a flavor blast in their mouth?

2UrPf6esFFtCeH92fv9H3Q.text: Love the atmosphere.  The best item was the fried mac n cheese hamburger.  Fried fish was just ok.

G3I4f8_YEvAUQi6ly6FNDw.text: This was my first time at a Guy Fieri spot (from DDD!) and it did not disappoint.  Chuckled as we pulled into the artfishly decorated parking lot and knew it was going to be a fun spot from the start.  They easily accommodated our group of 8 and the staff were so helpful and friendly, even making us feel comfortable about the new grandbaby that was with us.  So on to the food, we tried the coconut shrimp and shrimp curry appetizers, and both were tasty, though the curry was sweet as opposed to the spicy I was expecting. I got the bulgogi roti with red curry sauce and cactus salad (it was so fresh and delicious, definitely try this).  I would love to come back to try their other unique menu items.  Definitely get the bananas foster cheesecake too!  I don't even like bananas, but it was so good.  Tasted like eating banana pudding!

uNta05dh3-S-POGiUdapWA.text: Oh geez....can't believe I just discovered this place!!! Came here Friday for lunch. Flavor explosion!  My husband and I got $1 beers!  I ordered the Schezwan Salmon tacos with the Squash casserole and my husband ordered the Southern pulled pork with BBQ and blueberry sauce with the japapeno grits for a side. Now, even though I am Southern through and through, I have never been a grits fan. These grits completely changed my outlook.....holy amazing!!! I actually ate most of my husband's when he wasn't looking! The salmon tacos were crazy flavorful and the blueberry sauce for the BBQ tacos was amazing!  Great experience and will definitely be back.  The waiter said that on Sundays they have complimentary mimosas......may need to check that one out! :)

iklpkmO1rll1rOXFh6GNhQ.text: It was o.k.... worth a try.
