K_3ZkAbGeCNSsFmClMhoZQ.text: Employee used our Groupon incorrectly which cost us money. Then I found a piece of bone in my pulled pork tacos. Not the same service and food they used to have!

berjoCVJ6mRKkZYhfgcLoQ.text: I've been driving by this place for a while now, but I just haven't had the chance to try it out. So I came here with a friend and looked up their menu online and decided to give them a chance. First thing that comes to mind when I came here and saw their menu was that it was absolutely Krazy.  Krazy Fish is a Southwestern Asian Fusion restaurant, at least that's how I would describe it. What surprised me was that even the menu had Pho, which is absolutely nuts to me. I ordered their bulgogi sandwich, excited to see when it was brought out that it was hearty and full.   Sadly, even though the decorations were pretty and it was very creative inside, the food was a little bit of a let down. However, there was a nice twist on the mac and cheese as a side (I'll give you the details, it wasn't cheddar cheese they used instead it was a nice pepper jack cheese which actually gave the normal mac n cheese a punch!)   The bulgogi sandwich was a little let down I must say though. The bulgogi didn't really have that bulgogi taste I was so used to at korean restaurants, however if they did marinate it right and had that kick and sauce pouring from that sandwich it would be awesome! I think I give them a thumbs up on knowing the path to take to make that sandwich awesome, however they missed it on the flavor. The beef tasted like just beef that was cooked, no where near bulgogi flavored beef.   The Chipotle beef taco was supposed to be their version of the bulgogi taco (at least that's what they said) and it was yet again a let down. My friend and I also got the side item cactus salad, which was I don't know a little wild. It had a slimy texture and well it tasted a little exotic nonetheless. But, back to the topic of the taco. It was just beef with  chipotle sauce on top. This place is definitely a place to eat and have tacos as a side item, so I guess coming in here for lunch was a little off.  Overall, I thought it wasn't too bad. They're almost there though, with that bulgogi sandwich. I'll definitely come back here and see if they change anything before I say anything. Without a doubt I think this place is a great place to drink though, and if I don't come back for lunch at least I'll come back for tacos and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bulgogi sandwich
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chipotle beef taco
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Another hanging decoration

BOTC9xKrZyi5nI3fh_FDxA.text: I really don't know how to even review this place. There are so many choices from every different ethnic background. There is also something called "Krazy Sauce" that seems to be on just about every item.  The inside is nuts. I really can't describe it properly. It is cheesy and themed.   I love it.  The grits are absolutely incredible. They are jalapeno grits. omg.  I did not see the banana pudding from fat city- but I really hope it does make an appearance.   The beers are way over priced though.

njEV_aZ9CItHQ6MX2hvykA.text: I'm going to give them 4 stars because our server, while a little awkward, tried really hard to make sure we were happy.  It was a little hard for me to select an entree here because everything, and I mean everything, seems to either be spicy or loaded with cilantro.  Two of my biggest dining foes.    I ended up with the fried calamari roti (burrito) with whichever was the lightest spiced curry.  I forgot to mention the cilantro thing at first and so after we ordered I remembered and got our servers attention.  He took care of it right away and my food did come out cilantro free, phew!  I also had the squash casserole and side salad because I was told the mac-n-cheese was even spicy, made with a queso sauce.  Sides were okay, I did try my sistersmac and while yes it did have a kick, I found it pretty tolerable and very yummy!  Brownie in an orange was weird and the orange flavor on everything was a bit much for me.  But it wasn't bad.  Overall this might not be a place suited to my tastes, but I appreciate what they are doing and I wish them success!

D6K5cvJ4Hrf3OZM9ocv_iQ.text: Anything they say is vegan is not! Everything has fish oil, or oil that has been used to fry fish. There is a lot of cross contamination, and some of their employees are not being paid properly.

Rm-nJfpJQhMBfMa_ODFMYw.text: Get over the decor - it was unique and fun. My wife and I plus a friend had lunch at "The Kraze" today. Great service (I think everyone in the place checked on us) and fantastic food. Texture, color, flavor - everything rocked. I had Cajun Carbonara - shrimp and pork w/ penne - my wife enjoyed the Shrimp & Grits and our friend had a LARGE beef sandwich with fresh jalapenos and sides. We all shared bites and found it all to be exceptional. The bill for all three of us was $36.  We will be spreading the word and we will be back often. You are our new favorite.

Oacy9GsAbym6y13nTNtWvw.text: My birthday is in September. September 6th, to be exact. I've been hunting around for a great place to have it, and so far, this is at the top of my list. In fact, Krazy Fish is at the top of my list in North Carolina for:  1.) Best Tacos I've Ever Had 2.) Most Unique Atmosphere 3.) Most Friendly/Laid-Back Staff 4.) Best Food Fo'Yo'Moneh   FOOD: I'm serious about the tacos, dude. Had them tempura-calamari-wise, and tempura-shrimp-wise. Seriously deliciouso. Not just good seafood, but the tacos come with their krazy slaw, and while I'm not sure exactly what's in it, I assure you it is tangy and delicious. Also, you get you choice of unique sauces to top your tacos. So far, everything I've tried is amazing, though my favorite is the Pink Gold sauce. One of the best things is actually the taco shell... soft, flour or corn tortillas that are fried until they're all puffy and crispy and flavorful and delicious... the entire thing truly is a symphony in your mouth.  SERVICE: Seriously great. Very laid back, and when I leave, I feel like I've made friends. KC is loud and hilarious, sitting down with you and telling you about future plans for the restaurant, and future concoctions. I can't wait to go back to try his shrimp cocktail gazpacho.   ATMOSPHERE: Krazy. No seriously, I have no idea how they made the little decorations for that place or why, but somehow it works. Apparently there are also plans for the patio out front, and it's still under construction. If they put in some corn hole/ping pong/whatever, they'd complete a gold mine. Hopefully those plans are already in the works.  PRICE: One'o my favorite things about this place... seriously great pricing. Two culinary exquisite and heaping tacos with a generous side for under $8? Sick, dude.   I highly recommend this place. Catch me there in the future for my tentative yelpy birthday, unless I find someplace better (but I really doubt I will!)

YJksjpvn0ZPZHUQzM6DJLg.text: Went back again and had great service and food. We tried different menu items and left satisfied again.

svRv7NRoBBPmDQrC_tFB5g.text: Love the employee that was on Bad Grandpa... Hilarious!! I figured the place for a jersey shore sh*tty place to eat or dance club... Guess not

8Elo5ZT6flLMmAMMZQDzTg.text: Krazy Fish is a very interesting place.  When you drive up the outside kind of looks like a dive bar, with an outdoor patio and the krazy fish sign prompting you to get "krazy."  It kind of looks like a strange garage sale inside.  Then the menu comes and you are astounded by the unique mish mash of items that are just as strange as the place.  Basically, Krazy Fish lives up to its name - everything from the locale, the building, interior, menu and staff is kind of crazy.  The fun part about crazy is it isn't boring, and the food here was the most exciting I have had in awhile.  Most items on the menu have strange fruity/spicy sauce concoctions.  Scanning through the offerings I noticed a lot of seafood options, vegetarian, asian, BBQ.  All over the place!  They were offering a restaurant week special the night we were there.  4 courses for 2 PEOPLE for $30.  Given the amount of food we got that was a phenomenal deal.  Started with the ceviche with tortilla chips.  It was amazing and I was full after that.  BUT there was more.  Amazing Korean BBQ tacos with a side of beans.  Very tender huge plate of ribs with a blueberry habanero (I think) sauce, potato salad and some flavorful green beans.  Finished off the meal with a bananas foster that was surrounded by Nilla Wafers.  Wow.  I could not get any more satiated.  The owner or manager came by a couple of times and was very friendly - you could tell both he and the waiter were excited to see us and enthusiastic about their food.  It was a Monday night and was pretty sparse in terms of patrons, so we got some nice personalized service and two handshakes on the way out.  A place the adventurous, or moderately adventurous should definitely try!

fuICKTzCSCnkkuOdjfnIUQ.text: My wife & I are are always excited trying new places where sometimes a star and other times a dude.    Krazy Fish was a big disappointment.  My wife got the fish fry and with four of us at the table none of us thought the broccoli casserole they brought as a side even was identifiable as such.  Her mac & cheese side tasted like it came straight out of a Kraft box (Kraft is better).  Our queso appetizer was unimpressive as well as my shrimp & grits.  We could not complain about the service thou.  We had a cute & bubbly teenage waitress who very friendly and stopped by often to ask if everything was OK.  The food quality just was not there.

acJrIFAKlwMiUZUdBRsPUw.text: Anothe great visit to the Krazy Fish- this time my first for brunch.  The brunch menu was nice, albeit a bit small.  One perk- all brunch dishes come with a mimosa.  We decided not to go that route and ordered crab cakes as an app, shrimp and grits as an entree and szechuan salmon tacos for entree.  All good as usual. Service was great and friendly.  Krazy Fish is a hidden gem- great food, great prices and an interesting environment that is definitely not too sterile or bland!

eSFrTUpL8n6ydnOn6fpiBQ.text: With so many reviews, my approach is very simple. I love KrazyFish!  Why?  Top Shelf cocktails (i.e. house tequila is Lunazul , which is a 100% agave tequila) Half price tacos EVERY DAY 4pm - 6pm (about 10 different tacos to choose from) Fresh Seafood Down Home Comfort Food for those who need to fill "full" Daily Specials Locally Owned Best Shrimp Po Boy I've ever had (even in New Orleans)

593AnJlIAvOLEXeyxyoA2A.text: Awesome food. Vegetarian delight. They have mixed and matched different ethic food to create mouth watering dishes. Definitely recommend for people who are visiting or locals to try this place. The decor is unique, music is mostly 80s and this place rocks !

sIn3S3KL9RtEQa-8Nh9SZQ.text: The group just went back and OMG    Even though it was Cinco De Mayo    they handled our party of 22 like PROS ! ! !      THE Food was fresh hot and served in a very timely manner ! ! !    words dont explain how great this place is ! ! !    GREAT FOOD GREAT STAFF,,,    Very attentive,     Pulled tacos  with the  bbq sauce with blue berry is off the chain excellent !  I highly recommend the  Potato cake app with Jamaican sauce  to make this a meal beg to have  your favorite meat put on top ! !  !

Jf-b75XX-yHPs_wxwsM_gQ.text: Hidden gem. Great, quirky service. Good specials. Great specials. Not stuffy hip joint. Eat their food and drink their drinks, you wont be disappointed.

yJNbKVGBreQ_EeawK1NhQg.text: The food is very different from most places in the area and a very strange combination of Indian food and southern and seafood. That being said my first time here was pretty good. Had the spicy potato cake roti and it was ok but I think I may have made a bad choice with the creole sauce on it. But the staff is great and very friendly!!!  I am vegetarian and the staff is extremely helpful!Would definitely recommend to someone looking for something different to try!!

D8K60f7dkyR-irisUSTSfQ.text: Krazy Fish is a pretty good local restaurant with great patrons. I feel like every time I go there the menu is changed somehow. I am a big fan of the fried chicken tacos with pink gold sauce (if they even have that variety anymore). I've had their chicken bolillos but that could've quite possibly been pulled from the menu and if so I won't be missing it. The beans are great and I always get that as a side. This place has a great atmosphere and the people are very friendly. There decor is sort of kitchy meets junkyard and this is one place where it's easy to strike up a conversation at the bar. The half priced taco deal is not bad from 4-6. The drinks are pretty good.

frRq4NKp3r-1IwMp2k8P-Q.text: The atmosphere is very relaxing. I tried the bulgogi tacos and the po boy. They are very generous with their portions. The macaroni and cheese was delicious and is a must have. The bulgogi tacos were good, although it lacked the bulgogi taste, but the taco shells were amazing. I also had their po' boy, but the sauce for it tasted a little bit funny. I would most definitely return to Krazy Fish to try out their diverse menu of fusion cuisine.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bulgogi tacos, po&#39; boy, bulgogi sandwich

I462jUzg79tA-GTuwTr36w.text: My family and I went to Krazy Fish based off of other Yelp reviews. It was not a good choice. No one greeted us when we walked in, even though there were two employees right in front of on the computer both looking down. Then they both walked away and another person came up and told us it is going to be a 15-20 minute wait, then walked away. We were seated outside, no one asked us if we wanted to be seated inside or outside,but we sat down. NO ONE ever came to our table. We were seated in a corner then the table next to us was seated about 15 minutes after we were. A server came to their table and got them waters. Then another server came and started taking their order. Still no one has come to even greet us. I went inside to ask why no one has come to talk to us and I was told he was coming. It was busy in there but there were at least 8 servers for a restaurant that is by no means large. It was not more than servers who know how to do their jobs could handle. No one came to talk to us, so we left. The food on the menu looked good but we will NEVER return to check it out.

DI4qn9W-NzF-osbBHfnx8g.text: Been to Krazy Fish three times now and it has never disappointed!  The staff is funny and super helpful, drinks plentiful, and most important the food is great.  So glad they're in the neighborhood.

Vhqe8n1J-SM5ym2m8RsQBw.text: Krazy is quite right. An eclectic mix of Spanish food with Japanese ingredients molded together with an American twist. This place is quite interesting with it's decor, food and beer.  When it comes to the quality of the food though, I can't really say I was  wooed. Shrimp wrap was just okay, ceviche was just okay, and fish tacos were just okay.   On the up side, they offer a few cool local NC beers, and the staff is friendly and attentive. Funky fresh, check it out for yourself folks!

y5fT1XQh_0y8BQcKGzWkHQ.text: We stopped by on our way home from an event. I've been wanting to try them for a while, after hearing some many great reviews about them. The reviews did not lie.  My wife and I order apps. and based on the waitress suggestion we got seafood creole platter and shared it. It was so good and so filling. Everything we had that night was great. The service was awesome. We look forward to going back .

RwOuauO7xQgbLZxsuYBn2Q.text: Really good customer service you don't have to wait a long time to be seated and all the staff get along very good very happy people clean toilet very clean the cleanest one I've ever seen better than the one at home if you came here from the beach area this place will make you feel like you're at home

aOiR52a05QiwXPyZf3EIfA.text: The food was amazing..the menu has a great variety of entrees to choose from with very unique styled tacos..I would almost rate this restaurant as top places to visits for tacos however their customer service is not up to par. My husband and I were seated at a table next to the door during a breezy fall evening... I took it upon myself to move our seats to someone less drafty and then we still waited for almost 20 more minutes until some acknowledged us...  Although i loved the food, the service has caused me to not come back...

fdanoOs9dmJZGm1eRHBo3w.text: The food was good but I just had too much fried fish, so I got tired of the taste. I will try it again though and order something that is grilled.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Party of four came in for a late lunch. We had civiche and calamari as an appetizer and they were great.

20Q5p39voZ7fbbH6sZohnw.text: If you find yourself heading to Zada Jane's for brunch our suggestion is you keep driving and go down to this place! You will get just as of good food cheaper and quicker. A lot of people forget about good old Krazy Fish and when I drag them over there we always get the same reaction, "I always forget about this place"! Also don't think they just have fish they have one of the largest selections of tacos out there from tofu, to BBQ, and of course some great seafood ones. One of the last reasonable price places in this area which is an extra bonus. We went to their brunch for the first time and have to say they have a solid selection of choices we got the huevos rancheros and the biscuits and gravy which were both good and they have $4 mimosas, bellinis, and bloody Mary's on Sunday's which if you are there after noon you should totally get.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and gravy, potatoes, side a bacon on top and their huevos rancheros on the bottom.

edF4F7UqMyk1oqZQ1ZYSBA.text: Cute dive-taco bar with cheap drinks, food with quick service, and fast seating. Should you dress up? I wouldn't. Ambiance is extremely casual (I'm talking t-shirt and shorts) with fish themed figurines hanging from the ceiling with wooden booths for seating.  Happy hour is not an option on the weekend, but the prices are still cheap at $4 a taco that it's not a necessity. You can mix and match as well if you're not feeling two of the same. We enjoyed the salmon, southern fish, popcorn shrimp, and the blackened mahi pictured below. Would reorder the shrimp and the salmon, the fish and mahi was average and didn't "wow" us.   Calamari was a served in a generous portion as well paired with a more mild yet tasty marinara sauce. We accompanied our meal with the house margaritas at only $6, which makes it an easy decision.  Overall, would be back for a casual, cheap yummy dinner with some fresh tacos, chill vibe, and affordable drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Calamari - would reorder! Generous portion
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top to bottom: Popcorn (4/5), Southern Fish (2/5), Salmon (4/5), Mahi (3/5) - $4 each

Eokyey44Vvg31W1QanYZtQ.text: My fiance ordered the shrimp and grits.  I must say the pictures made that dish look amazing.  However, the real outcome was less than pleasurable.  The entire dish lacked flavor.  I admire their efforts in the attempt, but hands down sadly a diner (midnight diner) has them beat by a long shot when it comes to the shrimp and grits.  Would not recommend this dish.    I ordered the seafood creole, a rather large portion which I am not complaning about.  However, it saddens me that this dish disappointed me.   I was super excited to try it, again, due to the pictures online.   Definitely better then the Shrimp and grits, but even still lacking True flavor.  The blandness and sogginess of the fried fish make me gag.  I was hoping this would be my go to seafood restaurant here in Charlotte, unfortunately, I must keep searching. But the service was amazing.  Kudos to the server!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

LwPFtCLrjop552EIBHPBcQ.text: We decided to get a quick bite before going to an event in uptown. I was really looking forward to some tacos and heard their selection of salsa was the best.   Honestly, the food was amazing but all I really wanted was grilled shrimp tacos (not friend/beer battered style) and they couldn't do that nor was it on their menu.

rP8XIlUUiXLm2WAl7e8rnA.text: We were pretty excited to check this place out after seeing it on Food Network. The building is really cool looking and has a very eclectic style throughout. It was freezing inside and multiple customers ate wearing jackets.  We were disappointed that they only offered three beers on draft, all local craft which is awesome, but all very similar beers. We ordered a couple of bottles instead.   We ordered the mussels and potato cakes for an appetizer, both were awesome. We also ordered the southern fried fish tacos and the Buffalo shrimp tacos. The buffalo shrimp was flavorful but the shrimp were slimy. The southern fried fish tacos had very little flavor. We requested a sauce to go with it--the lime tartar sauce and that really helped. Lastly, we ordered the fried cheesecake which was good.  Overall, the food was good with the exception of the tacos. Between feeling slimy and having no taste we were pretty disappointed. The service was mediocre. Unfortunately, we probably wouldn't go back. Worth trying once for sure.

mqTSC_G9U6OtsSx2syX7eg.text: Sure looks crazy on the outside but best believe the food is crazy good on the inside...GREAT service lots of food and prices are very ressonable. You will definitely get your money's worth

wBajTHg7yq_Zw0XTKESjRg.text: This place is well deserving of 10 stars. Jason our server took exceptional care describing all of the specials in complete detail making each dish sound utterly amazing. It was a difficult choice but we settled on the Diablo and the Neptune platter. Everything was plentiful with bold vibrant flavors. Food Network even did a special on this unique hidden gem.   Defiantly will be back to try the ice-cream and Gumbo, heck everything on the menu. A must try place if passing through Charlotte. Everyone there was friendly and takes pride and passion in the food and presentation. So much to say as words cannot describe how exceptional the selection is just read the menu and you'll see what I'm talking about.  Beware highly addictive fun place to eat drink and spoil yourself.   Note to Owner - If you plan on expanding we want in....

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Creole
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our new amazing food spot.
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Neptune platter with jalapeño grits.

5hga8hUmntc7boNkjmgszQ.text: Probably one of the best restaurant experiences I have ever had. Food was way beyond expectations and so was the service. Absolutely amazing! We will be back anytime we visit Charlotte.

TpWhDj8FLUWlL3TDL7SLdQ.text: Just came back and was disappointed. My sister in law found a fly In her grits and they weren't nice about It. Although they replaced the grits (fly free) she couldn't eat it. We felt they should have given her meal for free.  It would have made a happy Customer. Instead it left the Four of Us extremely unhappy and we will Not be back.

H3N_fV_MWOslgViuB72z6g.text: Great spot for Sunday Brunch.  Thai iced coffee was a great way to start.  I ordered the Biscuits and gravy and it didn't disappoint.  Biscuits were light and flaky.  Gravy was rich with a nice flavor.  Eggs were cooked perfectly.  The Jalapeno cheese grits were a hit as well.  My wife had the Huevos rancheros.  The presentation was excellent and she said they were tasty and very filling!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

zD6UfSH_bHRCeXsE1YgxrQ.text: This food was so delicious!!! The server was very accommodating of my gluten allergy and was able to give me corn tortillas for my pulled pork tacos and mussels without bread. The mussels and pulled pork tacos were absolutely incredible. The gumbo and the jalapeno grits were not gluten free but my boyfriend got both of these foods and loved them. Wine was very cheap ($20 a bottle) which was great as well. The service was great and the atmosphere was fun. Would highly recommend this restaurant!

xAHnQmtzU82qVMs1nBU1XA.text: The mussels in green curry are enough to keep me coming back. Most dishes have some solid heat to them. The seafood diablo is equally good if not better as a leftover the next day for lunch, call me crazy.   The atmosphere here is quite unique but is very fun to be around with all the trinkets in the restaurant

cR94nM8cD9hSQ0ZZuoniAw.text: Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. Came in and had a seat at the bar. The bartender, with an amazing mustache, gave us great food suggestions. We have the mussels, Mahi tacos, and shrimp and grits. All were great with exceptional flavor. That mussel sauce...mmmhmmmm

AvfC_-dAIXY60jfSqGVfBw.text: I had a nice time!! Food was absolutely AMAZING....our server AMY was a sweetheart! We will be back!!!

zOrajjKXyyAO7HTwunGrpA.text: The service itself was worthy of 5 stars!  Sherry was just delightful.  Very impressed when she offered my husband a sample of the dish he thought of ordering.  As for mine, fried pallack &mac n cheese, I was very unimpressed.  The fish was  greasy and "airy" so it fell apart, necessitating me to use my fingers.  The cornbread should have been called "dirty bread" as it had extra seasoning (breadcrumbs or poppy seeds) sprinkled on top.  The mac n cheese tasted like it was smoked. Im a very simple eater and went with what I would consider a safe basic choice.  I probably wont go back, but my husband enjoyed his meal(s)!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

6tCyY28jMK7yl_wBg2grFg.text: Confession - watching the episode of Diners Drive-Ins and Dives that features Krazy Fish has been on my to do list since our first visit. Also trying their tacos but I just haven't gotten around to either yet.   Why do I love it here?   First - it is so kitschy and I adore it. I naturally find my eyes wander to take everything in when we visit. I feel like every time there is a new surprise based on a different seat. Floating mermaid? Blowfish? Check. Of all the places I have visited in Charlotte I would safely say this has the most unique decor.   Second - the service. We have always had the most friendly wait staff. Last time I was eagerly and hungrily watching as our waiter went by with everyone else's food. He eventually stopped off to let me know our food was next (in a joking good humored way) and took the opportunity to see if we wanted more drinks. Even though we don't go often since it is on the other side of town it just has this amazing neighborhood feel to it.  Third - maybe the most important. The food. Is. Amazing. Everything we have tried has been delicious. If you order one of their entrees it will quite possibly be more food than you can eat in one sitting. I can attest to never actually finishing a meal there, which means leftovers and I can enjoy it twice! Except the one time we were going out afterward and I had to leave behind such delicious food and my heart broke a little.   Fourth - the price. It can be super affordable if you go for a roti with a side which comes to $8 on average. My favorite dish, the seafood diablo, is pricy at $17 BUT comes with more seafood than you would expect. Sure there is a good portion of generic white fish in it but it is also chock full of lobster and mini scallops. Oh and it comes with a ginormous salad to start. So as far as getting a bang for your buck I would say even the entrees are a good deal.  Honorable mentions - the Thai green curry mussels are a must try if that's your thing. Huge appetizer portion with tons of bread! The cheesy jalapeno girts - my boyfriend doesn't like grits but went with the waiter's recommendation to get them as a side. He now absolutely gushes about the grits there.

biJ12HhFKotVVpkZMVcxXw.text: Winter it the time for a soup and I was so disappointed I missed the She Crab, and the Lobster Bisque. The lobster bisque is better than any I have had any where, So, the offering was MUSHROOM...........UGHH. MUshROom???  MY Hubby ordered a bowl." I don't care for mushroom soup, but can I taste yours?"  OMG.  I ordered a bowl straight  away.  My taste buds were addicted!  I came back the next day for a bowl for lunch, and had a  To Go for lunch on Monday! A friend just called and suggested we go somewhere to grab a bite, and I'm thinking  MUSHROOM SOUP @ KrAzY fISh!!!!!!! SOOO GOOD.  I had a Roti with southern fried fish and Red Thai sauce that was so flavorful and filling..   Lagniappe  was when Gorgio let us try a new menu Item, Spicy  Chicken Sausage Tacos. Nicet amount of heat,  a little side of habanero apple butter makes it just right!

2tNmH5h9l0e_v9l6cD_1QQ.text: This is one of my favorite spots in plaza Midwood.   Never have I been let down by their food or service.     Their specials are always great and when I want to get my fried fish on I can think of no other place I'd choose in this city!!!  Margaritas are awesome too!

_k7ep4uFiHRG8k2lQVX3hQ.text: Outstanding selection of uniquely flavored tacos.  Additionally the mussels were as good as we have had in Charlotte.  Very reasonable prices and service was great.  Only wish we lived closer to come in more often

FQWocCLfR4dtHzAiLDBSSQ.text: My family and I LOVE this place!  We often go for Sunday brunch; however we go for dinner occasionally also.   It doesn't matter when you go because the food and service is always great.  The Thai Iced Coffee is wonderful and it's an absolute must get whenever we go.  We all love it.  The tacos are awesome and the roti is also great. Both the chips and salsa and ceviche are amazing!  For breakfast the huevos rancheros is great as is the chicken and waffles.  The restaurant itself is funky with a crazy, eclectic style.  The staff is super friendly.  We are so happy we spotted it on Diners, Drive ins, and Dives.

t54FtjBwI9UYwijZ76vjQg.text: We had the southern platter & the salmon tacos.  The southern platter was a little too much fried on 1 plate but all the favorites.  I really enjoyed the specialty sauce on the salmon tacos.  The vibe was like a Mission or Ocean Beach joint in San Diego.  Crowd was mixed from ecletic to the 60-70 set. Very casual  Only improvements - provide butter for the grits & provide cornbread or hush puppies as a bread equivalent when initially seated.

fu2aat_1a1-DJX9cFtVWFA.text: My boyfriend and I have eaten at Krazy Fish before.  Our first time to eat there was okay - not great, but it also wasn't bad.  For our second trip, we went after the first two places we were wanting to eat at had long lines.  The waitress dropped us off at our table, and then waited a few minutes to take our drink order (not exactly great).  When she came back over, we ordered the salsa trio and queso for an appetizer.  My boyfriend ordered the fried shrimp po' boy, and I ordered a fried chicken roti with the Indian curry sauce.  We both ordered macaroni and cheese as our sides.  The salsa trio was good - the verde and more "regular" salsa (can't remember the name) were great, the pineapple one was pretty good, but the queso was a little too sweet for my liking.    When we received our entrees, my boyfriend immediately removed the tomato from the sandwich.  Tomatoes are out of season, and more often than not, they don't taste great at this time of the year.  My roti was good - however, there was too much rice.  So, I ended up picking the chicken out of the wrap.    Unfortunately, the macaroni and cheese was something you would find in the deli section of a cheap grocery store - the grease was separating from the sauce.  That is not something I want to see when eating.  Near the end of my boyfriend's po' boy, the breading had separated from one of the shrimp, and he realized that they didn't de-vein the shrimp.  So, he immediately stopped eating and placed the napkin on the plate.  He also mentioned that he could not taste the remoulade sauce at all.  The waitress did not stop by once to ask how our meal was, and she never came to bring us our check.  I waited ten minutes (mind you, it was FREEZING inside the restaurant) before I got up to walk back to where she was (back by the kitchen/bar area) to hand her the card and ask for the check.  She told me to "hold on one minute." I went back to the table, where we waited for a couple of minutes for her to return.  She never checked on the couple who were eating beside us, either.  Furthermore, she had come back to the table behind ours not once but TWICE and still didn't check on us.

M4ozROcwHJN7HVlwmKinRw.text: I've driven past Krazy Fish countless times, never quite sure what type of food they served.  A couple of coworkers suggested we check out K.F. on a Tuesday after work.  Who says you have to wait until Thursday night to start your weekend?  The thing about Taco Tuesday, is well, they have half priced bottles of wine.  Every day is taco day, as the tacos are 1/2 priced 4-6 p.m.    We split the potato cakes as an appetizer.  Delish.  I loved the Jamaican yellow curry sauce it came with.  I ordered the tuna tacos with pineapple salsa and devoured every last bite.  The tuna tasted so fresh and was really complemented by the pineapple.  Oh and the best part? The flash fried taco shell.  Totally worth it. Minus one star for the swarm of flies we somehow attracted to the outdoor patio. Shower much?  Next time, I will be trying the pulled pork tacos with blueberry tamarind chutney.  Love the creativity of the menu! Great service, funky-fresh atmosphere, oh yeah, and two bottles of wine, an appetizer, and a meal for $13.  I've spent more than that at a Chick fil A!

4cyan1LQJ1dAclUib98n3w.text: Service and atmosphere was great. Food was a little blend, but enjoyable.

6kqPZlkCUf-cNwpNSp974g.text: Have been wanting to try this place for years, well Krazy Fish today was your day and you did not disappoint!  Server was quick to tend to our drinks and was very knowledgeable of the menu and was even able to talk us into the shrimp pimento cheese app.  The appetizer arrived in no lie about 60 seconds later and it was awesome! It arrived in a family size lasagna tray and the flavor was out of this world, one of the best pimento cheeses I have ever had.   For dinner the wife got the fried shrimp platter which she said was pretty good I tasted a few and thought they were pretty good as well.  When I ordered I was torn between the roti or the tacos, server talked me into tacos so I got the bulgogi tacos which were as well sooooo good.  The flavor was great and portion size was good for price.  For my side I took the multiple suggestions and went for the cheddar jalapeno grits.  Now I don't even particularly like grits but these were off the charts good.   All in all everything was so good and service was great, and even though food was delivered so quickly it might seem to have been microwave cooked it tasted way to good and noticeably fresh.  I have no complaints and there were many other items on the menu I need to venture back to try so I will be seeing you again soon Krazy Fish!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bulgogi tacos with cucumber salad and cheesy jalapeño grits....every bite was amazing!
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp pimento cheese, couldnt stop eating! Soooo good.

3bwOE2jQk5oIXqHKD8nz-g.text: This place has the best tacos, really good mac n cheese, and excellent service. Always order something on special!

6t0sNev22mcbvOB4gYVVOw.text: They don't advertise that they have a happy hour from 4-6pm where the tacos are half off, and miller lite is $1.75 per bottle.. But my girlfriend did some snooping while I was here in Charlotte for my business trip.  I have crazy greedy eyes so my mind told me to get 2 tacos. My stomach told me to stop after one plate, cause I was already full. Mind over body, and thus, of course, I had another taco.   Got their Tuna Taco priced at $9.95 and the fried shrimp one at $7.95 (then you divide that by 2). The food here is good. Yes, get the Tuna Taco, but NOT the Fried Shrimp (highly disappointed). But the highlight are the sauces; they are what makes the tacos in my opinion.   I had three of their different salsas: Salsa De Arbol, Pink Gold Salsa and Blueberry Tamarind Chutney. Pink Gold Salsa is a MUST! Ask your server to change it from anything that you would have with that. You won't be disappointed.  For 2 orders of tacos and a bottle of beer, meal came out to $14 with tip and tax. CHEAP!

hYbD-WuknW9BK2P78WSfLQ.text: Delicious! The salmon tacos were the hit. Spicy potato tacos and roti were also amazing. Great place and good service!

wgNkulvCv8va9GJC59ww8Q.text: Ken Foust here, The food here is the best.  I eat at other comparably priced establishments and, frankly, I have been surprised at how much more complex the dishes are @ Krazy Fish.  They have treated me so well as I live nearby.  Do pass up the opportunity to experience their Krazy Kuisine..

5AxLkXA4ZW0GYaxybrxcKw.text: Krazy Fish is one of my favorite spots in Charlotte. It is a bit further down Central Ave than the other hot spots in that neighborhood - which is great because it makes parking much easier.   The food is great (and cheap!), the drinks are great, the servers are laid back and efficient....no complaints! Every time I've gone here I have had a great experience.  And I believe you get a % off your next bill on every receipt which is a bonus if you can remember to keep up with your old receipts!

3hLRDXi7kGPPvOEJBfW9kA.text: Love this place.  Cool vibe, great menu variety, friendly staff and most importantly awesome food!  Really liked the shrimp tacos and roti. Cuban sandwich is another great entree. They have a nice bar with a bunch of Margarita choices and the mystery $1 beer.

0MSqgM5aYYMrsgGRvdemOg.text: Last Sunday my Dan and I revisited here for their Sunday fun day brunch. They have made some great improvements here. We first ordered the calamari and it was delicious! Then we ordered the mahi fish tacos and the pulled pork tacos, both were great and right on point. The service was wonderful. No matter what our experience the staff is always great. I really applaud them for the changes they have made and we will for sure be back. Thank you Krazy Fish!

-KcE2Ta_MUKzGhrNhjq-IA.text: I should start by mentioning that I choose my friends based on a mutual love of food. Don't judge me - you know you do it too. My high school friend and her husband take me to Krazy Fish every time I'm in town and for good reason. The food is consistently delicious! It must always be summer when I visit because we always sit on the patio and enjoy a few drinks with our tacos. This past weekend my friend and I shared the grilled shrimp roti (an off-menu item! my waitstaff probably hate it but I love ordering off-menu) with a side of mac and cheese and the Szechuan salmon tacos with a side of jalapeno cheddar grits souffle. I actually think I blacked out from happiness because the next thing I knew my plate was empty and my stomach hurt from being so stuffed. Maybe that was the margarita, but since I'm not sure I'll just have to go back for more. Whatever needs to be done for a well-informed Yelp review!

gkzpoLytBkYdHIYFEqkSJQ.text: I love, love love this restaurant! It might not look like much from the outside, but the food is phenomenal! I haven't had a bad meal at this place yet.  My favorite is the grits, best grits in town as far as I am concerned.  The atmosphere is really cool as well.  It's so laid back and chill.  Great place to have a beer eat some great food and just relax.    I think the servers are great too.  Both times I have been to Krazy Fish I have had the same server and he was quick and gave great service.

Xj3iMhC4-E0RqV_TJMtMFA.text: Fantastic service and food second to none... Thai to Creole to Mexican. I couldn't be more delighted with this find. Order the Thai green curry mussels!! Will definitely be back.

FHsXSF_NDqyQ9rJSYVitCw.text: I have been wanting to go here for years... Finally decided to join them for brunch last Sunday. All their brunch meals includes coffee, mimosa, Bellini or hot tea! I ordered the garden scram omelet which had a lot of veggies and cooked perfectly. It came with a side of seasoned potatoes (unfortunately, it was cold and just okay) and a biscuit ( it was also not warm but good). Overall, I would definitely come back because all that was under $12 including tip and I also want to try their tacos!

G6PQarI6cq9nk5SBps7NwA.text: The apps where good but when we had a problem with the temp on our burger the waiter got a little rude.

cFvna6YHamfH3xWaoWkTqQ.text: I like this place. It seems my yelpy friends are divided in their opinions, but I've had positive experiences both times I've been.  Super kitschy. Yep. There's random stuff everywhere on the patio. It's like Cracker Barrel and a high school welding class had a love child and painted it with bright colors.   Food is delicious, though. I finally was able to try the lemongrass tofu tacos, which had been previously recommended...but on my first visit were sold out. So good. A little on the chewier side than I'm used to when it comes to tofu, but the lemongrass flavor paired really well with the blueberry salsa/sauce.  And the jalapeno cheese grits were, while not necessarily the most perfect complement, a True force to be reckoned with. So, so good. They put most other cheese grits to shame. the jalapeno kick is a swell addition.  Siracha on the table, which makes the Mr happy. He indulged in the buffalo shrimp tacos, which hit the spot. I sampled a taste of the buffalo sauce and was pleased with the flavor.  Overall, a solid choice. I'll definitely come back...and bring some friends who need to see the Krazy side of the QC!

Tbu3Y8yNrRX2k4sUoWlRXA.text: Krazy Fish is krazy awesome!  Sorry, I've been dying to say that for DAYS.  Anyway, the first thing you notice as you pull up outside is the tacky decor on the outside.  It kind of looks like someone nabbed a ton of metal lawn decorations and decided to display them proudly outside.  The moment I walked inside, it was even more prominent.  The hanging plastic mermaid was definitely foreshadowed that I would love this krazy place.  The first night, I ordered the krazy grill with chicken, the cactus salad, and the jalapeno grits souffle.  My partner ordered the seafood creole.  Both of them were SUPER fantastic!!  The seafood tasted pretty fresh, and it was very reasonably priced for the quality of the food.  The sauces on both were mild-to-medium spicy, definitely a great balance.  The only thing that was just ok was the cornbread, which may have been because it was later on a Sunday night.  My second visit I ordered the calamari tacos, which came with a mango salsa on top.  Again I had the amazing grits souffle (even better on the second visit!).  OMG, this was also quite delicious.  My friend had the regular fried fish, which wasn't as good as we'd hoped it would be (but still pretty good).    This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  I can't wait to try everything on their menu!  If you like seafood and you want to try foods with Asian and Hispanic flair, I highly recommend this place.

PZ3so6zMM-GXk4EI6B9J5Q.text: Krazy fish is a favorite if you're visiting Plaza Midwood Area, funky decor, great ambiance and friendly staff. Our server(Porter) kept us laughing through the entire meal and was definitely the highlight of the evening. Food was tasty and reasonably priced for the amount that you get.   Will definitely come back for more of the Krazy.

av9aAzIC_dYM34Ti2iurlw.text: A friend recommended this place and for that, I am grateful. I quite enjoyed my meal(s) and I especially love the ceviche, the portion is generous and it is acidic, just as it should be. I would love avocado in the dish though. They always have intricate specials and crafted drinks as well. Each time I have been there, I have had great service.

T6Fgq8MonTTevxwZ5Pz5sw.text: Just okay... Fish was drenched in grease and almost inedible.. The server, however, didn't stop until he made things right.. The shrimp was pretty good.. Likely not to come back unless I'm in the area and starved..

KEt2vcCjv5DRAC3gEjzR1w.text: Phenomenal service, great food, good atmosphere. I highly recommend you to pay them a visit when in Charlotte, NC.! ! !

XE7aNguzSc7hkCqT5n6yQg.text: I don't even know how this place is still open. The food is terrible, the service mediocre and if they didn't serve alcohol it would be a complete waste of space.

X4uV90pl4LNCCqWjNbIqJw.text: We come back here again and again, even though it's a 45-minute drive from our home. Visiting relatives or friends? Krazy Fish and then Amelie's for coffee. I've never had a bad meal here. The staff is great and the food is wonderful. Fish cooked to perfect tenderness. If you get there and order before 6 you get half-priced tacos with a your purchase of a beverage.  I wouldn't call it Mexican, though. More Caribbean. OH...and WAY BETTER THAN CABO FISH TACO! just sayin'...

28vTgoZAeSNxRsoh6Z__Jg.text: First time here. Heard a few friends say good things. Glad we came. Server was awesome. Food was better than expected at every turn. Will be back. Soon!

4u1kcYQuQyHoq6EFmzJ3-w.text: This is hands-down one of my favorite places in Charlotte.   Yes, it's a little weird. The menu is an unusual mesh of gourmet asian, rotisserie, soul food and fish.  That being said, anything and everything I've gotten on the menu has been out of this world.  It's imaginative and fun. Very well-thought out and insanely delicious. I always get the grill mix which includes the smoked meat and chicken (though you can pick your own meat combos).   One of the best things though is the price. That's right. It's cheap. Less than you'd spend on a manufactured and plastic tasting meal at Applebees and the like. There are always great specials AND if that weren't enough; at the bottom of your receipts are discounts that you can collect to take off the price of your next meal.   An all around win great for family time, friend time or date time. Even with the obscure fish sculptures staring at you.

8vrUXYLpSQZ9xRvbVmY2UQ.text: Much Thanks to the Charlotte Magazine that was in our hotel room. It was the best of issue and we used it to go to a lot of places while we were in town including this one.  We came here after picking my friend up from the airport and it was nice to sit out on the outside area and just chill. I had one of the Rotis and my friend has the tacos.  It was good a nice sense of home cooking and the prices were really reasonable.

WZXEawrGFsAiotkJkt5W6g.text: First things first... The place has a Krazy theme and its decorations are out there. The menu was a mixture of TexMex/Southern/Asian foods. First thing I'd like to point out is the service - which was outstanding! Our server was very friendly and helpful when it came to ordering since we told her it was our first time there. We started off with the Szechuan Salt & Pepper Jumbo Wings and these were our favorite part of the meal and set really high standards.  I ordered the fish fry with a side of jalapeno cheddar cheese grits souffle, cornbread,  and mac-n-cheese. My wife got the Krazy burger. In the fish fry plate flavors were hit and miss - the fish was well cooked and seasoned although I was expecting a little more crunch. The Krazy slaw didn't do anything for me, I tasted a lot of cumin and it didn't provide that refreshing and sometimes even creamy feel I expected. The grits were creamy and were spot-on with the flavor. The Mac and cheese was a complete miss for me - I barely touched it. It lacked the flavor and "homey" goodness I was expecting. The cornbread as ok, a little too dry to be honest.  I will definitely come back and give other menu items a try. Future reviews will follow.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Krazy burger with roasted potatoes
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish fry with jalapeño cheddar grits soufflé

tkHSEgp1DB4p9AxHy_IlPw.text: Went for lunch on a cold weekday. Place was pretty empty. Service was speedy, but atmosphere kinda lacking (cold, dark).   Food was very good. No complaints about the standard "Southern Fish" tacos. Side of corn was disappointing --- pretty much canned corn w/ added spices.  $2 Yuengling specials can't be beat.

pBz9FZ0E0VrvbNKrmeHXkg.text: Great place. Tried the Shrimp and Grits. So good, it's like a good book you can't put down!! Wife tried the Krazy Pad Thai and was great. Father in law had the Neptune's Platter and also very good. Portions are huge. Will for sure come back!!

vW6aW4X7veXSjtKczbTAzw.text: Five hours later, I am too physically ill to eat dinner. Went in to order chips/salsa and two fried chicken tacos. Got a house margarita that had minimal alcohol content. The salsa seemed like it had been sitting uncovered for a while and the tacos were incredibly bland. The margarita tasted like pure salt water. If I'm sick off only fried food, I cant imagine how their fish would settle. I'm honestly just giving them two stars so my review will be taken seriously and not make it seem like I'm disgruntled. Skip this place and head to Three Amigos if you're looking for tacos. Or Taco Bell. At least you'll know you'll be sick after that experience.

K9pl9I6OQGONkrEINiSGUw.text: Krazy Fish, an awesome Independent Restaurant in plaza midwood!   Very affordable with a creative menu, for everyone.   Appetizer, we enjoyed the shrimp curry, with the perfect undertones of heat for the curry and topped with tempura shrimp..For my  wife KreKre, she had  some special dish with shrimp, and shredded pork that she loved,  for myself, lemon grass tofu roti(burrito) with a side salad and a side of carrots, cabbage & broccoli. Yes I  recommend this place!  KRAZY

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special of the day
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. So, ... after I had a few bites of my side of broccoli, cabbage &amp; carrots and the side salad.

1rD0GfeGJTjo65UN6oaPJQ.text: Charlotte - Not too bad ! I dont want to just give a bad review and the fish was good. I had the Fried Talapia which came with a choice of side and I tried the Black Eyed Pea Salad wich was drowned in vinegar. The Fish was pretty good so no complaints on that. The waitress was friendly and the atmosphere was different. The Cole Slaw was drenched in vinegar as well so I may not come back. This my be my fault because I initially came here to try a fish taco and didnt so...... I will give it a 3 out of 5. Everyone is diff and its worth a try :)

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Talapia Fish - Pretty tasty, didnt care for the black eye pea salad or the cole slaw but still not bad !!!

bi9Gn75wDpasYMY48DHnnA.text: My companion and I had eaten at Krazy Fish several times. The food was quite distinct and appealing in contrast to the awkward exterior and aesthetics of the building.  On Sunday August 9, 2015, my companion and I went to have dinner at Krazy Fish. We initially ordered drinks and an appetizer. I began ordering an entree and my companion asked the waiter if he could order 2 different tacos instead of 2 of the same all listed under the daily specials, as he had done numerous times in the past. The waiter explained he would have to ask the kitchen manager because he was unsure about it. While waiting, my companion saw the acting assistant manager, Bonnie, come into the dining room, and asked her to come over to the table. From across the dining room, with other customers present, Bonnie rudely yelled, "No, don't even bother asking! I'm not doing it. If we start doing that for everybody it would be a fuc***g headache for the kitchen, so we're not doing it for you." The owner, Giorgio, was not present, nor was the manager Venus. Venus, unlike Bonnie, was always polite, professional, and quite accommodating whenever possible. If there was something the staff or kitchen could not accommodate concerning our order, Venus professionally came to the table and explained why and sometimes offered alternatives when available .   After Bonnie's very unprofessional and rude antics of yelling across the dining room, terrible customer service, and use of profanity, we canceled our appetizer order, paid for our drinks, and left without any objection or retort. We went to Cabo Fish Taco in NODA. There was a short wait but we were promptly texted when our table was ready. The place had a big crowd. Service was prompt, professional and courteous, and the food was great.

t5lw3Wrg4wWg_MDVCOvDCQ.text: Being that I have visited this location before I was shocked and saddened that I was forced o pay 1/2 price for a meal I did not eat. What was worse is that the owner instead of talking face to face had somone relay to me that since they won the "Best of Charlotte" newbies have come to taste food and did not like it so they implemented  a policy not to lose money that you would have to pay 1/2 price for meal. So here's the thing, I took a bite literally it tasted like the dish prepared in was not properly cleaned and reused. And it tasted like it was cooked in used material. I paid $44 for some food I never ate. DO NOT WASTE your time especially NOT YOUR MONEY! I am sad to say that a local decent spot has let fame got to their heads and forgot how to treat a customer. I will not be returning and lost money over terrible food. Bad Policy. Bad SERVICE! The waiter I must say tried. It was management that didn't see the value in a customer just in money.

lVwaOxWZV69XLSXvterLOw.text: Quirky decor but bland food.  Service wasn't bad but my mom and I could have spent the amount of money somewhere else on better food.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Krazy fish fry - scallops
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pollack fish - krazy fish fry
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Artwork

fEV-rDT91dIULhQcs_LHeQ.text: Visited last night and it was awesome! Great service, the lobster bisque was amazing and the hurricanes did the trick

K8DcgNIvbX3rpv9Z4Gkn6g.text: Potato cakes were tasty. So was the gumbo...strong  curry flavor. The kids enjoyed their dishes, which is always a plus They even given military discounts #Winning  The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars was because it took a little long before we received service while other tables that came in after us were getting service ahead of us. Secondly, I ordered the blackened catfish, which was just a little salty for my taste; however, I don't cook w/ salt, so it might've been fine for someone else. I didn't return my food or anything. I got a doggy bag and will try it again for lunch tomorrow. Other then that, I'll definitely return and try other things on the menu like the fish tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guy said it&#39;s good! #Dineindrivethru

aWTMH9TpYl-iOOKkvzSBqg.text: So this particular place is a place that I have enjoyed coming to over the past few years for tacos this particular day I decided to try their brunch Sunday brunch with my mimosas My husband had French toast eggs with bacon and I had salmon with eggs and grits the salmon have lots of flavor the grits were absolutely creamy and delicious. The mimosa was may really well.  Like I stated before I've been coming here for years but something was all the atmosphere has changed I did not feel as though our waiter was that friendly or or attentive to us I was eager to Harry up and eat and leave because I just did not feel welcomed.  I just did not get a good vibe.  This stretch of central Avenue has tons of restaurants to choose from so I'm going to put this one back on the back burner and try some other places in this area

xCWmTWZBBv_Sti_mkuVkAA.text: Stopped in to grab lunch with a friend on Thursday. The place had a good sized crowd for a midweek lunch service, but the restaurant only had one waitress on staff. She was super friendly and clearly skilled at her job. God knows I couldn't serve 8 tables at a time including one with more than 6 people. However, as a customer I don't want to have to flag down staff or wait forever to be waited on. Again, she was fabulous the problem was just the ratio of tables to staff.   I've eaten here several times and typically love the food, but this past time the tacos were definitely too oily. There was liquid all over the plate which made the tacos soggy and unappetizing. I will definitely be back based on previous positive experiences, but maybe management should rethink the staffing for lunch time.

lpOuDPAhrFQO5BQSpyjrsg.text: We stopped in Charlotte on our way down to Florida, we didn't want to waists the trip eating  somewhere fast foodie so we tried this place out. I can't remember everything I order, I'm writing this review a month later. What I can tell you is hat the curry burrito and gumbo was really tasty, very different. My wife had some type of fried fish she wasn't crazy about. She thought it was too light and feel apart to easily. She's a bit of a picky eater but I always value here taste buds. All in all, I would give this place another go. There were so many things on the menu that I wanted to try.

p7Wgc4uSD5By1Ba3p95wDA.text: Great food.  Definitely not your average seafood.  They have some Indian & Thai in the mix and do a very good job at crossing over.  Not too many places can cover different types of food and pull it off.  My daughter had the seafood Creole,  my son had Neptunes platter and I had the blackened tuna and we shared an order of muscles.  A LOT of food.  One of my favorite dishes was the salad.  Beets, black eyed peas, greens, pickled cucumbers, jalapenos and greens.....very unique. ...very good!!!!! No waiting and the atmosphere was good. I will definitely come back!!

8SUiJxaBTj5Ppbw-XgWX9A.text: Amazing !!! Wanted something new and different and this was definitely it! Our waiter was amazing and gave great suggestions. They're drinks are great and they're food is even better! I love the electric atmosphere there as well!

tk4lVuFsduXJt9WiP6V7Vg.text: Small area and pretty descent. Friendly staff and quick too. Curry mussels were so good! I had the blackened tuna taco and it tasted ok. I had the side of potato salad and it was only ok, nothing too exciting.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

TAMlciMGHUZ4pqEdVjU8XQ.text: So...being from Northern Va I appreciate the unique..since there isn't a lot of it around here.  Food spectacular and cool.  Beers ice cold and some great options!  This is no meat and potatoes place..if your palate welcomes good stuff..this is it.  Owner is a super nice guy as well!  Love helping the small business!  Cheers!

ox40lCe6IZL144SNaiEYag.text: I thought this place would be a lot better. I knew it would be kitschy, but I thought the menu looked good, and I figured it was more upscale than the trashy mediocre diner food that it actually was.   If you read the reviews, there's a common theme that the service is usually bad. This was True. It wasn't AWFUL service because our waitress was reasonably pleasant and friendly, but she was inattentive and forgetful. My wife's ceviche tacos didn't have guacamole like they were supposed to, she wasn't asked which type of salsa she wanted, and she never got the gumbo she ordered. Ever. And the waitress was so hit and miss with service, my wife didn't really have a chance to ask for the gumbo again.   The food itself was bland and forgettable. We started with the salsa/queso trio. The chips were a little stale, and the salsas weren't flavorful. The queso was decent (although if you're looking for True Texas-style queso, walk on). Then I ordered the beef bulgogi roti. Why are rotis being served at a seafood fusion place? Who cares! Why not? The beef was more like meat loaf than bulgogi, the rice was NOT SALTED AT ALL, and the habanero apple butter sauce wasn't even spicy. I ate half, which was more than enough. No flavor whatsoever. I got mac and cheese as my side. It tasted like sadness, and it had a lovely clump of burned cheese on top to really class the dish up. It also came with a tiny little salad...which was spring mix and tomatoes. No dressing of any kind.   The drinks can be all over the place. The jalapeno margarita was a hit, the sweet tea vodka was mediocre, and the berry thing (it's like vodka and agua fresca) was saccharine sweet and not drinkable.   Skip this one. If you want GOOD diner food with better service, go for The Diamond. If you want good seafood, go literally anywhere else.

jlI1_6yPr376aED64bLuVA.text: Krazy Fish was a let down mostly on service.  Once my order was taken, I never saw my waiter again.  Poof!  He vanished.  I wanted more to drink, and I wanted food to go.  Nadda.  Oh, well.  I was handed off to someone else to pay the tab, and then magically my waiter reappeared, all happy to see me.  He wasn't so giggly, however, with the 10% tip which he barely earned.  Not even a wave goodbye, either.  The menu is interesting and eclectic which sometimes suggest flavors muddle.  My blackened tuna was cooked to order, but it didn't keep inviting my taste buds back to the party.  I cleaned the plate only because I was famished.  I would've ordered more . . . well,  you know the story.  I'm tempted to try KF again but with Cabo a short trip to NoDa, not sure I'll make the effort.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened tuna.

oUY-KV8ENoUfj1V6THg9lw.text: Tacos and beers before the show!  Had the buffalo shrimp, chicken and fried grouper with jalapeno grits.... excellent!  Tacos were two for $10 and very good. Great service and atmosphere!  Great drink specials as well. Will come back in the near future.

vAq38IZbk_Wkrjphpjj9dg.text: OMG A-MAZ-ING!!!  We came on a Wed. night and they had their wine bottles half price.  We didn't get one this time, but good to know for the next. I took the advice of David P's yelp review and so glad I did.  I got the Thai Curry Mussels and they were fantastic.  I loved the heat in these... if you can't take spicy food, you might want to skip these.  I LOVE spicy food and these were perfect.  Next I got the szechwan salmon tacos with a side of veggies.  The sesame and flavors inside were perfect. A large quantity of salmon was inside the tacos... which are in a bread a bit thicker than a tortilla.  My boyfriend got the pulled pork roti with a side of roasted potatoes.  It reminded me of a pot pie inside a wrap.  It was huge and very good.  All the food was soooo good.  I must have told my boyfriend 3x later that night how good that meal was and how much I enjoyed it. I will definately be back.  Bring a sweater though, the place tends to be cold... even in summer.

oTO26MQGqOi31RTVoSzPTw.text: I came to this place because of DDD. They certainly live up to the visit. The place is a True dive with whacky decorations and dump atmosphere. I say dump with the best intention. The menu is fun and appealing with crazy tacos rotis and entrees. Another bonus is they have a parking lot.  I had the bulgogi and potato cake tacos and the Souther chicken toto with honey butter sauce. A True superstar on the menu is the jalapeno cheese grits.    The bartender / waitress was excellent and super friendly.  Overall the place is great and a must visit when you are looking to have a dinky meal in ultra comfy surroundings.  FoodDude!

xm9evDev7CH1ePPT2n9KwQ.text: I've dined here several times in the past without issue, however, this last visit will surely be my last. Found hair in my calamari appetizer, but since I could not prove it came that way...too bad, really?? Ok ..on to the entree, a shrimp platter ...the shrimp were not cleaned and the remainder of the food was cold and bland. The manager came over to address our concerns, well actually to tell us that they do not absorb any customer dissatisfaction with their food. She took the entire plate and walked away without even an apology. We paid the bill and left quietly. The  MENU does state that the establishment does not replace meals if the patron is not satisfied. So basically the patron has to be responsible for any shortcomings that come out of their kitchen. I personally don't think this is fair but this policy is disclosed on  their laminated menu's. Our server was great.

tWIu0X6WTOtIyWdrRZ6ylw.text: Krazy Fish looks unassuming and quite random of a place to go, but it's a little hidden secret if you ask me. The decor is super eclectic and you may wonder if some crazy person or a 5 year old designed it but it's character, unique character if you ask me. I've only been here for brunch and it kind of serves as my go to quick and safe brunch spot when I'm in CLT. The foods always on point, they have some cool varieties. Best part though, every brunch menu item comes with a free coffee or mimosa! The steak and eggs are my go to item because the steak has a nice flavoring to it and cooked to a nice tenderness. I'd also recommend their Chilaquiles with some extra hot sauce. If you're in the Plaza Midwood area I'd definitely recommend this place, especially if you're looking to try something off the beaten path.

5Lo0OzsqoEYw-Mm6W_PvHw.text: Krazy Fish.  one of my faves. I have been here,many times.  I have not gotten anything i didnt like.   i try different dishes about everytime i go.

WZpYGg954i8dEQYCqf6JUg.text: So I've been patronizing Krazy Fish since they opened. I love this place and the food makes me so happy. The food gets 5 stars. The last two times I stepped into the building, I had, by far, the worst service I've ever gotten. It was lunch, during the week both times and I believe there was only one server working. The first time, I brought a couple of friends with me. one who had been there before and one who hadn't. The server rolled his eyes and sucked his teeth so many times, I asked my friends if they just wanted to go somewhere else. I had to apologize for this establishment's treatment of her. Let that settle. He then transferred our table with no notice, but that was ok given the attitude we'd received. The story there is longer but, y'all get the idea. The second time was actually this past Thursday. I again joined a friend for lunch. The server walked to the door, saw us getting out of the car and rolled his eyes once again. He then motioned for us to sit wherever, or maybe he spoke really low. He then put water on the table as he passed by to attend to another table, mumbling something else under his breath. My friend then said "I had him the last time I was here and he was super nasty to me. Do you want to just go to the Diamond?" And that's exactly what we did.  I LOVE Krazy Fish, but I'm not going to patronize a place that treats me like crap every time I walk through the door. I hope something changes.

FE8Dq36A0yZsu4gDrOtrZQ.text: I've wanted to try this restaurant for years and just never made it until now. I'm not sure what I expected but I think it was greatness based on the pictures submitted by other reviewers and the eclectic exterior of the restaurant.   When we arrived we were kinda greeted by some guy and through a combination of body language, nonverbal cues, and common sense we arrived at a table. Our waiter was nice but very uninformed about the menu offerings and though we explained it was our first time here an needed a moment to review the menu, he proceeded to read almost the entirety of it to us. Ver. Batim.   We ordered the seafood dip with toast points as it was one of the specials and we both ordered the Cuban Chicken Roti one with the Jamaican Curry Sauce and the other with Indian Curry Sauce. The sides we selected were the Broccoli medley and some kind of Corn concoction with a fancy name.   The dip came out quickly but I was surprised that it was cold. I would've liked to have known that was how it's intended but it was decent for cold seafood dip. There was some long piece of white meat or something that could've been squid or???? The point is that when we asked what was in the dip before ordering he definitely didn't indicate something that should look like that.   The Roti was flavorful except both tasted exactly the same. When we inquired about this the waiter, after "going to inform the cooks about it," literally said "um the Jamaican Curry is Indian Curry with curry in it."  IM SORRY WHAT???? The Broccoli, cabbage, and carrot situation was way overcooked as in almost brownish-grey and very peppery. The Corn was good.   Overall it was just "ok" and a strong maybe on returning but I just wasn't that impressed.

h4M2AWiDazf97h1OH1mLwQ.text: My husband and I went to Krazy Fish Bar & Grill for dinner and loved it.  The food was awsome and the athmosphere was even better.  We sheared a Cuban Chicken Roti, along with the Curry Shrimp appetizer. At the end of dinner we were both completely full and happy.  Great customer service, we will deffinately dine here again!

4PohKqrRL1zdI86XvGAM-g.text: Gawdammit. Having worked in endless kitchens, I know how things can get all mis-sorted. The strangest thing I ever found in my food were STAPLES at a curry place my friends and I have religiously eaten at in Brick Lane, London. Anyway. It's happened to us all before: HAIR IN YOUR FOOD.  My friend had one of these Living Social coupons to this "eclectic", kitsy restaurant in Plaza Midwood, Krazy Fish. Place looked cozy, run by young, hip twentysomethingyrolds. Glanced in the kitchen, couldn't help notice the very earthy chef vibe, bit like at Common Market. Fair enough. Ordered a glass of white wine, and a special on the menu, Blackened Tuna tacos. I was actually pretty excited, until I got my food.  Lo and behold, a hair! Tucked just on the side of a taco-- it looked flung from a greasy dread, or something. My friend noticed it, but since it was on her bill, I didn't want to make a fuss. I know it's the price you pay at these southern, homey places-- but it pretty much ruined my entire experience and I doubt I'll ever go back.  Reminded me of an Applebee's I stopped over at in Richmond, and found a pubic-looking wrangle of a strand in my Carbonara. Trying not to vomit, I complained and all they offered me was 50% off and to remake my food. I was livid!! Why would I want to eat the same thing from your kitchen when my appetite's already been spoiled.  Blecch.  Rankings      # of times dined here: 1st     Cost of Bill incl. Tip: $15 for 2ppl (using Living Social)     Food Rating: 5/10     Service Rating: 8/10

XREmxt5sQSLFyZVBM4dsbQ.text: Yum!!! Amazing!!!! Food was great, service was amazing, shocked that I have never been before! Drinks were great too! I had the salmon cakes with the squash casserole! I tore that casserole up, delish!!!!!

9ne-O9MlD5xfTOuJ7KIUuA.text: I wanted to see what all the hype was about, but i was disappointed.  The food is okay at best.  It seems like they tried to create a fusion menu, but everything fell short (either too salty, or too sweet).

QwGbruF-rgrgcx4eWLZXDA.text: First timer: Jason was my server and he was great.  I had the Buffalo chicken tacos with the jalapeno grits. Everything was delicious...but lets linger on those grits...they were scrumptious!!!! Thanks for the recommendation Jason!

PUK0G6sFBe-UHu3eZxSqDQ.text: Walking into this place,  you get mixed emotions.....it def. looks like a dive and IS tacky, tacky but the smell is soooo alluring!  Staff is very attentive and down to earth....service is also very fast.  I wouldn't say I was wowed by the food but it was pretty tasty and you get a big bang for  your buck!  Boyfriend LOVED the tacos....I didn't but only bc I'm not a fan of celery seed in slaw.

83GFYx0wBbiyhXgfBRKb1w.text: Awful experience!!! went there for lunch, place wasn't busy at all. Took them forever to get our food and when we got it it was cold. All there dishes are seasoned the same way the only difference is that is the sauce that they put on top. Very bad flavor not to mention the taste of the old oil that's probably haven't been changed in a while. Save your money and go somewhere else

AYFGtKEATbmTA_xLNGQPjw.text: It's crazy inside Krazy Fish...that's for damn sure. Paint splattered booths, sparkly countertops, a mishmash of menu items, blow up doll caught in a net...but I dig it! Although the place was quite quiet during lunch yesterday, a few friends and I enjoyed a tasty meal.   Our server was most excellent - a mash up of tattoos & Southern charm - with many honeys, sweeties, and dolls thrown about. I fully appreciate when the server gives solid suggestions, too! We started out by splitting an order of the ceviche - a magnanimous portion of fresh, lime laden fish with plenty of onion, tomato and cilantro to amp up the flavor. The portion was generous and the taste was right on. Plus, our fab server brought out a bottle of guacamole so we could douse to our liking.   For my meal, I chose the blackened tuna tacos with pineapple salsa/slaw and a side of jalapeno cheddar grits. Two large tacos arrived with plenty of tuna and mounds of tasty pineapple slaw stuffed into fried soft shell tortillas. Let me tell you - I love me a fried tortilla. Taste-ay. The combo of the pineapple and tuna was bright and the grits, albeit a bit heavy, had great flavor and texture. I would have been totally game if they were a bit spicier, too.   I like this kinda crazy, Krazy Fish.

q8U7JS6jgu3lBgMVDBrniw.text: Fantastic place! Five of us went Friday night. Not only was the food great, but our server was a pleasure as well! We will definitely be back!

4Xbhz-MOPnCs3d96mFylOw.text: Came here recently with some local friends, and really enjoyed it. It is a laid-back place where you can eat well, and enjoy interesting food at a cheap price. I had the BBQ brisket tacos, and they were out of this world. And to keep it eclectic, I had to order the mac and cheese, and it was verrry good. And having foodie friends, we tend to share, and the pork roti didn't disappoint either. Also having New York City's famous McSorley's ale to wash it down, I love this funky joint, and while I do not live nearby, I hope to visit again.

gb11zG-lhN1Mi33ZFUTFuw.text: While the location and decor are casual with a hole-in-the-wall feel, the food is anything but.
