K-17E-lg99A4Nz3_98hccg.text: Tried this with my girlfriend for the first time a few months ago and while I will always love NoDa's Cabo Fish Taco...... The fish tacos I had at Krazy Fish were somewhat MORE exceptional.   Tried the schezuen salmon tacos and the Cuban chicken tacos and oh man!!!! The salmon was delicious!!!!  Probably the best tacos ever!!!!  How I avoided this place is almost concerning so don't make my mistake!!! Get there ASAP!!!!

Vcb2L4On1kEQqoDt0uDmhA.text: Before anyone starts snapping his/her fingers, twisting his/her neck and saying 'oh NO she didn't!!", hear me out on my reasoning behind my 3-stars.  This is a prime example how expectation can ruin just about anything.  After seeing all the rave reviews, I dragged my fellow Yelper friend to try out Krazy Fish for dinner on Friday, waiting for my socks to get knocked off.  Instead I was left slightly disappointed.  Stepped through the door of this dumpy looking structure and we found ourselves in some sort of Alice in Wonderland-ville.  The eclectic decor is cute.  The place was busy, so we waited a little for the hostess.  By the door was a big blackboard with their specials on it, so my friend already knew what she wanted for dinner before we even got our table. We got seated at one of those tiny 2-top (why such small tables even exist in any restaurant? After salt & pepper there's barely room for water let alone my plate).  i was pleased to find out about the $2 domestic (Icehouse) special, SCORE!    The menu was simple enough and just as expected.  I decided on the Cuban Chickent Roti (aka burrito) with Jamaican Curry sauce and squash casserole as my side. My friend ordered the Thai Red Curry with Fried Fish special.  Here comes the "fun" part.  The waiter guy (he looked 12, I didn't think child labor is allowed) came back 3 times trying to get her order right.  Somehow "the curry special" as we were pointing to the blackboard only warranted a lost/deer-in-the-headlights look from him.  He had to walk to the blackboard and stare at it in order to know there are specials in the restaurant he's working at.  Yike!  My burrito looked good when arrived.  I like that they pressed it on the grill so it's a little brown & crispy on the outside.  My friend's Thai Curry Fish, on the other hand, looked odd, nothing like curry or fish.  Oh wait, I know why!  Because it indeed WASN'T Thai Curry Fish, it was shrimp gazpacho, the only other special listed on the board.  Now, how on the freaking earth after 3 repeated clarifications, curry fish became shrimp gazpacho will forever remain a mystery to me.    I nibbled on my side salad as they scrambled to fix her order.  I have to say, it was some good berry salad dressing, not tart like most vinaigrette, very summer friendly.  Then I started to poke at my squash casserole, which wasn't too heavy or cheesy, another good one.  Finally her food arrived and I dived into my burrito.  Lots of rice, not enough chicken or sauce.  It became kinda bland.  Honestly I couldn't even taste the "cuban," for all I know my chicken could be Costa Rican.  I ended up spooning my friend's curry sauce, which was deliciously coconut-ty, over my burrito. I would have lick her plate clean if I could.    The food overall was fine but nothing too memorable. But the service was just mind-boggling.  I know the place is new, but the waiter doesn't know his daily specials? Now that is KRAZY (pun intended). And oh, he forgot her side salad too.  So, 3-stars for now, and I will return and try the Tempura Shrimp Tacos and see if it can earn an extra star.

38270u1C-4nCKXHiPrX9fw.text: Too many reviews on Yelp forced me to take the cruise down Central to Krazy Fish to see what all the talk was about and well worth the drive.  Chef salad had so many ingredients, every bite was an adventure.  Our waiter made suggestions and offered up the specials in such a way no one at our table could make a decision!  That's a good thing!  Pros: Awesome variety of food Love da music Wait staff was johnnie on the spot  Cons Room temperature glasses for beer Room temperature red wine  Several items on menu not available - one being Dijon vinaigrette - hello - how much effort does it take to whip that up - also out of scallops but that is understandable  Would definitely come back and partake of the deck and another cold one - just hope they have chilled mugs next time

2R_dmm0BVqxyo_3EsJofDw.text: Holy awesomeness in my mouth!   Was in town for work and was looking for a place to go that offered vegetarian options but wasn't too earthy since I was dining with coworkers. Despite some of the mixed reviews and seeing pictures of the crazy decor, I talked my party of 4 into making the trek to Krazy Fish. And it was SO worth it. (at least that's what 3 of us thought...the guy who only eats at chain restaurants wasn't all that impressed)   I had the "special" pineapple margarita to wet my whistle. It was pretty good, but a little sweet for my liking. The tabled ordered the potato cakes and cheese and salsa to share. I can't put into words how good the potato cakes were. We had to fight over them and every drop of sauce on the plate. I was expecting typical fried southern potatoes but these had an Asian zing. The pineapple salsa was really quite amazing, too.   I have a big appetite so I started off with a salad, too. I'd never had a salad with black eyed peas and jalapenos, but it was really, really good.   For my meal I got the lemongrass tofu tacos. I consider myself to be a bit of a vegetarian taco aficionado since I eat vegetarian tacos any time I can find them and these were SO good! But even better were the jalapeno grits that came as my side. I'd never had grits before because, well, they seemed gritty and boring (or have meat in them) but these grits were nothing short of incredible. 3 of us got them, and we could have licked our bowls.   I heard from my coworkers that she she-crab soup was really good and the Salmon tacos one of them had are still being talked about days later.   If you're not put off by crazy decor and eating food items that seem like they might not go together (but actually do!) give this place a shot!

ww7ax-o5oyL-_t9W7TOp_A.text: Great service. Friendly and welcoming atmosphere. Mussels in green Thai curry..phenomenal. wings a little salty for my taste but were still good.

E0w-w2jlYJWJICcQxNJSSQ.text: Krazy Fish (and More!) has been taunting me with delayed opening dates for a month or two now, but they are finally open and I must say, it was worth the wait.  While the interior decor looks a bit like a performance art version of the mind of an unbalanced person with an aquatic fixation, the food is delicious. Get the tacos. Let me say that again good and slow so you wont miss it.  GET. THE. TACOS.  I've tried both the tempura shrimp and cuban chicken versions and both were delicious (though I'm partial to the shrimp, with a touch of the pepper oil that is on the tables). Neither was particularly spicy but the flavors were full and bright. I love that their slaw (which tops your protein) is not a mayo-y mess and the tortillas are fresh and fluffy. Tacos come with one side (all this for under $8). I am in love with their jalapeno cheddar grits souffle, to a ridiculous degree, but Jake's mac and cheese put up a strong argument and I look forward to measuring their squash casserole against Dish's.  Yes, they serve other things besides tacos. There is shrimp and grits that is certainly on my to do list. There is pad thai. There is curry lemongrass tofu for the veggie crowd. They will even serve you up a quarter chicken, and I look forward to trying any or all of these dishes. But in the mean time (and who am I kidding, it will only be a matter of days before I stroll back) I am glad to have Krazy Fish as my new neighbor.

SfcfVgYZM_EBbeJrkzt3qw.text: The food here is terrific! I ordered the BBQ sandwich with macaroni and cheese. All of it was delicious. Most surprisingly was the pickles that came with my plate. I've always hated pickles, but my boyfriend encouraged me to try these because they are unlike anything he'd ever eaten. The pickles were like tangy cucumbers. They had more of a consistency of cucumbers, less like pickles. They were fantastic. We also had the chips and salsa appetizer. The pineapple and mild salsa were awesome. Everything I ate was delicious and filling. The server was friendly and attentive without being overbearing and fake. It was cool of him to give us to-go boxes for our food and the salsa. Also, the interior design and decorations of the place were intriguing. I can't wait to come back.

za9Qztsj9D_Xn5WOn0NGXQ.text: I love this place! One of the best Cuban sandwiches i ever had! Great services and great food!!

S6qp9pRR-kAHmmBrREumXg.text: Excellent Gumbo!  Honestly I would just come back for that next time.  However, we did try the Chips & Salsa sample...the salsa verde is the best!  And neptune's platter was good if you want all fried, the fried veggies were the best to me.  And I got a combination of the grilled shrimp and ceviche tacos with Mac & cheese...didn't finish anything but the grilled shrimp taco.  But I am giving this place 4 stars for the GUMBO!!!!!!!!

POTy13nT0mNWv5svuw7jQQ.text: It's a long drive for me to get there, but i'm always glad to go.  They have the best calamari.  The southern fried veggies is unique and was what won me over the first time i visited.  Since then, i stick with the combo thingie with chicken and southern veggies or go with whatever is on the chalkboard up front.    and always get the brownie.  the brownie.  always.

gLbX-vfyp0mf69lNtDV0Hw.text: Had to make an account special for this review.   *Brunch Review*  The below experiences are True for me as well as the people I've dined with.   I only get one dish for brunch. The French Toast Platter. Twice I've received cold, wet, egg saturated pieces of bread.   Egg dishes are supposed to come with a biscuit. Can't tell you how those taste because I never seem to get one.   The bacon, oh the bacon. The bacon on more than one occasion has looked like gnarled pieces of flash fried beef jerky. I don't know what the deal with that is. But hey, sometimes they do you a favor and forget to give you bacon altogether.   Waited an hour for food most recently and 2 hours the trip before. I thought that was a fluke as the manager or someone explained they were short staffed.  Methinks not.   I guess my recommendation is to come within an hour of opening for brunch or you may be in for a long wait for subpar dishes with missing items.   1 Star for Jalapeno Cheddar Grits and the Roasted Potatoes because they are they only enjoyably edible parts of my brunch 99% of the time.

aqqjyC4vYcemh0-yvJ6aIA.text: Second time I have been here. Very delish!!! Cozy low down chill place. Love the gumbo, fish taco, creamy shrimp and grits and calamari was good too.

IsGFKqwCxUgKlp3E-hJUBw.text: Worst experience ever. I am allergic to shellfish and there was shrimp in my chicken sandwich. Service was slow. We had a party of 8 and it took over two hours to get out of there. I was no compensated for the mistake with my food which could have killed me. Waiter had no personality. Will never be going back again.

e4capyS5VtMk6sSpNYbVqw.text: I think this place is strong competition for that other well-known place up in NoDa! Love this divey/hipster place for it's eclectic decor. The fish tacos are always on point. If you want an appetizer, the pineapple salsa in the trio sampler is awesome! They have a great selection to choose from and always have great specials going on. $1 mystery beers make it worth while (if you don't mind that you may or may not end up with a PBR). Plenty of outdoor patio space make this place a must see.  So far, this place has never been overly crowded --- that may change once its episode of Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives airs, so check it out now!

hDLFQ58kP85gIYq07gn7-g.text: Husband had the fish tacos with mac and cheese. Very good! I had the roti with calamari and a side of jalapeno grits. The grits were delicious! Started with the chips and salsa sampler. I don't think the chips and salsa were worth the five bucks, though.Chips were run of the mill. Having said that I am a fan of thin chips that are seasoned. I only liked one of the 3 sauces.I believe it was chipotle. Our server was knowledgeable and helpful with the menu, as it can seem overwhelming at first. Large menu and hard to choose.Nice beer selection and full bar. The place is funky with Guy Fieri's face painted on the outside of the building. If you're hitting the clubs in that area definitely give it a try.

8BDLdI39qNAqYgBzb4eLJg.text: Excellent service and explained several items and spices we have never heard of.  The gumbo is delicious and not over spiced, served with cornbread. Y-YScnSplwdoUYO4lbRaxA.text: I loved Krazy Fish!  The atmosphere is eclectic and dive-y; definitely not fancy.  The service was excellent.  I didn't catch our server's name, but he was attentive and gave great recommendations.  I had the Szechuan salmon tacos with a side of jalapeno cheese grits.  The tacos were great, but OMG the grits?  Amazing.  Next time I'm ordering shrimp and grits just so the grits can be the main focus of my meal.  My husband ordered Neptune's platter, which is a giant plate of deep fried fish and vegetables.  I of course sampled everything and it was wonderful.  It came with 3 different sauces which were amazing, too.  He had a side of mac & cheese; very yummy!  I can't wait to come back here and try more things!

9R4EEc13MEcCYVlA75JCCg.text: This is a great place....taco Tuesday and half price wine ask for Jerry. We had the salsas and chips. Love the pineapple salsa. They have a lot to choose from on the menu. I see why Diners and Dives likes this place.

39TAxIel5XuaQXQHRev5ng.text: Just about the worst food ever.   Coleslaw had a cup of some spice, maybe cumin.  Seafood platter with southern fried vegetables came with fried green and red peppers and carrots.  The 2 sauces that came with the platter were both sweet.   The squash casserole looked and tasted like the dogs dinner.  The seafood was greasy.   How do they stay open?  Get a real chef or a cookbook.   Cooking good food is not that complicated and they are way over complicating it.

4ejfvUGFyNj3SD2biXWrDg.text: Loveeeee me some Krazy Fish.  I can't believe it's taken me so long to come Here! Had lunch with a fellow yelper last Tuesday and got the red curry.  Super good stuff, friendly service and a strong Bloody Mary!!

Lhn7GbPEy5khsgRh6Dg_og.text: A group of us went.  One person got the Neptune, another got the gazpacho with shrimp and it looked really good.  I got the gumbo since it was featured on the food channel and it was very flavorful.  My disappointment came with the entree.  I ordered the mango shrimp with jalapeno cheese grits.  I'm not kidding when I say it was like eating a thick soup.  Bleh.  I knew in one bite, I had made a mistake.  The gal next to me got the fried fish chips and she literally ate like 4 pieces and left the rest. She was too polite to say anything. The waitress didn't even ask why she didn't eat her plateful of food.  The place was soooo cold.  Definitely bring a jacket if you eat here, but personally I don't care to return.

7JRCtZrWctaIeCz8uVFO3Q.text: Came for lunch on a Sunday with a Groupon and was pleasantly surprised! Everyone from the hostess to our server were super friendly and helpful. We had a Bloody Mary, salsa sampler, fried grouper tacos with Mac and cheese and salmons tacos with cheddar grits. All 3 salsas were great. The tacos were STUFFED full of fresh, tasty fish and salsa/slaw. I gotta say...these are the best, biggest tacos I've had in Charlotte. Cabo Fish Taco doesn't have anything on Krazy Fish...these were way better. Everything was a great value too. The drinks are good and cheap. If you get the brunch on Sat or Sun it even comes with a complimentary mimosa or Bellini! This is my new go to place and I can't wait to try their other offerings. Hidden gem!

wz8mlPsMQSTKA3R959cK8Q.text: My husband and I came in this past Sunday after finding a local game shop didn't open until later in the day, and boy were we surprised! I was skeptical because of the pictures online of the restaurant. The fish is amaze-balls. I had the Schezwan Salmon Tacos and my husband had the fish tacos with the pineapple salsa. They were amazing. He took home a pork roti as well (I didn't get a bite of it because I've been fighting a cold), and man was I jealous! He put the roti in the oven for about 20 min and he said it was the better than the fish taco he had. We shall be back for sure!  Oh, and they have a patio so you can bring your canine with you! Yay!

c7K6teojXmjkIjFxdmFpQg.text: This isn't the first time I've been here, but I am giving five stars b/c each time I've been here I have a great experience. First, parking is on premise and close by so it's easy like I like it! I have heard and read about bad service experiences here, but this visit, like my others, the server was engaged and fun, and very effecient. We are leisurely diners, and never felt rushed. She gave good recommendations and answered lots of menu questions. They have a full bar. We got mussels to share to start. They were delicious, prepared in curry. This is a spicy dish, so if you dont care for that, be aware!The portion was very large and easily could be a full meal themselves. There are lots of fried dishes on the menu, but we still had plenty of options.   I got Red Curry w shrimp and tofu for my entree, and my friend got the blackened tuna. His face was so sad after he tasted mine that I switched plates with him for a while so he could have some of it. (The tuna was okay, but the Red Curry was just outstanding.) I had a hard time getting my plate back! Generous portion of protein w a variety of vegetables, served with their Krazy Rice, which by the way was cooked perfectly- just enough stick to hold the grains together. The place filled up, and it was noisy with happy people, families, etc. But, it's a funky little place that was even better because of it.

0f4uawoREC1eCSC-27NSCg.text: Kraut fish is a cute eclectic place over in mid wood.  I went for drinks and dinner with a co worker, as we are both from out of town.  Overall, the drinks were great; however, I felt the food was a little expensive for the quality.  We started with the mussels (which were actually very good), it was a Thai take on mussels and very different from food I had gotten anywhere else.  I got a seafood curry for my main course, and I felt the seafood wasn't super fresh and was a little chewy.  Overall, I wasn't impressed. My coworker also got a very large friend seafood platter.  It was good, but in my opinion it was expensive for a platter of fried seafood.  Service was good atmosphere was fun, food was average.

wM229qQisw3nJu-UO_zjmQ.text: I was really excited to visit this place because of its funky look and DDD. But it was a total let down. We went on a Sunday afternoon and it just us and like a couple of other tables so they were not busy at all and the service was so incredibly slow and bad. Our appetizer and the kids meal we ordered came out pretty fast but then we literally waited for like 30 minutes for our food which we learned later was just sitting under the heat lamps for like 15 minutes. There were like 3 servers hanging around not busy while our food just sat there. And our server was hanging out at a table sitting with them for like 10 minutes when our food was just sitting there. Finally we got up and asked where our food was and it still took another 5 or so minutes for someone to bring it. The tacos were soggy by this time and not good. Aside from the bad service the food was just a total let down. The kids meal was gross and our tacos were soggy and it seems the oil was old because everything fried had a bad taste to it. This was a bummer because this was a place we were excited to visit and we left not even enjoying or completing our meal.

OnaF6VP62RSuapeAQOkr_g.text: Got the Groupon and knew I was in for a treat.    Thank you KC for opening up another great eatery.   I have absolutely no complaints.    The Fried Shrimp w Sweet potato curry over potato cakes was Awesome.     Chips and Salsa, I had the gringo, pinapple and the roasted poblano I think, and couldnt have asked for any better.   I honestly cant remember the 3rd course name.   Something to the effect of seafood curry, with fried seafood on top, rice in the middle.   FREAKIN FANTASTIC!   fourth course was a mojito and some $1 beer.   Fifth course,  Bananas Foster Creme Brulee,   not eggy creme brulee,  more creme,   very very good.  and for the final course bc I just was not finished....   Yes  6th course!    The ribs, they were a special offering and lets just say I hope I didnt ruin my craving for smoked ribs that I was planning on doing this weekend.    KC does it again.   Even the smoked half rack was excellent!     If you remember Fat City, and you remember the food, you will want to go to Crazy Fish.    The mac and cheese is there, the squash casserole is there,  the corn bread,  and several other old recipes were on the menu.     Enough about the food.    The service was top notch as well.    Nobody was slacking there.    If I could remember the girls name I would give her commendations.   Young, Blond,  knows her menu quite well.     All in all.  You are  fool not to go try this place and if you do ENJOY.     Thanks Again KC.   Hate it you were at the beach but I will be back and will say hey to you then.

xi7pGfp0eIFJpmkeu1XpFw.text: I have been to Krazy Fish multiple times and always, always enjoy it. It's my go to place for out of town company because it's unlike anything we have at home.  Food has always been great and atmosphere is killer.  I ordered a delivery order for an all staff meeting.  Our office always uses chain restaurants, which I hate.  We ordered from Krazy Fish and people loved it!  The staff was AWESOME to work with and we had a HUGE variety of food.  Something for everyone, for sure. Can't wait to use them again.  Venus is awesome!

dhiSssGHwW2CqcncinSiFA.text: After seeing this place pop up on yelp and consistently get good reviews, I had to try it.  I grabbed some lunch with my mom and when we walked in the door we immediately noticed the funky interior.  Knowing this use to be a Pizza Hut, then a few bars; this place has changed for the better.    Sat down and reviewed the menu, lots of good choices, especially different style tacos.  I went with the Krazy Pad Thai.  This dish was oozing with flavor, especially the slaw.  I mixed everything together, added some Sriracha, and the meal was magnificent.  Next time I order this I'll ask them to spice it up in the kitchen, great flavor, just not spicy enough for me.  My mom chose the red snapper taco's with a side of mac and cheese, interesting pairing but hey I've done Krazier so who am I to talk.  Anyway, the fish came out lightly breaded and perfectly fried.  The sauce that was drizzled over the tacos was exceptional; Sweet, spicy, a little tangy, it worked.  The mac and cheese, as mom put it, was not as good as hers and I wasn't going to argue, but I liked it.  The top was loaded with Cheddar Cheese and I feel like they also mixed some cream cheese in the body of the dish; this gave it a rich taste which I enjoyed.  The only negative about this experience was the time it took to get our food.  The place wasn't crowded at all and it took over 20 minutes to get our food, not cool.

uwU3Zk2GLbBMvBVFusRyOg.text: Am I the only person who thinks that the food here is horrible? I stopped by here after voting for lunch. We ordered Chips with Salsa and Queso as an appetizer and sadly that was the best thing that we ate. My partner got the Schezuan tacos with cheesy grits and I got the Krazy pad thai. My pad thai was so greasy and the shrimp in it smelled shellfishy. Honestly, the smell of the pad thai reminded me of my wet dog and made me sick to my stomach. My partner who is usually not a picky eater couldn't even finish his second taco. Overall this place is overrated and I will not be a return customer. Not sure if it was because it was lunchtime, but the other user photos definitely do Not look like the food I was served. buyer beware.

XrrzQteMsOJxcXw8m7O8zw.text: I really like the food, their jalapeno cheddar cheese grits are my favorite. The service was a little slow but our server was very friendly. If anything they are always so busy that the place is super loud so is not good if you are looking for a place to have a good meal and a nice conversation.

kmDwZq74P-o6du65ny2Muw.text: Hands down the best place in town for tacos. If you want fish tacos, look no further. Their fish/sea selection is awesome: crispy ceviche, salmon, seabass, fried shrimp, tuna, oyster. Also worth trying is the cuban and pulled pork. Oh,oh . . . and for your sides, I recommend the jalepeno grits.

-ky7eHiLySemXPn2jw2mhQ.text: I was hesitant to go .. but we were seriously impressed about the food.  It was DELICIOUS!!! I am def going back to try everything!! Its a mix btwn asian/ louisana flavor .... I do suggest everyone try it

7heulWoSlQQrQRhsE2W33Q.text: OUCH....this describes my experience here.  3 star concept....3 star funky fishy decor.....1 star execution.  I can forgive a place for being a bit frantic on a Friday night but ummmmm your restaurant was just half-full.  Hmmmm.  So my fellow yelpette and I were here last Friday and immediately you notice the energy of the staff.  Frantic really doesnt seem to describe it.  Terrified seems to fit better (I know we are gorgeous and thus intimidating but please really guys.....har har...)    Yes loved the $2 IceHouse but things went downhill quickly from there. The special on the chalkboard by the hostess stand was winking at me as soon as I walked in the door.  $13.95 for Red Curry Fish with rice and a side salad.  When I ordered the special from the waiter I had said I would like the curry more on the mild side and he said 'yes yes' and appeared to write that down.  So yes I was very surprised when I got a shrimp appetizer instead of what I ordered (yes it was another special listed on the board).  It wasnt as though it was supposed to be sent to another table, our waiter literally had no idea what the specials were and just decided to pick one for me?!  Thus ensued more frantic behavior from the staff.  When I did get my dinner (while my lovely dinner partner just picked politely at her plate so as to not be rude)  the dish was fine (not great) but the side salad was lost in Never Never Land....  So when he brought the check and had charged me the full amount, I politely pointed out that either he adjust the bill or bring me a side salad to go.  He did the latter.  This place is a non-repeat for me.....there are just too many other options that are fab and consistent less than a mile in any direction.  Bad Fishy!

bdNr38FdDE58oZMNVlbHmg.text: saw them on food network so we wanted to check it out.  super eclectic decor with great service. the food was ok. I'm glad we stopped by. would love to check out their other dishes.

BrRl3qD1E2YUpKoH3MwuMg.text: We first went here with friends for half price tacos.  I had shrimp tacos and grits.  I had never had a shrimp taco before and it was just divine!  There were two tacos, dressed with cabbage and a spicy pineapple salsa.  I do not eat grits, but thought I'd give these a try because of the cheese and jalapeno in them.  These grits are to die for!  They are creamy, cheesy and have just enough kick to be a little hello in your mouth.  The service our first visit was a bit show, even though we were the only guests there.  We were all out of beverages so I walked up to the bar to request refills and reorders.  The owner was standing there and completely flipped his lid, screaming and yelling at staff who were out back smoking.  LoL. The service for way better, even though I was mortified!  Since then, we visited almost weekly for a variety of foods and great drink specials.  The good is always fresh, the flavors and good are consistent and enjoyable, and the service had been well above average.  If you're looking for a really casual place with an outdoor eating area and a separate outdoor bar.  This is the place!  They have great food, great prices and specials, and a variety of foods made well and they are very consistent with good service.

4up4DMrbSXai6EIgrYzWJA.text: Yes, very nice.  Had the brisket tacos with a side of black eyed pea salad in honor of New Year's Eve.  Both very good but especially appreciated the salad.  Wife had shrimp and grits.  That too was very good.  Topped it off with a peach cobbler.  Nice atmosphere, great service from Chris.  Will definitely go again.

FgJrUZboPYVB6sCsHETLvg.text: What's my new favorite place for casual eats in the Queen City?  You guessed it Krazy Fish.  If you want to have the same experience I had  I suggest grabbing a seat on the patio - asking for Susan to wait on you - order a couple of mojitos and some tacos.  What kind of tacos?  Well the one thing I can say about Krazy Fish is you will have plenty of options to choose from  and there is a lot more than just  tacos on the menu,  Ceviche, steak, curry's, tofu, etc. etc.  On the recommendation of some great yelp reviews I went with the tacos.  I was so happy with my meal the pulled pork taco was my favorite and Danielle G. right on with the Pink Gold sauce it truly was a amazing.  Put this place on the top of your list to try and save room for the berry cobbler a completely unexpected delicious surprise.  Oh and before I forget the prices rock.

i7MVtzzRhmZLOU0_2wvISw.text: For me just so-so. I have been twice and both times ordered the shrimp. A taco and the po-boy and both times it looked and tasted like the shrimp came from a can. The atmosphere and staff are nice so I hate to rule it out. I may try brunch but will not go out of my way.

OFgm40kCboobks_xewny_Q.text: we came to to the decision to eat here because we hadn't been and we are too lazy to cook dinner at home.   it was probably the best idea we'd ever had. EVER.  i got the calamari tempura tacos, my boyfriend got the shrimp tempura tacos. it had really great sauce and those shells are like, who came up with these taco shells because you could probably fill them with anything and it would be instantly delicious.   dont let the decor throw you off and when they ask you if you want desert you must say you want the orange brownie concoction or you will regret it for the rest of your life. i ate it a few hours ago and all my girl scout cookies now taste like crap compared to that brownie thing.   bottom line: eat here. order the tacos and orange brownie. have the greatest day ever.

XxLdZw9HwYOcWhr1k0MHWQ.text: I love that place. Great food! Vegetable Tacos are my favorite. Love dollar mystery Beer. Kwel stuff hanging up. Great staff.

_wYtAcqHWQ1Jbyn7rjsSGw.text: FUN & ECLECTIC!  What do you like?!?  Asian Fusion, Caribbean, Latin American, Mexican, Sandwiches, Seafood, Soul Food, Southern, Tex-Mex, Thai, Vietnamese...then go to Krazy Fish!  SO many options, friendly servers, and KRAZY good!

CT4ITSa9iaBmzIWz7nTaSA.text: They were smoking a brisket and ribs today so naturally we tried the brisket tacos and the jerk ribs. I have no complaints on either of those. The sides were very average. The squash casserole was really weird and did not taste fresh. Despite the lackluster side dishes the place overall was great, and that brisket was delicious!  I'll definitely be back.

DWOGmpgFBNwGY1aL41sfIw.text: Great shrimp cocktail. Fish tacos were decent, their beef tacos were really good. Prices were pretty good too. Highly recommend

CbmgUgB0XmcstoyB-nLnFA.text: After my first visit last August, I immediately fell in love with this place.The food, the drinks, the wacky decor, the atmosphere, I had finally found my "spot". I have periodically frequented Krazy Fish since then and after each visit in the recent months I must say my opinion has changed dramatically. Although the atmosphere lately is anything but fun and upbeat and downright uncomfortable at times, I find myself returning for the simple fact that the food is always delicious. As for the drinks, I have to say it's hit or miss, most of the time it seems the person behind the bar is basically "winging it". They have a decent wine and beer selection and always have beer specials so I would recommend going that route considering it's hard to screw that up. The service has never been over the top great which I have to sum up to poor management and lots of yelling going on (even with a full dining room) and at times looks to be down right nasty. I have personally witnessed servers on the verge of tears which would explain new faces just about every time I have dined here. Such a shame that this place has so much potential but who wants to dine at a place where it seems that there is always some sort of turmoil brewing behind the scenes? I would definitely recommend the food, however, let me suggest you call in your order and eat it in the comfort of your own home so that you can fully enjoy your meal. The Salmon Tacos are the best and will not disappoint.

tOTtxGMqX2y9FkTuOAmuMA.text: Yes please! Pros: Amazing food! Always get the special.  Best grits Original menu Parking Never a wait Great drink specials - especially the sangria pitcher  Great vibe, cool patio  Really friendly and attentive staff  Cons:  Not open on Mondays   This is my favorite for "Mexican." It's not your traditional Mexican, but they have the best fish tacos ever! I love this place. Every person I suggest it to feels the same.

JTzYfrMSTlv_SYINmiqAEA.text: Love Krazy Fish! Best hidden brunch spot in Plaza Midwood. Prices are super reasonable and wait staff is always so friendly. Great midweek taco specials as well.

u1-7RkZCXks2AarZcrSV3g.text: Excellent service and prompt.  Quite accommodating Ceviche was fresh and flavorful, but the calamari was bland though perfectly fried.

1GbqwCbBdy7Tpwk_vx7-7w.text: What a great Plaza-Midwood spot! It's shame these funky old places are slowly disappearing, so I'm glad this one is still here. Great southern-Asian-Soul-fusion food, friendly staff, and a really fun cool funky decor. Yes it's tatty around the edges, but it's just an awesome spot for lunch or dinner. Filled with local families on weekend nights, but for me the best thing is weekday lunch on the outdoor covered patio on Central Avenue. Lots of creative specials, really fun food, and just a fun place to hang out. Definitely a "local" favorite, so you'll lots of neighborhood folks there. That's a great bonus in Charlotte. Give it a try for relaxed, fun, and very creative food.

yL_dTz2xJC_LKcZwLowXvA.text: I have only been here once before, and it was for brunch. I realize that my review is most likely based on a fluke, but I have not been back.  My sister and I came here for a weekend brunch, as she lives nearby.. Unfortunately any place that ends up making you sick, it's hard to want to go back. Sadly both me and my sister ended up sick that day. I probably will go back, it is only fair to give a place another chance.. I'm just not sure when that will be yet...  The service was Ok. Not standout, and a tad on the slow side. Everyone was friendly enough.

0nK9z1PDqU91LeGLT6VlTw.text: This has become a regular Wednesday evening spot for me.  Half price tacos and bottles of wine cannot be beat!  Love the eclectic atmosphere.  The service is always outstanding.  Must have the tuna tacos, nice big chunks of tuna enveloped in a soft taco shell.  Definitely worth a try!

jXunDo60UTZeiz1gmxcaeA.text: Really great bar and grill that we found from food network DDD. After going on a hike at Lake  Norman State Park, my lovely wife said "I want a nice fat glass of wine!" as we were pulling into the parking lot and Krazy Fish was more than happy to oblige! See, picture of the fattest glass of Pino Noir (her favorite) I have ever seen. We both thought the Asian Green Curry Mussels were the best we have ever had. She had the Thai Chile Seabass Tacos which is worth the drive up from Columbia SC (one of the chalk board specials). I had the Salmon Tacos which were also excellent.....but the mussels were the BOMB!  Can't wait to come back. YAY Yelp!

8saYIcqCvb_IaEDzGXGILw.text: I went here with some girlfriends for lunch at the beginning of a fun, laid back weekend visiting Charlotte for the first time. We loved the cute atmosphere, and the waitress was very friendly and attentive. We enjoyed the peach mules and peach tea for cocktails. I had the pulled pork tacos with blueberry chutney with cheese grits as a side. It was all very tasty. I would definitely recommend giving Krazy Fish a try!

xp4q93YBukz78HPqrOEnWQ.text: Wow just wow. We had passed by this place several times and even saw it on Diner, Drive in's and Dives. Finally decided to stop and wish we had done it much much sooner! Missed getting a picture because we just devoured it all. We started with the potato balls and both got tacos. My husband got the lemon grass tofu with the blueberry curry. Amazing! I had the mahi mahi tacos. So tasty. I love that they make fresh tortillas which is hard to find in Charlotte and being from Texas handmade tortillas is where it's at.

cJOeFcW2iEXrOTgDvtbPvQ.text: Food was terrible. It tasted like it was reheated. I purchased both a fish and shrimp Krazy Fry, but there was nothing fried about it, it was chewy and not crispy. My fish didn't even taste like fish and the lady acted like she didn't want to touch my hand to give me my food (to go order) she placed my food on the counter beside her for me to get it.  I don't know what kind of "cornbread" they have but it's not like any cornbread I've ever had. I will never eat here again.

4g6XOVgvzxcvrTWReiF5SQ.text: Gave this place a try from the recent Groupon.  Phenomenal food and much better then Cabo Fish Taco. It's owned by the same owners however it seems they have deeper flavors and much more value and portions when it comes to the fish on their tacos.  Their tacos is the same texture when it comes to their taco shell slightly fried like Cabo Fish Taco.  Their menu and style is interesting as they have food items and flavors of Asian, Jamaican, Mexican, and Soul southern.  You cannot go wrong with any of their tacos. Make sure when you walk in and look at the chalkboard for their specials. That's what we did when it comes to their grouper and sea bass tacos and I tell you what, they were AMAZING and do not skimp on the fish!  Just got me another Groupon and can't wait to come visit again!

xIXsXw-kxyaPQTnE_mTaHg.text: I rode by this place so many times. Well today was the day to stop and I'm glad I did. The food is fantastic and the customer service was on point. I had the Seaford Creole, it was so good and I didn't have to wait long for my food to come out. I will be back more frequently.

kYX7m6xZxkHhfv2xqGa0iw.text: Ever since I tried one of their dishes, I've been trying to find my way back.  Finally managed to drag my hubby out to check out this restaurant tonight!  As expected, he loved it as much as I did.  It's truly a "Krazy" looking place, somewhat of a dive with lotsa funky decorations floating about...and the menu is quite eclectic, featuring everything from Southern American and Cajun, to Thai and Indian!  There were so many mouth-watering options, it was quite hard to choose...but I went with one of their fancy house specialty,"Seafood Creole".  Although it was a bit too heavy on the sauce,  the spicy flavor lived up to my expectations.  As expected, I also enjoyed the fried varieties of seafood in this massive dish (huge portion)!  My husband went with one of their customized "Rotis", and he enjoyed every bite of it.  Did I mention that they also have amazing Gumbo soups??  It's too bad that we live so far away from this restaurant, but with such Krazy good food at a value (and great service too!), we WILL return!

Ke1runsL_e0qNkqw_MpTsQ.text: I enjoyed everything with the exception of the Mac and cheese, which tasted like an off brand Kraft boxed version. That aside, the seafood creole platter was huge and flavorful. I wish the tacos had more seafood than their signature slaw, but I still cleaned my plate, so what does that tell you?   We had a great conversation with the staff and the service was top notch. A few bites in, my date declared that we needed to return to Krazy Fish in the future.

rhJGLy86cxnT3rDv4mZBOw.text: I love the chill atmosphere Krazy Gish has. Theo waiter was so helpful and I got an amazing dish. He said they are now for their grits best in Charlotte and I believe it!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

35Dvi0kzA_KvIGuDui6ipQ.text: Just finished eating at the Krazy Fish. VERY DISAPPOINTED with the management. Wait staff were great. BUT found a fly in the food!!!!! The waiter replaced the grits but I was too grossed out to eat them  When the check came there was no compensation for my gross food! I spoke with the manager who kept insisting that since they gave me a fresh dish they would not comp it. I told him there was no way I could eat it - kept thinking about the dead fly I almost ate! The manager then talked to the owner in back, he said, but the owner couldn't be bothered to come out to talk to me. He gave his manager the message that there was nothing he could do. Bottom line - check the Food for bugs before you eat it and if you find one, they obviously don't care. Not even an apology.

ikWQXLyODv6eW8MWGCIvbA.text: Always been great food and fantastic service with friendly staff...of all kinds. Always enjoy sitting outside on patio.

WaxthYklUvoWdaSyH8PkUg.text: This is a neat place to visit... Unique atmosphere- lots of interesting pieces.  Family enjoyed our fish tacos!

ravIFA_C3exhKLGzTwEAgA.text: The service and food is great! I had the lunch menu the first time I was there and I had the taco ceviche and it was one of the best I had. My friend had the Shrimps and Grits, the same, he loved it. I then tried their brunch menu, let's just say I'm hooked.

tpOg43Q7ZTZvtoMYSFTMIQ.text: The menu is promising but I ordered the wrong thing my first time here. The Blackend Mahi Mahi Tacos with Kimchi aren't good at all. The side of cheddar jalapeno grits are great though!   Next time I'll try the Pad Thai or Sauteed seafood

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Mahi Mahi tacos with cheddar jalapeño grits

LHaoa5NOkYjmN6qN5tLFJw.text: The seafood creole dish I ordered was good, not great. It had a mixture of fried and steamed seafood. I much rather have all steamed just because it would compliment the taste of the creole sauce more.  The tacos that my friends ordered was um... bleh! For me the chicken was bland and dry. Veggies should have been fresh?? Come on guys!  Well, I guess the distinctive part of the menu was the gallery of different ethnicity because it had Cajun to Asian (yes, theres pho on the menu).  Service was bumble. She messed up 3x on our order. At first I thought she was drunk from her bright red face but realized after I left that she was only high.

yUpDgEpBU1XJu-fBZVXGlQ.text: I went there with my wife (who happens to be Thai so pretty knowledgeable) .  Sashimi was outstanding and an item not on the menu but is special...Jimmies special...chef is authentic Asian...you may have to ask for it first and make sure Jimmie is in kitchen but it is awesome .. you will not be disappointed ..............

OyBN6TXO_ryI5zT81270Yg.text: The service kept me going back for a while. It's always been good. The food is fun...and a bit different...in a good way, but doesn't seem consistent. Depends on who is in the kitchen I guess. I will say they've got the most amazing house salad. Try it. Love the patios.

mFBQdB5eaG--3xNp3qR7bA.text: This place is awesome! The food is delicious (I had the blackened tuna tacos) and our server was so attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. If you choose to eat here, you will not be disappointed!

5QxYkuDwB0cwkfe6ejydIA.text: If you are looking for a top notch basic breakfast (with some creative twists), don't waste an hour waiting on a table at Zada Janes, because you will most likely be seated immediately at Krazy Fish AND have a better meal with guaranteed better service. I also love Krazy Fish for lunch or dinner and they have menu options to please everyone in a large group.

ngSk9rLsA4g3QSFU7ynIYQ.text: Bottom line... Order the tacos, skip the entrees.   I've been on the hunt for a legit fish taco joint after Cabo left me wanting more.   What was ordered...   - Szechuan Salmon Tacos. Yum. The salmon was nicely cooked and the toppings and sauce really complimented the fish. This dish is on the sweeter side. For the side, the jalapeno cheese grits were excellent. Super rich and creamy but I didn't get any jalapeno heat or flavor. I'd get them again. I really appreciated that the flour tortillas were lightly fried, which gave them a nice texture.   - Blackened Tuna Entree... Small portion of "blackened" tuna. The fish was taco quality, not super high-grade. It came out overcooked and flavorless. Served with canned green beans, flavorless rice topped chicken gumbo. The best part of the meal was the starter salad. For $19, I was pretty disappointed at the plate that came out. They really should take this off their menu. I guess it serves me right for ordering something other than tacos at a fish taco place.   I'll definitely be back for the tacos.

M1CYlo1jiR7jUUTT-0DeQg.text: Don't mind if I do...1/2 price tacos between 4-6pm everyday! Also, they have "bartender's pick" beers for $2 (for the risk taker in all of us). I enjoyed my experience the first time that within days I was back for more.  This is a funky restaurant with homemade decor. You'll find "Krazy" interpretations of fish hanging from the walls and ceiling! They've converted an old Pizza Hut to house their yummy tacos and Southern sides.   The service was friendly and the food came out quickly, yet freshly made to order. My first visit I ordered a special Schezwan salmon taco. It was very flavorful! The next time I had the Ceviche tacos. Unless you like a lot of tang from limes, you may want to pick another one. I didn't care for all the zest...it actually made my tongue feel raw. Hubs had the lemongrass tofu both times...don't stop a good thing when you have it, right?!   Fun, funky, and fresh is a good way to be...we'll be back, Krazy Fish!

BPU1riBwzNmQYHzxZsCGRw.text: Love the eclectic decor. Sat outside by the bar and smelled like a dirty bar, not very appetizing. The huevos rancheros was pretty good but excited to try the tacos next time. Our server was very kind and helpful!

TxjYVD0KOSAauDAqHbwFbA.text: This place is KRAZY!  I've spied it off of Central for a while, but just never got a chance to try it until now.  It is really hard to anticipate what to expect with this restaurant based on the reviews, but the place has it's very own personality - a unique one at that.  The weather was nice so we decided to sit outside on the patio.  It did eventually get pretty cool, but nothing that a margarita couldn't fix.  I tried the "Ghetto Surfer" which was pretty good.  The other drinks on the drink menu sounded super unique and worthy of at least one try.  The menu is a bit overwhelming since in the first 30 seconds I was reading about tacos, then right next to it is korean inspired fair... or if you weren't starting to get dizzy reading the descriptions, there is thai, southern style food, and other food types.  Great if you were feeling adventurous, but I would not recommend it if you were expecting a certain (one) genre of food.  Our server was nice and told us about the specials.  I went with the special:  Szechuan Salmon Tacos with a side.  I chose jalapeno cheddar grits.....  DELICIOUS!  My plate was clean in a matter of seconds.  Overall a CRAZY.... but good crazy... experience.  Can't wait to come back to try the ribs [in blueberry sauce??!!??].

CeVvQMdD1AJea0S_nsamgQ.text: I have tried so many types of tacos and have loved them all! The Mac and cheese they offer as a side is one of my favorites in town. I always tell my friends "try the Mac and cheese!"    Very cool atmosphere and nice staff. Had a couple nights where they were randomly closed though, so I'm not sure what was up with that.

bjCSbTRl61OV3Ct1vnWWpA.text: First time in and stopped for lunch. The board at the door had a great list of specials, but when seated we couldn't see it. When we asked our waiter, he didn't relate anything we had seen on the board and only pointed at items on the menu.   Had the glazed edamame as an appetizer - it was edamame drizzled with a terriyaki (I think) sauce. Tasty. Both of us ordered the Krazy Grill with two options - both had chicken, one with pork and the other with beef. The chicken was excellent but the beef pieces were dry. The sides were good and the portions ample sizes. Both had enough to take half the dishes home. We weren't overwhelmed or over the moon about the place, but pleased enough to go back to try other menu items.

enWOnK6OvUSTWP9x8Bm8iw.text: My cousin and I went her Sunday 3/12/17 after the snow settled for what was advertised as "Brunch."  We were highly disappointed that brunch was actually a mediocre breakfast.  My cousins roasted potatoes looked terrible and in her words tasted like the potatoes were molded.  She complained to the server and he of course took no interest.  Our French toast was ok nothing to write home about.  Worst eggs in America.  We both agreed we would never return for any meal.

FCDAseBFT1LmPWSCV-ApFw.text: Heard of them from the Food network show with Guy. The Fried vegetables are good! They have a unique style and its kinda cool I guess

2hnP2noqf63H4IVtQbt_7Q.text: I have lived in Plaza Midwood for a year now and am so sad it took us this long to discover Krazy Fish. This may be our new favorite restaurant in CLT. The food was delicious, and served promptly. The atmosphere and decorations are fun. Our server Porter was great! He helped us navigate the menu and offered tasty suggestions. If you haven't been, stop what you're doing and go!

9dH0tB2OTmDyqScKzZB4vA.text: Another place I'm annoyed at...why didn't I find you earlier? My husband and I were STARVING after a taxing morning of...doing taxes, so we decided to check out someplace new. We decided on Fern because we'd been wanting to check it out for a while based on friends' recs. Thank goodness they are closed on Mondays or else we'd never have found Krazy Fish!   All tacos were half off today, and we were informed the same is True from 4-6 daily. I got the scallop tacos with jalapeno grits and my husband got the Thai tuna tacos with Mac and cheese. Nevermind that the sides were not chosen to complement our entrees, but rather based solely on waitress suggestion and yelp tips. Everything was Krazy good. We left very satisfied and before tip, the grand total was  $11. Now that's just Knuts.

_rak1R3ApxjPkHMt5nyqfw.text: This place is so close to getting 5 stars, it's almost painful to punch it down to 3. But that's exactly where it is.   The good:  The wait staff is *awesome*, really laid back, on point, getting you what you need when you need it, with smiles, style and friendly banter. Our waiter was a very cool dude and we enjoyed his presence.   We also like the atmosphere. The outdoor seating is a creative project of junkyard items sculpted and painted into what looks like blossoming garden all around you, and somewhat protecting you from the traffic on Central.   And the menu is great. A nice mix of meat and vegetarian options, and some exotic variations on tacos.   But, as with all restaurants, all of this is precariously balanced on top of the food.   The bad:  My wife got the blackened tuna tacos. They gave a *generous* portion of blackened tuna. And therin lies the problem. It was mostly just fish, slightly fishy fish and tons of it, juicing out and making the taco soggy. I got the potato tacos, which were indian spiced with a blueberry chutney. They tasted similar, but not quite as vibrant as samosas you'd get at an Indian restaurant. They were fairly dry, and again, it was just two large lumps of potato really. The blueberry chutney was very good though. Both of our dishes could have easily been kicked up a few notches to really round out a great experience.   We will be back to give it another shot. The mixed bag of reviews this place has makes me think they have a few different cooks who aren't all on the same level. Seems to be a lottery whether you'll get amazing food or mediocrity. I find it to be that way at many Charlotte restaurants, and you know what? That's a real shame. Pick it up Charlotte.

dd0nzpg_WUFfQNfGPWYlYQ.text: Krazy Fish is hands down my go to restaurant when I am trying to show off the best Charlotte has to offer.   It's got a funky, fun, hippie atmosphere and it's laid back ambiance is really contagious, this is especially True for some of the people who work there. The staff is fantastic but make sure you go there with some patience, order 1 more drink than you typically would, and enjoy the experience.   Their tacos are creatively delicious works of art. I've tried all of them and have yet to be disappointed. Same goes for their sides. My all time favorites are their beets, side salad and squash casserole. Those side choices might make me sound like an 80 year old man, but I just can't help it. They are too good.   Little secret, if you love their Seafood Diablo (a heavenly mixture of Asian seasonings/curry with all the best seafood you can think of) and it's not a nightly special, ask your waiter if the kitchen would be willing to make it. They always have every time we've gone and asked.   Krazy Fish always has some krazy specials, those paired with their menu have yet to disappoint me in the 30+ times I've been there. What ever the chefs were inhaling when they were creating their culinary masterpieces has me coming back for more and singing their praises.

nvdq62g750xMyVKR0C26lA.text: Seriously strange, this place. From the Mad Scientist Acid Trip Under the Sea decor to the banana salsa to the...just...huge, newspaper sized menu, there are some really outta-the-norm things going on at Krazy Fish.  And I gotta say, I likey.  Things are messy - ya, there's brownie-filled orange cups for dessert for cheap, but they're overfilled, spilling out a bit. A salsa brought to the table in an icy squeeze bottle. A cold, intestinal coil of cheese grits solidifying while your sandwich is steaming hot. Water all over the bathroom floor. Corners, art to run into. Cilantro in everything, all hail the cheapest herb, garnish, chopped, springs tucked into your taco, sandwich, salsa, everywhere.  It's almost, kind of a foodie joint, because anything, anywhere, on the menu, can be put in any burrito, any sammich, any taco. There are near-infinite combinations of flavor happening and not a lot of steering going on - a gruff rec by a waitress, that's about it - so it's easy to choose and end up with something freaky-not-good. OR (like moi) you could get jittery with excitement, anticipating what lemongrassy tofu, pickled jalapenos, and coconut curry could possibly taste like, and WHOA it kinda worked, even if it was a little sweet. Things are, here. Sugary. Riding that edge of too much. Not taking the plunge.  Other options for veg's - tempura vegetables, potato cake. You can have a potato cake taco. Dare ya.  House slaw is riskily weird, but good - toasted cumin, a little bitter, Indian flavors.  There are like, 10 salsas. I even enjoyed the banana, sort of.  It's beautiful that no one worried about foodie trendy BS when designing this space or menu. It's just all really Krazy, in an homage-to-East-Charlotte-ethnicity kinda way. Tacos, bolillos, banh mi, burritos (er, roti), viet, mex, thai, indo, chinese, whoa.
