Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

xK9bZGS_F49zX2zEouJJQQ.text: Wonderful tacos! We had wasabi salmon, potato cakes, sea bass taco and ceviche. All were very tasty. My friends really enjoyed how flavorful the food tasted. The decor of this diner made for interesting conversation.

nXlmgR91CIU9ze7SwX87MA.text: I like Krazy fish, but I don't love it. The vibe is cool, the service is good but something is still off. I think that 'something' might be a little bit the food and a little bit the atmosphere.The menu looks so interesting when you're reading through it.. it's one of those menus that gets you all confused because you want to try everything - the tacos, the roti (essentially a burrito), the pad thai, the potato pancakes - there's so much variety! The food didn't live up to my expectation though. There was nothing bad about the food, but it wasn't as flavorful as I was expecting it to be. I didn't leave the restaurant thinking "oh that was a soul satisfying meal"  The ambiance - it's super casual, colorful, and friendly. It was a little annoying to have two completely different TV channels playing in the background + music.. it made for a noisy (not in a good way) atmosphere. I'm all for loud places, but usually there's some sort of harmony between all the noises in a restaurant, and that was not the case here. I'd say it's worth checking out if you're looking for a local, casual hang out with decent food and good daily drink specials.

pZx29739lIaXD1C7baOmLQ.text: Possibly the worst food ever!  Waffle House looks like fine dining compared to this. My husband and I recently moved to the area and had several recommendations to try Krazy Fish. I so wanted it to be our new neighborhood spot, but was really disappointed. We started off with chips and salsa which were somewhere around $8.00 and was nothing but a small bowl of bottled salsa with Real Lime added and chips straight from the bag. I then chose the Cuban tacos.  The worst food I have ever had.  The tortillas were rained. The smelled like moth balls.  My husband had some sort of fried fish that tasted and looked like it had been under a heat lamp all day and you guessed it....straight from frozen box to fryer.  All this for around $45 including one cocktail and a beer. If you are looking for good inexpensive eats in Plaza Midwood I would suggest the Diamond, Thomas Street Tavern or Whiskey Warehouse.  For nicer dinner, but still reasonable Lulu or Soul would be my pick.

oa_FKmtXHC_Q913DU3Dh3g.text: Last time!  It was great to hear the manager yelling and cursing at employees while young kids are in the place!  Don't waste your time.  It didn't feel like the a/c was on.

Zv-VA7IAihVFpUYaatpPjw.text: I just don't get the rave reviews. The food was sub par.  We started with the salsa and qeuso sampler. Everything tasted straight from a jar, especially the stadium style cheese.  The tacos are a greasy vinegary mess.  The shell seems deep fried, the breaded calamari was bland, and the banana salsa is the only thing that made the tacos manageable.  My fiance got soggy fish tacos, which others have stated on yelp, and couldn't finish them. We will not be going back.

pivCMWt5QAoSJpyKJ2BZfw.text: Krazy Fish is a great addition to the neighborhood.  I went twice in one weekend.  Yes, it was that good.  Tacos are unique with a delicious slaw that is both a little spicy and sweet.  Nice balance of flavors/textures and you can't beat the prices.  We'll be back soon!

eqokVYVTNWbhbidCiAG0cg.text: Went to Krazy Fish for the first time after giving up on the other local place for fish tacos due to decrease in quality and service.  I have to say we were very impressed with Krazy Fish.  The decor is wild but the food can't be beat.  We ordered the chips and salsa sampler using the suggestions from our wonderful waitress Tonya.  All the salsas were fresh and tasty.  We ordered the tuna tacos and they do not skimp on taco fillings!  There was so much tuna in the taco that it kept falling out!  It was perfectly prepared and the salsa complimented the other flavors.  Although the choice of sides are a little strange (cheese grits and mac n cheese with tacos?) it was all so delicious that we didn't care!  We also were fortunate enough to be there between 4-6 pm so our tacos were half price!  Even the regular price of tacos is well worth the money because of the generous portions of taco fillings and sides.  Tonya was attentive, helpful and completely on point with drinks, appetizers and entrees.  Most would think by the looks of the place that service would be lacking but that is not the case at all.  We will definitely be back and will share with our friends the great experience we had at Krazy Fish.

CYydb8V2-qFyNFKdE_mPSg.text: We stopped by Krazy Fish for a late Monday lunch, and left totally wowed. My expectation on seeing the menu was that it was too ambitious, that  no one could successfully deliver on such an ecclectic fusion but it worked and was amazing. I had the ceviche tacos with jalapeno cheese grits. Everything was impeccably fresh, delightfully different, and the service was great.

A9tESIMx1xK1WHH0Qpd-hw.text: I was a little leary of this place since it was lunch time on Saturday and we were the only customers. OMG.....what a surprise!  We both ordered the "Southern Fried Fish Tacos".....they were absolutely a delight for the taste buds!!!  The mojitos were not bad either. The decor is interesting and our waiter was great.

3ZVuOS7D503-hcQ9G4Y_aQ.text: This place was fantastic! I never review restaurants but this deserves my time. Service was fantastic, they had great beer, the food was beyond words, and they have great prices! My favorite part is that I had an indian appetizer, a thai entree (in a burrito), and a southern side (amazing grits souffle)! Crazy mix of delicious flavors! It may be a little out there compared to our favorite Plaza Midwood restaurants but it's well worth it!

cvAEcqFZvuJ7a5gVi2C_Ng.text: * A preamble rant:  I have a rule - never go to a restaurant that is less than 2 months old.  too many bad experiences, and there are so many kinks to work out.  and every time i break this rule, i remind myself that i really need to obey my rules more.  having just opened a month ago, Krazy Fish is still experiencing some growing pains.  Today, they were still in the process of installing computers/registers, our itemized receipts were handwritten on blank receipt paper.  The server we had, while very nice and friendly, was brand new and it showed - drink mix ups, had to reconfirm order a couple times.  no serious detriments in time or service, but small annoyances that are specific to new restaurants.  thats why i have rules.  All that aside... the food is fantastic, a blend of mexican, asian, and seafood fusion.  they have tacos and bolillos, pho and pad thai, among many other choices, and most come with choice of chicken, pork, or various seafoods.  the menu is dominated with taco, roti, and bolillo possibilities, but there are many other entree options, and it took a fair amount of time to parse through the data and come to a final decision.  also their food is fairly cheap, everything we got was less than $10 per item.  the chef and management are really on to something.   -Roti - w/ cuban chicken, Jamaican curry, small salad + 1 side.  the "roti", or flour tortilla, is very good, and this is basically a GIANT burrito with rice, choice of meat, and choice of curry inside.  while the chicken was a bit dry and the burrito overall was dry and could have used more curry (which was delicious),  it was still very good, very filling.  my side was squash casserole, which was super cheesy but good. -Rotisserie chicken - w/ habanero apple butter, cornbread + side.  it was really good and the habanero apple butter really set it off.  side was seasoned green beans, also very good.   -Tacos - tempura chicken and shrimp, +1 side.  both chicken and shrimp were good.  you can mix n match your meats and your salsas.  fresh made flour tortilla was tasty.  roasted potatoes as side were really good.    inside decor is definitely plaza midwood-y, very artsy, sometimes frightening, sometimes confusing.  custom made tables and benches, and strange mobiles decorating the ceiling.  very unique in the style that we all know and love about that small strip of Central Ave.    bottom line:  in a month, after they have gone through puberty and worked out all the operational kinks, this place will be 5 star worthy.  i will definitely be going back.

RUpBBKcHonhKKDLPQl1fFw.text: I saw this new place pop up, and it looked interesting. After all the reviews I read, I figured it would be a cool place to try out with my girlfriend. When we first walked in, the decor and look of the place felt "cool". It seemed pretty eclectic, and definitely a fun atmosphere. The layout of this restaurant is open so that you can see all the other tables and the bar. We were greeted right away, and told of a number of great specials. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable and seemed to have good suggestions for drinks and food. The menu was very different and almost difficult to choose because so many things looked soooo good. The one main problem I did have with this restaurant is that when we were there, the man behind the bar seemed to be a manager of some type. He obviously was not having a very god day because he felt the need to yell very loudly at his staff, telling them that "if they did not do a good job they would be fired" and proceeded to go on and on about how every little mistake that a server made "could cost them their job". Now I am all for a manager making sure that his staff is following company policy, As I have worked in the food service industry for over 10 years, but it was very very disturbing and very uncomfortable for me and my girlfriend and I'm sure the rest of the guests to have to sit and listen to a manager go off on his staff for things like "not having enough pens" while trying to have dinner. I was very pleased by the job our server did. The food was amazing, the service was great, the manager behind the bar is what made me and my girlfriend not want to come back. These conversations, and tirades should have NOT occurred out in the dining room, and the manager should know better. That type of attitude from a manager/bar tender on a power trip is not impressive, and does not encourage me to come back. My suggestion is either order togo because the food is SOOO good, or go on a night when that guy isnt working.

sRBFsRhzpNTjuJtREuFfsw.text: Possibly the worst restaurant experience in the last 25 years. Food was not as described on the menu. Shrimp in the taco was not overcooked, a plus, but they were served in an "Old Elpaso" shell straight off the supermarket shelf. There was another protein substance in the taco that the server was told was chopped clam, but was really chicken. ???  There was also one long cilantro stem in the shell. That's it.   Not at all what was described in the menu and Truely awful.  Margarita was sub-par and the squash casserole was watery with large globs of stringy cheese. After I asked questions about what I was served and it was clear that I was unhappy (yet pleasant) our table was avoided by the server and manager. They made no effort to rectify their errors or make me happy.  I am not one to be critical, but this place is to be avoided.  Too many other people out there who know what they're doing and deserve your patronage.  If you have an open kitchen the folks preparing the food need to be aware and keep their hands off their faces and out of their hair.

R79yREEe5l-6mPs-E5kyzA.text: Hmmm, I want to give 4 stars for the creativity of dishes and side dishes served here but have to keep it at 3. First time I went to krazy fish (soon after first opening) this place gave me a great plate (burrito/ roti ) great service along with a side of passion.  Over the past year I've gone back a few times and none of that was even"sort of" delivered. Seems like the place is going downhill since its beginning days. Tacos were meh, I remember I ordered the chilly willy po boy, the shrimp wasnt so good, looked like that frozen popcorn shrimp out of a bag, however jalapeno and cilantro on top made me like it. My buddy got "cuban chicken" - not good. Some dry grilled chicken topped with a tomato sauce...  The side dishes are quite the variety. But as I've mentioned, quality-wise just seems to be going downhill... sides were cold & not as flavorful. Service was awful last two times... sigh. I really loved this place in the beginning.   I still really WANT to like this place!! But I'm being pushed away... not flying back anytime soon.

ZVVswEZ_u17QtQu1FaqbCA.text: Not too shabby.  Got a Groupon deal, and had to check it out.  Food: surprisingly good. I had the Green Thai Mussels, curry taste and spicy that was good. For dinner, I had ordered the fried scallop taco special that had cole slaw lettuce and slather of mayo something that was delicious on a white flour tortilla. My husband had ordered me shrimp and grits platter for take home last month - and it was delicious!  Place: strange.. Lots of different experimented objects hanging from the ceiling, with addition of street signs. But the venue did not deter me from entering the establishment with Groupon in hand and good reviews.  Price: it is really reasonable. You can get good lemongrass dish for $12.99. All fish tacos are under $12. The only difference is the big seafood platter are a little pricier.  Service: it was pretty good, but not A+. But if you need something, they can get you your needs quickly enough. It was busy around 7pm on a Sunday night, really?

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Late in taking this, cause I wanted to dig right in. It&#39;s the Green Thai Mussels!

STmrSZNcciFQcFr-CXSs0g.text: Had the Gumbo and Tuna Tacos w/pineapple salsa! Most excellent. Was even offered a table outside so I didn't have to leave my puppy in the trunk. Great staff who is aware of their customer need. I will return here and bring my friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna Tacos w/Mac n cheese and Gumbo w/cornbread.

vP9S_u7Ysafe_BER01xIEQ.text: Gone past Krazy Fish so many times.  It's a diamond in the rough of Central and it always sort of jumps out at you...but then it's too late and you're past it.  Well today we made a u-turn, and it was well worth it!  LOVE the artsy/hippy vibe that is visible in the art, music and menu.  This place blows Cabo Fish Taco out of the water - SO yummy!  Give it a try!

MWh7DVm5E9KwKc8VOg5K-Q.text: After not being able to get into Soul last night, we decided to try out Krazy Fish.  I've never been so glad to not get into a restaurant!    Krazy Fish has its own parking lot, which is nice in Plaza Midwood, and we were greeted as soon as we walked in.  The decor is fun and funky, and our waiter, Duncan, was friendly and helpful with menu suggestions since it was our first time there.  We tried the Krazy Grill with chicken, pork, jalapeno grits and squash casserole and the Cuban Chicken tacos with green beans.  It was all delicious!  I don't even like grits, but I couldn't stop eating these.  Everything had just the right amout of spice, and you can't beat the price considering how much food you get.  It almost felt like a Cuban Midwood Smokehouse, which is a compliment to both restaurants!

vwhmem9RcCKl8Hajh4gjyg.text: I think it's safe to say that we are regulars here. We come here at least three times a month. Or at least once a week. It's a part of our line up with ordering to go. As a frequent diner the food is consistent! Delicious every time. Never fails. We usually get the tacos and I've ordered another dish that came with two sides, and it was just as great. Their salsas are unique and fresh. The service is better than the food, and the food is pretty damn good. The people really make this place for sure.

j4UcIx88qDNAE9GWIfcAsg.text: I have been to Krazy Fish several times and absolutely love it!  They are consistent as well as my order.  The chips and salsa are a good starter.  The chips are not the best I have had, but they aren't the worse.  The salsa is what make the appetizer.  They give you 3 types of salsa, and my favorite is the pineapple based one.  I also usually get one of their delicious adult beverages whether it's a margarita, mixed drink, or sangria.  I always, always get 2 fish tacos with the grits.  First off, the grits are AMAZING!  They are a must get side unless you absolutely hate grits.  When it comes to the fish tacos, all of them are good.  I always get one of them as tuna and usually go for a taco special for the other one.  They are awesome and let you choose any 2 for only a little bit extra charge.  The staff is always nice and helpful, too!  Krazy Fish was featured on Triple D which is pretty cool!  The only downside of Krazy Fish is that I always crave it on Monday...the one day they are not open :(  My friends have also said brunch is amazing, so I hope to try it soon!

VgDZW6PrhHkFSzGls_pSfQ.text: This is such a fun, quirky little place. Great food, especially the curry dish they have on the menu! Service can be a little slow, but the staff is very nice.

SaeXpMQVyVhEtC_i2GF7Pg.text: I strongly recommend the wings, potato pancakes, and tacos. All are great. The mystery beer isn't half bad either. Krazy Fish is just a great place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo Chix Tacos with Black Eyed Pea Salad
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Szechuan Salt &amp; Pepper Jumbo Wings

GfqM-HkYypPkVadX2O6cTw.text: We love Krazy Fish Brunch on Sunday's! Try the Chicken & Waffles w/a mimosa.. Great and funny staff! Moderate prices and good food overall!

IhfOtzE_KaNuwOtFwc5alg.text: Krazy Fish is the first restaurant we went to Charlotte as my son is a huge DDD fan. And it was a great experience, starting with the decor and the style, followed by the people and the food. Our server was excellent - she knew the menu very well and helped us to make the right choices. We had the Roti, the tuna taco and a po boy - all were very nice and the sides just made it perfect. If you are in Charlotte, must pay them a visit.

SWb8E9TK0H7vhe_vYFCzPg.text: I'll preface this review by saying I have only been here once and with their extensive menu options it is quite possible there are 4 and 5 star items to be had.  First of all, from the outside, this place looks "crazy"...it reminded me of a trailer park or actually of my neighbor down the street that puts everything they can find that is tin in their yard and calls it good landscaping.  This place was like a junk yard with a fish theme but it was cool and certainly down to earth.  The inside decor remained consistent with the exterior.  Our waitress seemed really happy to be there and even sat down at our table to describe the specials and featured items on the menu.  I got the "act" but it was over done and I wasn't much in the mood for it.  I can just picture the staff meetings in the mornings.."ok do what it takes for shock value, just act crazy kids!! Make it a super fun environment."  Nah, it didn't bother me too bad and it was "fun" but my real pet peeve surfaced when the only menu choices she reccommended were the most expensive.  She went on to say "really for your first time in you have to go with one of the specials."    Against her wishes I went with the blackened tuna tacos that came with their house slaw and pineapple salsa on top.  They were decent but not amazing and maybe I am wrong in saying that for blackened tuna I expected it cooked through but it was really rare and cold...it just didn't work well as a taco.  I chose the squash casserole as suggested for my side and it was ok but lukewarm and not overly thrilling.  We ordered the cheesecake brownie ala mode but there was nothing cheesecake about the brownie...pretty standard, nothing special.  I give them credit for their creative menu and friendly environment but I won't make a habit of returning.  I will say it is worth going mid week when their tacos are half off...that may be more of a justified price.

ZEaafMgo3670hi977OB7_w.text: This place has eclectic decor & friendly staff. 2nd time here. The  food was just OK. I was surprised this restaurant made the food network.  Ordered the Cuban chicken with 2 sides (potatoes and green beans).  The food was bordering room temp. The chicken was a small breast/thigh and kindof weird to attempt to cut. Nothing special.  The potatoes were similar to ones I make a home, just colder. The green beans had a different flavor, but didn't amaze me. The best part was cornbread and I'm not even a big bread eater. One in our party received her burger well done when she was explicit in describing that she wanted it as rare as possible. They remedied this by quickly brining her another burger with more sides.  Came with a large party (8) and received our food in a timely fashion. However we never received refills on our drinks. Took a while to get our checks, despite there was a light crowd.  No plans to go back.

HiHjUR78F35k-q9UuBibMw.text: I have eaten here with the family a couple of times. Received a groupon for my birthday the first time we went. The restaurant is decorated kind of strangely but interesting. The food was decent and the service was the same. We will probably go back again.

oVsMVE_Ju_dvKI5W7axhFw.text: Big Fan here! One of the best places to grab quality late night food.  Decor inside is very quirky.  Normally, I'd label it as slum-y but it's laced with a perfect amount of funky re-purposed junk that just radiates fun and happy. Plus, I loved the sparkly tables.   Menu is equally as quirky. Pairings you normally wouldn't think of, but are a huge success! Lots of fish tacos, vegetarian options, appetizers. Flavorings range from southern to Vietnamese to Mexican to Indian.   I recommend the lemongrass tofu tacos, they're off the chain! Perfect large portion of fried tofu, fresh handmade mini tortilla, krazy slaw (house made), and a blueberry tamarind chutney... YES!   I've tried other sides, but the JALAPENO CHEDDAR CHEESE GRITS are by far the most superior selection. Heavenly even.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. lemongrass tofu tacos with jalapeno cheese grits souffle

IRtGId-oWapIxZw3ex1dEw.text: The cheese grits are wonderful.  Had the garden omelet which was stuffed and tasty.  Nice wait staff.  Very friendly and attentive. With all the good restaurant choices in Plaza Midwood, this place is worth driving a few more blocks down Central.  Can't wait to try more of the menu.

xY-OCWyjdzXWoEKJkBazmA.text: Why, oh WHY did we wait so long to try Krazy Fish? When I think of the sublime shrimp and grits that I could have been stuffing my face with all this time...I weep for the loss.  Funky vibe, cool and casual. Beer menu could use some work (not really anything special on tap), but the food was awesome. Again, I'd order the shrimp and grits again any day of the week. Husband's calamari tacos were, as they say, "off the chain". Prices are super decent, especially if you stick with anything that's not on the "Entrees" part of the menu. We're eager to hit them up for the weekday half price taco special sometime, since that seems like the best deal in Charlotte.   How soon can we go back?

Jz87weISumTafBxi5ZJpbw.text: CAN'T MISS KRAZY FISH!!  I was back again in Charlotte on business. Thought I'd miss it but finally made it back to my favorite Krazy restaurant. Brought another local who'd never been, hoping to create more Krazy Fish Fans. And well, now that DDD and that Famous GUY has been here (check the plaque on the wall) it should be easier!   This time our most magnificent server Porter described the specials in such detail that I went for it and had the GreenThai Curry Mussels..so good, another reason to come back again! And I um forget which drink I had off the great drink menu.. because it was really good and I drank it all....plus we had to sample the $1 mystery beer, you just gotta ;-)   Porter brought us a sample of the famous jalapeno cheese grits, creamy cheesy goodness with just a little kick.  Then later described the dessert menu, in which one item sounded like food porn--winner! But it was getting late, so we ordered the warm bananas foster glazed cheesecake to go. Yummy.  #KRAZYFISH#KRAZY GOOD FOOD!# DON'T BE KRAZY GET IN HERE#FLAVOR JUMPS OFF THE PLATE INTO YOUR MOUTH @ KRAZY FISH!#$1 MYSTERY BEER, KRAZY GOOD DRINKS#KRAZY FUSION MENU #GRAB A FRIEND AND GET SOME KRAZY FISH!

ITYOaSV9Y-l6NCsOUbiHqQ.text: Krazy Fish is an interesting little Mexican fusion place. I used to come here fairly often when living in Charlotte.  The first time I came here I was WOWED and perplexed at why I had never even heard of this place. Before I moved to Winston, I was house hunting a couple streets down and stumbled upon Krazy Fish and decided to check it out.  It's not one of Charlotte's most popular eateries and is hardly ever busy from what I've seen...to this day I've tried to figure out why.  The tacos are great! My favorite is the ceviche taco, which they do well. They have all kinds of odd flavors such as blueberry BBQ (haven't tried it but it looks good).  Perhaps one of my favorite things about Krazy Fish is the $1 mystery beer. They don't tell you what kind of beer it is, but you get a glass for just a dollar! Whatever it was it didn't taste like pee-water, so it's a good deal!  The decor is a bit odd to me. Outside they have tons, and I mean TONS of little metal fish sculptures. Cool, right? Well, when you go inside, it looks like a dive bar. I don't think the interior really matches the exterior.  Also, it is quite a walk from the main strip of Central Ave, and the walk takes you through a bit of a shady area. So, you can walk, but heed caution. I wouldn't walk there at night.  It's a far cry less fancy than the places in Plaza-Midwood's main area, but if you like an artsy fish trap-type restaurant with cheap beer and good food, it's a great little eatery! Sometimes I prefer it over the bougie-ness of regular Plaza-Midwood.

TzwgAeasDUXQ73Dxx-F8JQ.text: I'd seen it on central and had plans to try it for a while but finally got myself over there. My fried fish tacos were fantastic. I think they might deep fry the tortillas too cause they were super flakey and awesome.  I also had a cup of gumbo and some sofrito beans on the side that weren't really blowing me away but I'll be back for those tacos and to try some of the other stuff.

ZEPKgS2UP7QmNqiPhUI-lQ.text: Last night I joined my mom and dad for dinner at Krazy Fish. They bought a groupon and asked if I wanted to join them for dinner. The food was amazing!!! My dad had the seafood creole and my mom had the pollard. The grits will make you slap few people , Mac and cheese she didn't care for but she's picky when it comes to her make and cheese. Our waitress  wasTHE BEST Deannte {hope I spelled you name correctly}. She allowed us to taste a few things since everything is spicy { my mom can't handle too much spicy} and she was very patient. Although I arrived late she helped me with everything I needed.   Will be back, the only pit is there's only one location in Charlotte. I will have to try the shrimp and grits with the chicken wings next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

Wb0CXo1PquzCePVu4M5aEQ.text: Tried this place yesterday and thought the food was ok.  I had the southern fried fish tacos which was really good and the potato salad which was not good at all.  They overwhelmed it with mustard, didn't taste good.  My friend ordered the chicken and waffles and received a chicken leg and thigh.  She told them she didn't eat dark meat and at first they were like they don't have white chicken- huh? Chicken and waffles are traditionally served with wings so if they don't serve with wings the menu should specify served with dark meat which it does not.  At a minimum The server should have explained that as well.  They finally brought out fried chicken tenders which looked like fried clams because of how tiny the strips were.

zNk5hCJQml1ZczznJhOCBA.text: This is my favorite place to go for brunch/lunch on Sunday. The menu offers a little something for everyone. The jalapeno cheddar grits are my favorite side. I try a different entree each time I go and I have never been disappointed. The servers really like the food and are very helpful with suggestions. The atmosphere is very chilled and colorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southern Pork and slaw on floured tortilla.
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roti - Southern Pork
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brownie Sundae

T2Oy4n2AviSP1aqWIyobsw.text: There few things that can speak to my soul like the Szechuan Salmon tacos from Krazy Fish. It is an excellent choice for newbies, as it is nothing short of perfection. The blend of spicy, sweet and sour of the Krazy slaw is a divine combination.  Speaking of divine combination, you can not go wrong with the ceviche as a starter!  In addition to excellent food, the cocktails aren't too bad. I had the Peach Bellini, which, in all honesty was not the best I have had. However, with the Sunday Bellini special...why not try a few until you find one you like.  The few sips of a friend's jalapeno margarita tells me it's the better choice.    And, as a Southerner, it's only right that I comment on their grits. They are creamy, fluffy, cheesy with an after hint of heat from the jalapenos. Not the best pair with the Szechuan tacos but wicked as a stand-alone nonetheless.   The service is great, the staff are knowledgeable, the drinks are good and I've decided that the chef is righteous (there's no other excuse for such goodness)...you can't go wrong here!

CiOeW-M6lnv1hMnRN7F5Og.text: What a unique and underrated restaurant in Charlotte! Our friends took us here after reaching about it and they were right! Upon looking at the menu, which is huge, I wanted to order about half of the things on it.   I ended up getting the Roti with southern fried Calamari and Lemongrass Curry with a side of Jalapeno Cheddar Grits. It was absolutely amazing. I loved the sauce the most. I would definitely get it again if there weren't so many other things I wanted to try on the menu. My husband got the Krazy Grill with Cuban Chicken and Potato Cakes with Habanero Apple Butter and sides of Jalapeno Cheddar Grits and Picked Beets. I liked what my husband got but didn't think it was as good as mine. I'm not a big fan of grits, but these were really good. They were a little spicy without being too hot.   We were seated right away and the service was really good. Plus they usually have a Groupon.   You get a ton of food for the price.  I couldn't finish all of mine. We will definitely be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Krazy Grill - Conan chicken and potato cakes with habañero apple butter, jalapeño cheddar grits, and picked beets
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roti - calamari with lemongrass curry

yUJtCCvD-zf0VK1_t1ZXeg.text: We went to Krazy Fish because another place that just opened on The Plaza (no names! You might figure it out yourself) didn't take any more patrons - they "had to close the kitchen" because they were "to busy". Whatever.  Krazy Fish however absolutely made up for it. It wasn't very busy (Wednesday night) and the waiter was very attentive. Everything came out extremely fast and was delicious.  We had fried calamari for starters, I had the shrimp & grits which were very good and far from the bland stuff you sometimes get. My wife had the mussels which also were good.  To add to this it was 1/2 priced wine bottles and we had a bottle of cab for $10. You can't beat that.  Only four stars? When you sit outside it's nice but it's also pretty noisy from Central Avenue.  All in all a good experience and we will be back!

HzDkwY57Q2OEkgcZIvMqtw.text: Came across this establishment due to a friends recommendation and was not disappointed at alllll! I can see why Guy Fieri paid them a visit. Menu is very vast, something for everybody.   I will admit, I went overboard while ordering and got the Shrimp Po'boy and Fish Tacos. MASSIVE PORTIONS and would recommend sharing since they each come with a side. If you're in the CLT area, this is a must see.

udxL_iYPiW2eTNH1kBtHGg.text: Fun place for drinks and food. Try taco tuesdays, $2 tacos that are super tasty. Good service

iG5JnXF9g1_NgJWruubIWA.text: Stopped in to satisfy a fried fish craving and boy did they deliver! They have a large menu that covers a large food palette- I'll be sure to return to try other things on the menu! Their grits were super creamy and delicious! The service here is phenomenal- the wait staff is super friendly and very helpful!! Will be back!

39ZNX_ICbhcjTa1SBAZqbA.text: Came here for lunch and I have to say I rather enjoyed it. Server was decent, we were sat immediately upon arriving and he was prompt with taking our order. Started off with their $4 brunch bellini which was good just could have done without the grenadine. I also ordered the Peach Mule which was delicious.  We ordered the Green Thai Curry Mussels as our starter and they were some of the best mussels I have had, the favors were perfect. For my entree I opted for the Seafood Creole and when I say it's a lot of food, it really is but I'm not complaining. It has both fried and  sauteed seafood (so best of both worlds) with a creole sauce over rice. I'm just upset I didn't know about this place before.

3oF22-ExoelzFcf-P3zmWw.text: A True dive. It's great seafood and funky interior. The green sauce they give with the fish is delicious. Get crazy and try Krazy Fish!

kYwIRrdCwLJlGLVKJiI48g.text: Everything is just great. Food, waiters and waitresses. The prices. I enjoy Krazyfish. Such personalities.

o-VBWjTNbvMtIr-NfXtQdQ.text: Walked here the other night since it was so close. Had never been but heard good things. Definitely gives you a beach vibe as soon as you make it into the parking lot. Staff was extremely nice. Got drunk specials which were fairly priced and delicious. Ordered the salsa and queso appetizer. It came with 3 different types of salsa (mango being my favorite). Calamari tacos were delicious and my girlfriend ordered shrimp and grits which was absolutely unreal. It was raining whe. We were about to leave and the waiter offered us bus tokens! Super nice guy. We decided to grab a drink at the bar and call an uber. Will absolutely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon tacos omggggg
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chips a salsa queso platter on point

JKj4adj8Wi5hTgq-y8jPiw.text: Total let down !! My friend suggested we try this place out and I informed her she is now permanently banned from making any suggestion of anywhere to eat lol . First what I would like to say Krazy Fish is the perfect name for this place because everything on the outside to the inside of this establishment looked crazy and kooky but in a good way ! Outside of that everything about this place rubbed us the wrong way from the food, to the drinks , to some of the staff!! I ordered the ceviche which was actually ok and I loved the fact that our waitress allowed me to test it out before ordering because it had such a distinctive taste . My friend ordered the cat fish dinner which she said was ok as well but both of us hated our drinks they were watered down and just not good at all no flavor etc. So my friend pointed out to me that on the menu it stated if your drinks came fast you couldn't get a refund or exchange which I thought was weird. Of coarse I didn't care because I'm not paying for something I don't like so I let the waitress know she told us how the bartender was having a bad day he got in a fight the previous day before as if that has anything to do with us we just wanted the drinks replaced . The bartender his self came out and apologized and mentioned how he didn't like the drink either that I chose so just pick another one . Side eye . He suggested the liquid marijuana which was overly sweet as if someone poured the entire jar of sugar into the drink . In the mist of it I stopped a young guy working there and asked what his name was and his reply was why!? Ummm so once he seen the look on my face he hurried and switched it up and I told him the only reason I was asking because I needed our waitress name because I couldn't remember it and needed to get her attention. By this time we were both over it and just asked for our checks so we could get out of Krazy Krazy Fish!!! Oh and may I add they still added the drinks on our checks although it was stated they would be removed neither of us touched our drinks money thrown down the drain .

bMbSvIjDzEYfT5t_LaXgZA.text: Came here on a Saturday night, place was busy but the wait staff was on point.  Got the fish tacos and they where delicious.  But the True stand out for me was the grits. If you come here I know you say grits but I must tell you it's a must at Krazy Fish.  They are truly delicious and out of this world.  We tried to find out how they are made but our waitress said that it's a secret.  I'll be back real soon.

YcBMs1AFRztKifWv0BV29A.text: This was our first time here. We came because of the Yelp! score. We enjoyed the mussels we started with but everything after fell way short of expectations. The szechuan tacos were over loaded and no bueno, weird flavor. Just not great. The Grits were good. The blackened cat fish was also not up to par. The green beans seemed canned and the fish was not seasoned well. To eat it I just poured the sauce from the mussels on it. We won't be back.

P-IvKNDTneGJjGtxCaXgjA.text: Was very impressed with the food here. Their grits are out of this world and the wings were excellent. Our waiter was very friendly and patient being that we had a big party of about 15-20 ppl the fish tacos are really good too

5jW6RCLsX7NrJvlUSZP4UQ.text: I had Salmon Tacos! They were amazing. Best salmon tacos I've ever had. I love the atmosphere of this place as well. They have great customer service. From the host that sat us, to the server and the servers that walked past. I asked what she recommended and she took my phone and came on here to show me photos of what I asked about and that's what I needed up getting! Definitely will be back for taco Tuesday for $2 tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

96Kcp__vtjzFaAvJUnF1UQ.text: Amy and Haley are the best!! We've had both ladies as our waitresses and they are so sweet. Amazing recommendations they've made! I get something different every time and I usually don't ever do that but I'm never disappointed! Charlotte has so many good food spots but this is one of the best by far! The food is to die for, the ambiance is really chill, and the service is outstanding. Definitely a place to try if you haven't because I did once and now I'm hooked!

8g-djvwftLiMAfRaPpSPtg.text: The fish was not okay, I did not enjoy it at all. I am throughly disappointed. I was expecting whole pieces of fried fish. $18 for nuggets. Not worth it at all the the squash casserole was not good at all and the cornbread was not ideal either. I did however order some gumbo so maybe they will change my mind with the gumbo. The waitress was very friendly though.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

jn-aNcdKVX5ULyF2XBdS7g.text: Wow..I can't even explain how bad my experience was here recently.  I wish I could give a negative star. Without writing an absolute novel, I'll give a few highlights.    Absolute WORST SERVICE I have ever received.  We were there for 2.5 hours!  The craziest part is the restaurant wasn't even busy.  It was actually pretty depressing how slow it was inside.  The only facade they had of business were the few people on the outside patio facing central. We were with our kids and they were perished.  Anyone with kids knows how hard it can be to not get their food and have poor service. Once they finally received their food it was disgusting looking.  They wouldn't touch it and I wouldn't blame them.  We ordered the chips and salsa trio and the salsa was ok, except for the fact the chips were so stale.  Seems like they just poured them out of a bag that had been opened for a couple months.  Everyone in my party got different variations of tacos.  Tacos were decent but not great by any means.  By the time we got the tacos everyone was so mad and ready to go we could barely taste them. Our waiter would NOT bring us the bill.  We went to see the manager / host whatever 3 times! We finally waited at the front and just stood there for another 20 minutes to get our bill.  There were so many other issues I could go on and on. NO ONE there ever apologized and essentially seemed mad at us that we were complaining! It was very obvious every customer in there was in the same boat.    Whatever you do, stay away from this place.  I really hate to say this because I'm all for some good dive spots and anyone trying to do something unique.  But when it comes to getting treated so poorly, it absolutely can not be tolerated.

rd_C8W7Ygy40MqFD7mF6KQ.text: Interesting decor, nice staff and GREAT music. The soulful sounds of 90's hiphop played while I visited, which was...amazing. Oh, and the food.. my friend got the seafood creole which was a huge portion and tasted great with so much seafood variety. I ordered the bulgogi (korean beef) with thai sauce roti. It was good, average. The jalapeno cheese grits are a good side dish. I enjoyed the salt and pepper wings as an appetizer, though my friend thought they were too salty.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salt and pepper wings
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

MfcpXYMD52HeHZuCvaHTbw.text: This is one of my favorite places to take guests from out of town--- such a fun, quirky environment and they serve up some seriously good food!  One of my all-time favorite things to order is the Green Curry mussels....and I don't even like mussels! But seriously, theirs are out of this world! Be sure to order some extra toast to sop up the delicious curry broth with. It's a huge portion too (even though it's marketed as an appetizer), so there's plenty to share.  Their sangria is pretty legit, and I almost always order a glass of that when it's on special.  Order the Bulgogi beef tacos with a side of Jalapeno cheddar grits, and you basically have the perfect meal! :)  **Oh, some of the other favorite things that I've had are the Peanut Butter Jelly wings, the lemongrass tofu tacos, and the blueberry tamarind sauce is delicious too**

2EQeeNYqRjF08fg5rnwtbg.text: Great place, nice location and very good food. Doesn't matter if you are having breakfast , lunch or dinner there. They've good good variety of American, Mexican and everything in between.

7IuQ2-KwuWJqc_9JS2rKbQ.text: I don't get to this side of town very often, but Krazy Fish has been on my bookmark list for quite a while... so when I happened to be close by around lunch time today, I decided to stop in and finally give them a try.   I ordered the blackened mahi tacos but am not a fan of slaw, so I asked if I could get lettuce on the side instead.  Yay, not a problem here!   The tacos came with a pineapple salsa that was quite enjoyable. The blackened mahi had a nice level of seasoning and the dish came with some sort of raspberry concoction to put over the tacos. Looked a bit odd, but the flavors went well together.    The only downside to my meal was the Krazy rice - it was rather bland. (Basically, sticky-ish  white rice with some carrots & peas but not a lot of flavor.)  I think next time I will skip the rice and try the jalapeno cheddar grits instead.   Overall though, I thought the food was pretty solid and I would certainly come back to try some of their other dishes.

IzQ5koGJ2z5hmo4zcu9s1A.text: The only good about this experience was the service.  Dark hair female (Friday night). I love good service and this girl gave it.  Not one complaint there.  If this could spill over into your food, you'd have a winner.  The food was overly salted and overly greasy.  Shrimp and grits aren't suppose to be a ladled level of grease. I could dig around in the grits and find some creamy parts.  But I was not over impressed.  We also has the mussels appetizer, the mussels didn't taste fresh and with seafood, that's a necessity for me.  The sauce was good. And that dish stops there.  I'm not sure I'll go to Krazy Fish again, one time was enough.

gpwHCdfcoMrCpbPjNWDtrw.text: What a cool place!! We visited Krazy Fish after my parents (visiting from IN) saw it on an episode of Triple D. We are so glad we tried it!! A little off the main drag in Plaza Midwood, this place is a little hidden treasure. The atmosphere is cool & funky. We had great service & the menu is huge & diverse. Krazy Fish offers many unique seafood dishes. Three out of four of us got the Seafood Diablo - a permanent off-menu special (and Guy's featured dish on DDD). They LOVED it - huge portion, but they couldn't stop eating! In addition to lots of seafood options, there are some great tofu veg options including Thai & curry dishes. Krazy Fish is a unique dining experience for visitors of Charlotte as well as locals. We look forward to going back with friends soon!

NXiOsa2GaJyiBM_YAfAfdw.text: Eh, everything is fried, it's fine if that's what you are looking for.  I was expecting more fish options.  Cute place though.

MJ8-bBaFXkb99nDNQLJs1w.text: Great pulled pork tacos! Great atmosphere for hanging out with friends! Not quite in Midwood, but close enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious Thai Curry Mussels

7po54OXFLgnxyeevzdOdmw.text: Food was good.  Had the Tuna Tacos and they were good.  Menu said that they were blackened and I didn't really taste (which is ok because I am not a big fan).   Had the jalapeno cheddar grits and they were a little runny.   Overall good for lunch.

hrb6jEkjYCV-1PagziU5iw.text: This place is a real good place to come start the day or unwind after a long day. I've had brunch both times and it was delicious, service is prompt and friendly. I ate inside the first time but outside the second time, it is so comfortable and cozy. This place serves the absolute best grits I've had in Charlotte so far.... Amazing feel to the restaurant. Great specials, even on a Saturday !!!

_R73KrdOec16Q5o4GrUw1A.text: I decided to check this place out based on the great reviews and pictures one Saturday.  I ordered from the Krazy Grill cuban chicken my sides were beans and Krazy rice it also  came with cornbread! The cuban chicken was dry and I wasn't a fan of the vinegar based sauce. The beans and rice were just ok and nothing special about the cornbread.   The service was mediocre it felt like it took forever for our food to come because it did. They were not even busy at the time.   The only thing I liked was that they were kid friendly!

4iCk-5x6rvMl77wJc-rlvw.text: I finally went to Krazy Fish after passing it on my way home so many times. I sat down on a Thursday afternoon around 4pm.  I ordered the Sangria. It wasn't gross, but there was nothing special about it. I would order it again, because it was worth the $3.  I got bulgogi tacos and brisket tacos with a side of grits.  The bulgogi were my favorite because I'm a pickle enthusiast, but my boyfriend preferred the cheesy brisket tacos. We both left extremely full. I say, skip the ceviche- get some tacos and definitely the grits! Service was slow, but I'm not mad. Cool view of Charlotte and quirky atmosphere. Check it out if you're in the mood for something different, yummy, and super filling!

wAg77OEDxQFPPof-kfr_Ag.text: I found this place on YELP because it was near the location of my appointment. In town on business, driving from CLT airport with an hour to kill.  WHAT A FIND!!!  I had a 'special' dish modeled after a Cajun jambalaya - with a chipotle cream sauce.  A bit off the straight & narrow perhaps, but 'WOW'!!  Succulent (not over cooked) scallops, shrimp and mahi-mahi with rice on the sauce. I was so impressed, I returned after my meeting for Fresh tuna tacos and a side of gumbo. Once again, knock yer socks off great!  Add a mug of cool local brew and I was on the road back home.  Top it off with gab with waitress, owner/chef and other patrons made a long travel day so, so much better.

9V9R3N5On2_dZ4CeAlzOCw.text: I have lived in Charlotte (Southend) for almost 8 years and recently moved to Plaza Midwood. I can't believe I have waited so long to visit this amazing place!   My boyfriend and I stopped in on Friday night to give this little eclectic restaurant a whirl! I am so glad we did!   Upon arrival the host as well as passing waiters greeted us and were so upbeat, friendly & welcoming! Our waitress was wonderful and gave us some great suggestions since it was our first time there. The mussels were out of this world! Probably the best I have ever had! We also tried the brisket tacos and blackened tuna tacos! They were by far better than Cabo Fish Taco, and they have always been one of my favorites! We got sides of both mac and cheese, and the jalapeno grits. I have never been a huge fan of grits, but I LOVED these! We will definitely be going back soon!

IWG6KjPtP0crUAGHBcll5g.text: Krazy Fish has been on my radar for quite some time. With crazy steel art festooned on their front patio and dive-y exterior, what more could you ask for in Plaza Midwood? This place is ridiculous. Landing directly on Central Ave, it's not too hard to miss their parking lot. Turn in right before Morningside. Made that mistake once....  Glad to see that "Krazy" is first word in the name of this joint. Our server, Chad, was a freaking ray of sunshine. Hilarious and absolutely BLUNT. He had no problems telling us that some menu items were "dumb" if paired with others. He was jazzed to be there. What a great employee. He was fast, efficient and a great jokester.   Mystery beer is interesting....$1 and you'll, most likely, get a crappy beer. Haha. Worth the $1 laugh it brought to our table. Bud Light with lime. GAG.  Apps:  Started out with the potato cakes. These things are awesome. Plenty of veggies and in a creamy curry-ish sauce. I would have mistaken them for falafel had I not been told. I was happy and so were my taste buds. Throw a little sriracha on these bag boys and you'll experience Krazy enlightenment.   Entrees:  My wife got a fried veggie burrito. This thing rivals the size of a Chipotle or Moe's burrito. Packed full of rice and tons of tasty veggies. Loved the sauce that the veggies were sauteed in. Welcomingly sweet and a came full circle with the rest of her plate. The grits on the side were so thick and creamy. I'd have a full plate on my next visit if it were an entree. Delicious.   I tried the blackened tuna tacos. Holy crap. Pineapple salsa? I'd eat that on my foot. It was so good. Perky, cilantro-ey and so FRESH. I love every bit. Huge chunks of rare, seared tuna. The slaw, I'm pretty sure, is tossed in a bit of wasabi powder so it got dumped off my tacos lickity split. No offense. Just not a fan of wasabi. Got a side of the mac n' cheese per Chad's recommendation. So good. Soul food, meet Mexican. Be friends, I say.   Sampled the blueberry salsa and the chipotle honey. Very interesting. Look forward to trying them on their respective dishes on our next visit.   I'm happy to say Krazy Fish literally is crazy but absolutely intriguing. I can't wait to test more of the menu. Well done, ladies and gents. You've got something going here.

YIHwwNPGI8MLSV6aTpwVig.text: The ambiance is "krazy" and fun. Its very hippy like inside. Servers are friendly. Went here for dinner one night and ordered a roti with lemongrass tofu and korean beef tacos. We had the mac and cheese and grits for the side item. ( the sides were average) The "roti" is just a burrito with a looooooot of rice and a protein/veggie of your choice ( in my case lemongrass tofu) It was literally a carb full meal since it was a ton of rice inside of a tortilla shell with a little bit of tofu. I thought it was just okay. ( way too much rice) Probably will not order again.  The Korean beef tacos were flavorful but the portion was wayyyy too small. I think an average men will be able to eat at least 8 tacos ( so 4 orders)   Overall it was just okay...

SHzfrSFUCEYikJ901ttRqw.text: Charlotte foodie tour continues.  This place was featured on Diners Driveins and Dives recently.  The brisket taco and ceviche were a standout

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket taco!

Pf4QemVGeVVOIrqTKBU-eg.text: I have been here a few times and have always had a good meal.  This trip they were under staffed and it took awhile but our server was juggling the best he could. I would call that a manager oversight rather than blame the hard working staff. The gumbo was superb - a little zing of hotness w lots of flavor.  The bulgogi beef tacos rock - but my favorite was the chicken Cuban taco. This place has some unique character inside and they outside searing as well.  Great to place to have casual drinks and great good at a reasonable price.

rgp7svaOB7yn44XIgUUUEA.text: I'm new to this, but why?  How has no one ever made me go get some half priced taco's from 4-6pm.  Or even just told me to go pay full price.  OK, like I said, I'm new to this, so can't give the full report back till I go check it a few more times.  But, those salmon taco's ain't no joke.  Tried some tuna and some ceviche as well, quite edible, but not quite as awe inspiring.  Food was so good and I was soooooo hungover that I didn't really notice how wild the decor was till I was walking out.  Did notice Charlotte's own K.C.(old owner of fat City amond much other fame) was there, makes sense with all the tatted up waitresses.  Full report ASAP!!!

LnQVJB6H0ZJ7KprbqGfjSA.text: We had lunch at this fun and quirky seafood restaurant and tiki bar while visiting Charlotte.  It had been featured in Diners, Drive-ins and Dives which is how we found it. The green Thai curry mussels were Krazy good (although there were quite a few that had not opened while cooking so they couldn't be eaten - I wish the kitchen had not included those as part of our portion).    We also shared the Seafood Creole dish which was very flavorful but ended up being overly filling for lunch. Should have probably stick to something lighter.   Overall I would recommend this restaurant and the mussels (and the yummy toast they come with) in particular.

I08BYwRD9vQ3iYcAl0O_tw.text: This will be a mixed review. And I must say it's based on my tastes. Others taste may be different.  1. Their gumbo soup is absolutely amazing! I can make a meal out of it with bread.  2. Rarely they make a lobster soup too. Absolutely amazing as well!  Now comes the mixed part. My hard part is finding an actual meal that I enjoy. Their sauces tend to kill whatever I get. And if I say no sauce it has no flavor. Again this is personal preference. I still mainly go there for the soup and I deal with the main.

nUGtF97XykmzXmQR2FhbeQ.text: Delicious! Vinegar based Krazy Slaw has a great kick. It goes perfectly with the fish tacos  I have passed by this place on numerous occasions but tonight the timing, for dinner, was just right! To find out that the reviews were awesome and that it had Guy Fieri's stamp of approval on it gauranteed I'd be dining in a cool, funky, mouth watering, margarita infused heaven! Yeah!

Sn81H9UTzfcyZl_umgKHDA.text: This one has been on my bucket list for a long time.  Today, Virginia and I made it a reality.  It was so different than what I expected.  I suppose I thought there would just be fish and fish and more fish, all of it Krazy, of course.  I found a menu that was so much broader than just fish.  I actually had the red curry dish that came with chicken, shrimp, and tofu.  It was also served with a tortilla kinda bread and Krazy rice on the side.  It was very original and very well prepared.  I have eaten a lot of curries in my life, but never had one that came with three different proteins.  Loved it!   The atmosphere resembled something out of Key West.  Very funky and very fun.  If I had known it was all this good, I woulda come before now.   Now that I know, I guess I should keep the secret to myself!

mTiJxjvW5Rqiib8sKP3npA.text: Taco.  Tuesday.  Two words, that when used together, generate excitement.  For myself, I judge a taco place based off their fish tacos.  Krazy fish's taco Tuesday is almost all fish tacos...so if you're about that life, you have to check this place out.  You get an absolutely insane return on your investment, as each taco fills your hands with comfort and your mouth with tastiness.  All while your wallet barely feels a thing.  My server, Haley was on point with suggestions, ingredients in the tacos, and remembering to bring me a Thai tea at the end.  Crushed it!  Love you guys.  Wow, so I'm sipping this Thai tea as I finish this, and I crushed it while typing this last sentence.  If you like Thai tea and a creamy finish to some amazing tacos then don't waste your time, get it!

YJ1hclREL3E4D08pVaz3hA.text: Krazy Fish is such a kooky Midwood staple and that's exactly why I love it. It's in a random spot on the quieter end of Central with its own parking lot (nice). The decor is hilariously random and you'll notice something weird and different every time you go. There is plenty of seating, so you should be able to find a spot almost any time you show up.  They have the most eclectic menu you've ever seen, from curry to tacos. They have tofu options for almost every menu item, making this a vegetarian- and probably vegan-friendly spot.  There's a huge range in cost - you could spend $9 for dinner or $20+ ($18 for curry? how and why?!). It's not a very vegetable-intensive spot, so this isn't the healthiest option (and that's ok!).  The staff is super friendly and will help you through the menu if needed. They always have drink specials (and cheap drinks in general). They also offer brunch! I'll be back to try that out.

Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato cakes

w9ydzAIfVnhgyrnPLd115Q.text: It was a terrible experience. We moved here recently and I am a huge seafood fan and was excited to try this place. On a Saturday night it was empty. Bad sign number one. However we have two children so we soldiered ahead. We ordered off of the kids menu for our 2 year old. Mac and cheese. My poor kid took one bite of his Mac and cheese and his tongue was on fire.  It was super spicy. When we told the waiter he causally said something along the lines of "oh they must have used the Cajun cheese. They usually don't do that". So we asked for regular cheese and he said it wasn't available.   Come on. It's a kids menu. Kids. At least warn the parents. We also ordered blackened fish tacos and Sichuan fried chicken wings. The Mac and cheese was spicier than any of those. And they called it Sichuan chicken!   The food wasn't bad but this place is  NOT GOOD FOR KIDS. Also empty on a Saturday can't be good.  But you can buy some random shorty T-shirt about how they were on TV once and I'm sure the tourists love it.

ZVgVkNvlo8u0GFLeJ_gI-w.text: No bueno!! After reading lots of great reviews we decided to invite friends for brunch. There were 10 of us. We had a very nice server!! My fish tacos were awful!! The fish was so over cooked it was inedible. They were super spicy - the menu said nothing about spicy!! My friends shrimp tacos were the same!!  So disappointed!!!! The French toast was good. Fried chicken not great. Pea salad was good.

g50Gyj-JdtFnxXaAWxesyA.text: Our neighborhood favorite! Food is always delicious and employees are always extremely warm and welcoming. The specials are always on point too!

XdnCE-77Ou6hnkzBggeGhg.text: We stopped by here for lunch because we had heard they was featured on diners drive-ins and dives before so that made us curious, pulling in we seen the wacky decorations and it got even better once we went in. With a warm welcome we got seated and settled on a calamari po boy (pictured below) and it was so delicious, also got a side of potato wedges which completed the plate perfectly. This is one of charlottes great dives!! You'd be Krazy not to try this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

X1YWbKqzYn5HMoTW0DscNA.text: We have been wanting to try Krazy Fish for a while.   434 reviews and the top 20 or so are mostly 5 stars.   I am so glad we did, I would have to agree with all the reviews, we really had a terrific meal.   I did not post any pictures because all pictures that have been posted are accurate.  Starters - Lobster Chowder.   Excellent.  Giant chunks of lobster in a very light cream based chowder.  Side salad - my wife loved it - it had beets on it and a vinaigrette dressing.   Main Course - I went with the Seafood Creole.   Very interesting that they mix BOTH fried and sauteed seafood together!!!!   This is a huge plate of mixed seafood over Cajun seasoning.  You probably could share this plate.   So much food, it is overwhelming.........Excellent mix of fish, shrimp, calamari and scallops over Krazy Rice.  The Krazy Rice is sticky rice with veggies mixed in.   Both the lobster chowder and the seafood creole come with a large slab of cornbread, I did not like the cornbread whatsoever.    I do want to bring up something that I read in a few reviews.   I hate to agree with the bland flavor, yes I found it on a the bland side, but make sure you mix up the dish, the seafood was sitting on top on the sauce.   Also, I asked for some Old Bay and it was perfect.  Old Bay, salt and pepper = perfect!  My wife had the fish and chip special.  Very good large flaky white fish fried in a beer batter like breading.  The chips were homemade potato chips.  The chips were freshly made and excellent.      Lastly the staff.   What a great group of servers - all very attentive and excellent attitude.  Makes me think that the joint is just a cool place to work.

Y8oYp4mLhKoKVQVVpZfN1Q.text: Food is delicious but very heavy. Everything is fried. I highly recommend getting the pickled beets to go with everything. Shout out to Jerry for being such a great server

6JbXBSAu3EqRcAi3qFfh5A.text: I happened to see the Diners, Drive in and Dives episode featuring Krazy Fish, so off we drove there for lunch.  Interesting atmosphere, friendly staff and unique menu. Brunch  menu on Sunday.  My dining mate and I ordered the Shrimp Gazpacho, served in a margarita glass, enough for 2 people. Spicy sweet gazpacho with tender shrimp. We enjoyed this with high expectations of our food to come.  My dining mate ordered the blackened tuna taco  with pineapple salsa which  came with krazy slaw and a side of squash casserole. I ordered the lemon grass curry with  choice of shrimp, beef, chicken or tofu and chose tofu.  The  dish served over rice with Krazy slaw I asked to opt the rice and ordered the side of the squash also. Food came out hot, good portions, plated nicely.  However here is where the disappointment starts. My dish had no inkling of any lemon grass flavoring to my taste.  The sauce was  thin , sweet  and vinegary. The tofu was chewy, seemed to me it had been fried previously and reheated for my dish. When asked about where was the krazy slaw, the server said it was in my dish, yes the sauce and tofu over thinly shredded cabbage which was now a soggy mush, no resemblance of slaw. The squash casserole, bland and average tasting.  My dining mate enjoyed his tuna taco said it was tasty  well seasoned but admitted the slaw  also in the taco, not as a side, made the taco soggy .  Menu prices moderate. Menu choices quite varied and something on the menu even for vegetarians,  variety of southern fried foods, sandwiches,  filled roti and tacos, Asian fusion dishes,  Sunday brunch, see menu photos below.  Lastly I was seated where I could see food prepared at the open kitchen grill. At least once I saw the female cook, use her bare hands instead of tongs to place an ingredient from a pot to the grill. Both the male and female wore no gloves for food handling.  Not sure we would return here again

0Z05yVwu79bA8-XYNMDDwQ.text: My Dad and I watch Diners, Drive Ins and Dives on Netflix and recently watched an episode where Krazy Fish was featured.  Yesterday we drove down from Greensboro specifically to have lunch at Krazy Fish.  It was worth the trip and we'll do it again.  I highly recommend this place.  If you're in Charlotte for any reason, do not pass go, stop and eat at Krazy Fish.  We started with the Green Thai Curry Mussels.  It was worth the trip for these alone.  They are phenominal!!!  20 mussels with slices of bread for sopping up the sauce.  The tastes go very well together.  My Dad and I then both had the Szechuan Salmon tacos.  These come on a soft tortilla shell which has been warmed on the grill so that they are "puffy".  The salmon is layered inside a sauce and then topped with a cucumber based slaw.  Out of this world.  My Dad can't eat cucumbers so they gave him a different slaw on the side.  Terry, our server, was very helpful and friendly.  Since we'd driven a distance for lunch, we also met the owner.   The service was very good.  The place is tastefully decorated like a fun neighborhood place.  We will be back.  The food was fantastic!

veJy-16yFsBC0C0FtpFyLA.text: First of all, the place is laid back, casual and quirky! Dog friendly too. Sooo many items to choose from. We ordered the mussels. They were delish, could use a little heat, (Thai curry after all , and the portion was amazing. The wings were delish, and the pad Thai, also delish! $5 Sangria, and Mimosas on Sunday We'll be back to try some of their other dishes!

MpA_-2vsuLXeFt46Pt-MOg.text: Krazy Fish is just Top-Notch food. It was on the Show Diners, Drive Ins and Drives. The atmosphere is very hip and chill. I loved the design of the place. It was a rustic, random set up meaning they had just a bunch of random souvenirs, paintings, replica, all kinds of cool interesting things around the place. We went on the best day possible, Tuesday. I took a picture of the menu. It explains itself. The food was delicious. These tacos were fully loaded and each taco was specially design with specific toppings to make it a tasty masterpiece. They seriously slayed on the tacos. I got four, Tuna, Bulgogi Beef, Southern Friend Fish, and the Glazed Salmon. Each one was bomb but my favorite out of what I got was the tuna because of the pineapple salsa .   I will definitely be coming back. My parents love the place too. They saw it on that show because they watch it all the time. You definitely won't be let down. The service was great as well. Everyone was nice and respectful. Awesome place.

RknCOF8pDinORZnS_Nj35A.text: So another Triple D Let Down!  Noticing a trend here!  The Food: Food was not bad, it was totally average however.  The Muscles were fantastic but everything fell short after the opener.  Fish was over seasoned and that's from a guy who has a salt shaker in his car.    The Staff:  Much like the good very average, not rude but not helpful either.  They were attentive and no issues but it was just run of the mill.  The Place: Fun atmosphere, plenty of seating  The Drinks: decent beer list however would of loved to see more local option in the beer list .  Not bad just not anything special...if you are a triple D die hard maybe you can find something a little extra.

GYoULRqczWO1143FUgePAg.text: I've had them on my bookmarked list for a while now. I finally had the chance to go over the weekend and I really think I'm missing something. My experience was "decent" at best and I tried quite a plethora of items. From the gumbo to the Green curry mussels, the Szechwan wings and the lemongrass curry, nothing stood out as memorable. The wings were dry yet soggy (how?) while the lemongrass curry was really curry chicken (or protein of choice) on a bed of coleslaw. Possibly the menu is catered to too many varieties of food (from tacos/burritos to southern comfort to Asian fusion?) and thus lack a specialty.   On a positive note, our waiter was amazing and I did appreciate the kitchen splitting the lemongrass curry into 2 sharing dishes.
