9UBx3e94RnNi3-gh2LkfAA.text: Food was very good. Great hip vibe. Service just ok. They brought us things we didn't order, and then the things we did order, they thought wasn't ours. My table ordered specials for our main courses and we were all happy. We would absolutely go back!

K8d_O7aCyHJaG0qkiWWu7A.text: Today was my first time at Krazy Fish.  I must first say we had a great waitress named Bonnie. Not only did she help us make up our minds but really knew the menu.   I ordered crab cakes with the corn along with veggies followed up with the special lobster bisque. The Bisque was AWESOME! At first glance it can be some what not appealing but the taste was amazing. The crab cakes weren't lump cakes but a good balance of filler and crab. The corn was a "Mexican mix blend" which wasn't anything special but still good. The vegetables had a bit too much minced garlic but cooked perfect. All and all I would say give me the crab cakes with a huge bowl of bisque . Yum!  My one friend had the special salmon cakes. Definitely had an Asian fusion blend to it. They were good but definitely had something different in my mind. She loved and raved about the squash casserole . Spicy! She also had the Mac n cheese which was good but not killer.  My other friend had the shrimp and curry potato cakes. The shrimp was delicious and I am not a curry fan so can't advise against anything more.  For an app we had the calamari . It was hot and oh so yummy.  Will definitely be going again!  I believe Tuesday through Friday from 4-6 you can get half priced tacos .... A good selection of different tacos available.   It's a must try! A little hidden treasure.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo to go!!!

Xzl-VDKKVoZMsjNrBZFqtw.text: Looking for the best fish tacos in Charlotte? Look no further! Excellent daily specials and friendly staff contribute to a quirky and lively atmosphere. I recommend Krazy Fish to locals and visitors!

VBB2wrGwEwPUNFRdi2KR-A.text: Have been here twice.  Both times were excellent!  First time there I had gumbo which was some of the best I've had. This time had fried dumplings for an app and there were delicious!  Also had a roti with beef and Cajun sauce.  It was huge with great flavors!  The grits were also good!

6drii2b0oWATQAoL95ewcQ.text: What do you get when you put a funky restaurant in one of Charlotte's hottest neighborhoods and fill it with the most random decorations and an ever changing menu... you get Krazy Fish.  On our waitress' recommendation we started off the night with an order of wings. When they came out ours eyes were like.. Whoa! and after the first bite our tastebuds had plenty of questions. They were juicy on the inside but kinda dry rubbed with spices on the outside. They were a little sweet, a little spicy, a lot of messy... and some of the best wings we've ever had the pleasure of demolishing. It didn't take us but a few short minutes to turn that gorgeous plate of wings into a pile of bones.  Next we got the Three Little Pigs BBQ Sandwich topped with slaw and blueberry tamarind chutney with some potato salad on the side. The potato salad was forgettable but the pulled pork and blueberry chutney was amazing. I'd suggest swapping out the bread for something less dense and overpowering but overall this dish gets a recommend :)  Ella ordered the Brisket tacos with cheddar cheese and salsa verde. The Brisket was tender and full of flavor, it was loaded with gooey cheddar cheese  and the salsa verde added the perfect hint of spice. The only thing this taco needed was a dallop of sour cream... perhaps a dallop of daisy. The black-eyed pea salad is probably one of the best we've ever come across and on our top ten list of favorite foodie menu items. The chipotle beef tacos were made with Korean bulgogi beef, topped with a salsa de arbol, and wrapped in corn tortillas.  Despite Krazy Fish not being a Mexican restaurant... the bulgogi beef tacos were probably some of the best we have ever sank our teeth into and the macaroni was oven baked and as fresh as homemade can get. The blackened tuna tacos came with an Asian slaw and were a little too blackened for Ella's palate but the slaw cooled it down a little and we still easily recommend it for the average person. The jalapeno cheddar cheese grits souffle was great... according to me, but Ella said she's had better.   We also got the southern fried fish wrapped in flour tortillas with a "Pink Gold sauce" and slaw. The fish was fried perfectly and was well balanced by the crunchy slaw. The best part of this taco though was the pink gold sauce, i just wished it had about a gallon more. Last but not least... the cuban chicken tacos with corn tortillas and salsa verde.  Not real heavy on the spicy cuban flavor but still enough to make us smile.  Its not often we get to add a restaurant to our favorites list.. but Krazy fish definitely deserves the honor. They have great food, a great staff, budget friendly pricing, and oh yeah... did we mention GREAT FOOD!!!!

ETLP2iNt1wRCMf-DY2jk0Q.text: My new go to spot! Loved their brisket tacos they are my new fav. I went in for lunch one day and had the most wonderful server. I wish I remembered her name but I'm pretty sure everyone there is great.

EiWV9IQ5kazDkvOvWNSY3g.text: Only thing missing is live music on the outside patio. Shawnee is the best bartender! Friendly and chalked up small talk with my party. Price is affordable. Food....INCREDIBLE!

Yca4q9ZGH2JYpbYeYUPxrw.text: In from out of town to visit my brother, my parents & I met him at Krazy Fish. I had seen their episode of Diners, Drive Ins, & Dives and was curious to check it out.  We started with calamari which was lightly breaded & tasty. We also got chips & salsa which comes with 3 different options. A standard chunky salsa that had good flavor but not enough heat, a salsa verde that I found pretty bland but my mom loved, & a pineapple salsa that I liked.  I had Cuban chicken tacos; nicely toasted tortillas, shredded seasoned chicken, salsa verde and their house slaw, which added a nice crunch & acidity to each bite. I liked them but I love spicy so I did add some hot sauce.  My mom got the pulled pork tacos that she loved, my dad the Szechwan salmon tacos which he found a little messy but good & my brother got the special lime salmon tacos that he also said were great.   Our server was friendly & helpful, gave us recommendations. Decor is fun and quirky, would definitely come back next time I'm in Charlotte to try more off their big menu.

EX4vBCJOOA82bVSBBEizlQ.text: This is one of those places that never immediately comes to mind, but is always a great option.  Great patio and funky decor makes for a good gathering place for drinks with friends. Huge diverse menu with tacos, fish, Asian fusion, salads, and more. Even the pickiest of eaters will find something here.  Drinks are decently priced and there's a good selection of local and craft brews.

IDHUlQrGI9cQ_NQZqol9lg.text: Very quick service. The Food was amazing!! They have a sauce to go with any palate, whether you like spice or more mild foods. The portions are huge, so be sure and go hungry. Only downside is that they were very busy, and it was difficult to find a clean table. Will plan to go back as soon as we can! The chicken is seasoned to perfection.

oS6OG4f4c-yhkqNPqKSq5g.text: Do you like food? Do you like crazy? This place was amazing and we are not even talking about the food yet. I had to get past the crazy exterior of this place but omg the food is out of this world! The cheap and down to earth and the people love there jobs! Honesty you have to be able to just sit down and enjoy all that this place as the offer!

U5lYDktuu7O5cekUD_RQEg.text: I used to really like this place but they recently decided you can no longer mix and match tacos. I have always like Cabo Fish Taco a lot more but would stop in from time to time to change things up. They have the best jalapeno cheddar grits ever but since you can't mix and match I'd much rather make the drive to Noda for Cabo. I also really don't care for the texture of the taco shells. I like how eclectic the decor is in the restaurant.

99huREDQJ3-ysS5C5x7HlA.text: We've been to Krazy Fish a couple of times now and are always happy with our experience there. Firstly, the staff has always been super friendly and attentive with us and we have received great service. Secondly, the prices are incredibly reasonably for the quality of the food and the portions sizes. The beer prizes are even crazier; $1.50 mystery beer $3.50 Stella...!   Last time we were there we ordered the Thai green curry mussels for an appetizers and it was delicious! After we ate all the mussels and used every single piece of bread to soak up the sauce the waiter came over and was nice enough to offer us more bread, but we declined knowing that we would get too full for our entrees. I'm not ashamed to say that we finished the rest of the sauce that came with our mussels with a spoon as if it was soup! Both times I've gone I've ordered the Bulgogi beed roti burrito with thai red curry sauce and LOVED it. It has tons of flavor and the Bulgogi is always very tender. As far as sides go, my favorite is the jalapeno cheddar cheese grits, not exactly health food but it always make me very happy! Best part is that there is always extra to take home for round 2 later!   At the end, when you get your receipt there is always a credit at the bottom for next time. I believe it's a percentage of your final bill, our is usually about $5 and you can bring it in next time and they'll take that amount of your bill. You really can't beat the prices at this spot for a casual lunch or dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thai Green Curry Mussels

YTRedAS9YwcdoAUCgAg_Pg.text: Absolutely unique... Stunning flavors and you must try their great range of seafood dishes.  I went for the Shrimp / Seafood Diablo recommended by Guy Fieri seen on food network last Friday.  Will definitely return.

9sqd3txMi5y2CJyh5U8ioA.text: This place is fantastic. The neighborhood is swamped with over priced pretentious"restaurants" and Krazy Fish is a perfect escape- fair prices, excellent food and professional wait staff.   I have been for brunch several times and I am certain they make the best Bloody Mary in town. If you go for dinner, try the fried veggies and the beef. The grits are bangin, too.  Every waiter we have had was spot on. The tall guy knew to bring extra napkins and kids food out immediately and another guy- Porter? is a fuckin' smooth operatin' dude that will keep the glasses full and offer any help you need with suggestions. He's also somewhat entertaining, he gave me a lesson on Andre the Giant once.   I will continue to go back until they give me a reason otherwise.

_EiqC0-OxA2BbHH9RFn4LQ.text: Wonderful restaurant! Great food, atmosphere, wait staff, selection, price, and portion sizes. I'm a sucker for fish tacos but hate trying to go to Cabo Fish Taco for a couple of reasons (it's always crowded, the wait is crazy, and the price-point is way too high for what you're getting); so I found Krazy Fish when I typed in "fish tacos Charlotte" as an alternative a couple years ago and have loved it ever since.   My recommendation is the ceviche tacos - chopped white fish marinated and cooked in citrus flavors - and I always ask for the pineapple salsa to go with it because the flavors go so well together. Their jalapeno cheddar grits side is a must-try, too. Can't go wrong at this place.

IIvoQnPRF4oZG4-9mOZwAQ.text: Definitely a favorite over the many times I've been here. Feels like the beach, crazy reasonable prices and I love a jalapeno marg. I always get some type of taco, never fried, and I usually mix two different types. It could be mahi, tuna or salmon - I like em all! Same with accompaniments - bulgogi, kimchi or wasabi. I'm a big fan of the jalapeno cheese grits and the squash casserole.

H3F2c6t_0CwmquP4n_9Zbw.text: There are reason cooking networks find these places... That's because the food speaks for itself. Simply AMAZING! My favorite has been the mussels. A must if you've never been.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States

sSkNV_X-wscAEeeQGMl50A.text: I've been a fan of this place for a while. They have some incredibly creative dishes fusing Mexican with fish and some southern aspects.   I typically get the pork tacos with their blueberry salsa and coleslaw. Their tortillas are always hot and fresh. I've been told they make them in house; I believe it. They're always airy and light. I also like their Krazy Rice as a side. I hate the name (it sounds like something you'd get at a kitschy rest area) but it's a sticky white rice with carrots and peas. Great flavor.   Overall Krazy Fish has some great and innovative dishes and they're always consistent. I will say their service is typically slow so be prepared to hang around a while. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork tacos with blueberry salsa

_8R6kZMUh0c_RvvTu0syKg.text: My best friend in Charlotte lives in Plaza Midwood and is a big fan of seafood. And we've both found it difficult to find good seafood in Charlotte. So when he told me that he found a place where he had good Chilean sea bass and a lobster tail for under $20, I was pretty skeptical. But naturally, I was prepared to give it a try.  So we went one evening in December around finals time. It was a cool spot. I wasn't really sure what to expect walking in. It wasn't a fancy place at all, but the decor had its own appeal and charm to it. It had a variety of streamers, lights and...well "flair." Like it or not, it's definitely not something you see everyday. Plenty of seating, a cool tiki bar, clean, terrific and attentive service...not sure if there was any outdoor seating though.   But the highlight was the food. There were many cool options to choose from. They consider themselves soul seafood fusion and the menu options did not disappoint. The special was halibut with lobster tails and rice. Absolutely delicious. The best seafood that I've had in Charlotte. I also had to try the gumbo, because, well, I'm a fan of gumbo. And I'm now a fan of their gumbo. The meal was terrific and very reasonably priced. It was so great in fact, that I ordered shrimp and grits to go for my wife (who has to work late.) she was pleasantly surprised and loved it too! We can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creole seafood entree with southern slaw and steamed veggies.
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Special: Lobster tails, blackened halibut, green beans and rice. Delicious
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo :)

l7rEpptHiWVSPlmkCWv_qQ.text: Excellent service, food to surprise your taste buds, very reasonable prices, very funky atmosphere

O3Cd8ZTqvNxuP5lIpq6QWQ.text: Get the pulled pork tacos!! Fun place to go on a Friday and relax.

i8Z6IziUwDrWmiid6Nn-xg.text: We checked out this place this evening.  Had the salmon tacos. they ran out of the blackened tuna.  It was the best fish taco I had, plenty of salmon.  great sauce with it .    loved the varieties of the menu.  cool place.  Will be back soon !

9RUx1THgAtSDRBCcFwnQgw.text: Loved it here! I'm not sure if the food or the service was better. Had the crabcake special and ceviche tacos, both were delicious (I think the ceviche won though)! Salad was fresh and a nice mix -with not a sprig of iceburg, yay! Nice outdoor seating facing Central, so probably good people watching on a weekend evening. Interesting decor hanging from the ceiling. They have a good kids menu, not just the usual chicken fingers or burger, which my 10 year old loved. Cant wait to come back after the pregnancy and enjoy a drink or two or, um, five.

V1O7CoD-dabIS1X-hknmrQ.text: Decided to give this place a second try. Much better and on the rotation. Got the pork/brisket tacos with Grits Souffle, and Mac and Cheese. Everything was awesome.

g9L0mJa3o4zuX3RXTRyErA.text: Amazing seafood and cool decor. The staff is always extra friendly and their daily specials are creative and worth trying. I've been here a few times and they never disappoint.

knpwsvn51EsDeG0q54g-0A.text: Everytime i eat here, i'm left wondering..when can i come back?  This place is phenomenal.  The fried veggies....the chicken..krazy grill...heck, save yourself the trouble and just order whatever is on special that night, you can't go wrong. Prices were excellent.  Get the brownie dessert..you're welcome I gotta go back now, thanks...

j7zYSVoFfv72fcqgKNdhsg.text: I had heard that this place was great so I was very excited to try it - especially when a Groupon came out. Sadly, I was pretty let down.    It's a cool spot, service is great and our waiter was really friendly, but the food was just not wonderful.  Everything tasted like it was spiced with the exact same spice mix, and it wasn't a great one.    Maybe we'll give it another try one day, but I wouldn't recommend it now.

pvgFq5b6I_21cPNqCCm7Ww.text: OMG! Delicious, original food...but wait there's more...they have outstanding, friendly service. Krazy Fish has a funky, divey, fun, atmosphere.  Admittedly after residing in S. Calfornia for many years I am a taco snob. Krazy Fish has the best poached shrimp tacos this side of the Mississippi. I hear the tempura ones are to die for as well. Last night I had the gazpacho soup which was packed with shrimp. This place doesn't skimp and the price is right. Go hungry, leave full and happy. Skip Cabo Fish Taco for Krazy Fish. Guaranteed that you'll go back soon.

-5VsPd35gB4CCsBp6Bfhuw.text: Good food, tight seating. Overall this place is great and right around the corner from the night life.

HKstWSVf1njHTmN64AtiiA.text: Decor is quirky and fun to look at, but food tastes like what my hippie roommate used to scrounge out of our first apartment's fridge. Like, oh, we have some fish sauce, taco spice, chicken, and dried mango - what can we make? Almost like the chef had heard about a cool, international dish and attempted to make it without using a recipe or tasting the results. My husband's salmon taco was decent, but my pho's flavors clashed so badly it was nigh on inedible and even my friend's fried food was overspiced.

UHcARCxkTjjZc1UVR3iSVw.text: Been a few times, ordered the same thing both times only to be told just as everyone else's food is coming out that they were out of what I ordered.  My food didnt come out until everyone else was done eating and it was time to leave (part of my meal actually came out as we were walking out the door)...but I was still charged full price though!  I will not be back.

0luaylrs0nXb01QoowZupQ.text: Krazy Fish is bordering 4 stars and 5 stars. It can go either way for you depending on your personality. There is always something unusual happening there. Very colorful personalities and unusual decor. If you like freakiness it is 5 stars. If not then 4 stars. While the food isn't 5-star - It is delicious. The menu is so random and so much to choose from and reasonable prices that it is 5  stars even though it is 4 star food.  We have brought our baby there, kids, grandparents -all have had fun and loved the food and the "ambiance" of randomness of everything and everyone there. Just expect it to be arsty and laid back and not anything like a white linen or a chain mentality. It is never the same experience twice. Awesome place.

UvvePc6fW8q1UO1VPnvp0Q.text: I didn't even get a chance to eat. My boyfriend and I walk in for a late lunch. We stand there for a few minutes being ignored by every server there. We finally get seated and the server just throws the menus on the table and walks away without saying a word. About 5 minutes later were greeted by a dark haired lady, she takes our drink order. We waited 10-15 minutes and then the save guy who seated us comes over and asks if she's taken our drink order. My boyfriend says we're waiting for water. She then realizes she forgot our water. The guy comes back, with the waters, and takes our order. I start to tell him what I want and he gives me a dirty look and rolls his eyes saying that basically my decision was the wrong one and tells me that my food will be dry. I about had it with this place. I looked at my boyfriend and said, were leaving. And we walked out. Unless they teach their servers what customer service is, I won't be returning.

YEOqLRGoOT_MxpuagZ8q7Q.text: First time there. Went for the $5 BBQ, Wings or Jambalaya, and the $1 or $2 grab beers, but since we were seated in the roomy, back Tiki bar section, ended up ordering off the menu.  Loved the Southern Fish Tacos, and we still got the cheap beers.  Not to mention the free American Honey shots! Great service from Duncan, too!

tR6v5QBsYa3WNso7lyb7ng.text: The Szechuan wings and Shrimp and Grits are amazing!!! Came here for a late lunch with some friends and the food was absolutely amazing! Great atmosphere, good prices, amazing food. How can you go wrong?

Idvu4FbZXWZCPhXYTOfW2A.text: The food was amazing, ceviche to die for as well as the shrimp and grit.  The staff and owner are friendly and accommodating.  Hidden gem.

v-edXU4Ne4jfa1FG5S25Ug.text: Since it's near my house I used to go there now and then. (not a big fish eater) But quit going about six months ago I had some friends in town that I hadn't seen for a while and we went to catch up. The food was fine but the place seemed a bit dirty and our server found it necessary to sit with us and tell us her life's story  but being near the house and after a few drinks at home we decided to walk up. It was busy we had to wait for a table but that's fine not the restaurant's fault. When we were seated our server came got our drink order and took our order now it did take a while to get the food because they were packed but our server made sure our drinks were filled and after the food arrived it was great. The place seemed clean and the staff seemed attentive and let's face it that's half the battle. A place can have the best food around but if the service is bad I will not go back (zada James). I enjoyed the experience . Try the fried fish tacos and the mac and cheese

lfPmeKZAh4rIxTaMW4hX5Q.text: I had a great experience here. I went when it was slow, but I was very pleased with the service. I had the Neptune patter that include shrimp, calamari, scallops, and tilapia fingers. The sides were fried broccoli, carrots, zuchinni, and red peppers along with steamed cabbage and carrots seasoned with Thyme. It also came with what looked like Jalapeno cornbread. Everything tasted fresh and had it's own flavor unlike some of the fried food that you get. They have a very diverse and unique menu and I respect an establishment that has the guts to do that. I will definitely be back.

8l3oOqVqSRLMqukEmk4N1A.text: Wow. Damn! The portions are large, the prices are good and the food is delish!! Great variety and incredible flavor. The owner is cool as shit

sqcX1Ec0jfi5glow7gJDYw.text: Krazy Fish is a unique and fun Plaza Midwood restaurant that opened just over a year ago in April 2011. The focus is on seafood and spice and the global menu includes a multitude of tacos, roti (flour tortillas stuffed with a protein of choice, rice and a chosen "roti sauce"), sandwiches and salads as well as entrees like fried seafood platters and shrimp and grits. The decor is quite entertaining including lots of nautical chotchkes that put you in the mind of a beachside seafood shack.  For lunch I was able to try both the special salmon taco - delicious with a tasty sauce - and the fried shrimp taco, which was also very good. The jalepeno cheddar cheese grits souffle was awesome and should not be missed. Many of the other side options look like great choices as well, especially the cactus salad which I didn't yet try. Service was friendly and fairly quick and our waiter steered us in the right direction with several recommendations. I look forward to returning to Krazy Fish to try more menu items - in particular the wings and the shrimp and grits. Also to note: every day tacos are half price from 4-6 PM - a great deal - and on Tuesdays bottles of wine are half-price as well.

cKryBBF3ZX43fR49DuZLKw.text: I really debated on the number of stars I wanted to give this place. If I were basing it solely on one thing or another it might be different. First off we will talk about the food. We went in and sat at the bar and ordered the chips & salsa for an appetizer and they pick the different salsas for you. We got a pineapple, regular and the arbol salsa. The pineapple was good but not something I would normally dip chips into, the regular was really sweet but the arbol was my favorite. It tasted more like traditional salsa to me.  We ordered the veggie tacos to split with a side of the jalapeno grits. The grits were amazing. They were absolutely delicious. The tacos were also really delicious, the veggies are lightly battered and the taco had an almost asian inspired flavor as well. The only complaint I have about the food is that while I was eating my taco I noticed that something tasted off, I looked in it and there was a piece of a fish. I am a vegetarian who occasionally eats fish (like maybe 5 times a year) so luckily it wasn't that I was allergic but I was still deeply upset about the fact that there was fish in there. It seemed careless that that could happen especially considering that someone could be allergic to it. I do realize that this is a fish establishment but someone should be able to order veggie tacos without fear of getting fish in it. The second taco in the order that my husband was eating also had a small piece of fish in it as well.   The second factor for me was the atmosphere/service. We sat at the bar to eat since we weren't ordering much and didn't want to take up a table. The folks who worked there were very loud and didn't seem to care at all about what they talked about in front of the customers. There were several conversations happening that I wish I hadn't heard.  I would like to try eating here again as the flavors were really good but perhaps I will order out and see if I have any more issues with the food.

01CONaUnPNf-83WFwA2Pqw.text: Fun, eclectic place. Server was fantastic. The meatloaf and Mac and cheese My 6-yr old son gives it a double thumbs up!

s5QUcnz-YHs3vyjLNQf3yA.text: I have driven by here on my way to work every single day and always wanted to try it.  Finally tried it this week.  I really really really wanted to like it.  It looked different with a cool vibe to it that I thought my family and I would enjoy.  I cant complain about the service.  They treated us great and the food came out quickly.  The food however disappointed us.  My son had a burger which was incredibly dry.  For him to leave a burger half eaten told us something since he's usually a vacuum cleaner when it comes to food.  My wife's fish tacos were also really really dry.  Her squash casserole was really really bad.  I had a taste and needed to down it with water in order avoid gagging.  No joke.  My plate was fine but nothing great.  Not bad, but not great either.  I had a seafood creole platter.  All in all, I hate to say we probably wont be coming back for seconds.

MSHKuNl-uY94Oy-Wb9soLA.text: I had been excited for a few weeks to try this for the first time for my birthday dinner but 3 out of 4 of us were not thrilled. I ordered calamari which was fine but the tomato based dipping sauce was disappointing. I expected it to have a sweet sauce. I should have read the menu closer. My husbands ceviche tacos were tiny. My sons mac n cheese had an odd flavor. He wouldn't finish it. What kid turns that away?  My daughters burger and potato salad were good. My seafood creole was fine. I was expecting a richer sauce. The jalapeno grits were great. We won't be back. Too many other new places to try.

6EGzJMeGfd3gJcwpae7hFA.text: Just ate brunch today here! The food was so yummy! Had the huevos rancheros! My first! They were really good!!!! And of course mimosas! Hope to come here again for a Sunday brunch and try some of the other items.

l1URolP0uAfKGaIg_OXXUQ.text: When you come to a place thats this highly rated, you come in with certain expectations.  Don't.  Fish tacos here are a bit overrated and ceviche was just average.   The vibe was excellent but food was par at best.

GtBm8NjGX9a1iYYZzhjYtA.text: This is my third review on fish tacos. I'm a snob when it comes to those.  I have been to Krazy Fish multiple times despite the food being just average.   Why do I keep coming here? Taco happy hour!  Every day between 4-6pm you can enjoy any of the tacos for half the price, which comes out to be an order of tacos and a side for $4. How can you resist that? It's cheaper than going to the grocery store and making tacos at home!   So I have had the ceviche, calamari, scallop, swordfish, chipotle beef (all in separate occasions). The scallop & swordfish are not on their regular menu. They were specials. Always watch out for those! As a ceviche connoisseur, it was disappointing. "Blah" is all I remember. As for the calamari, swordfish and  scallops, well... they all taste the same. Literally. "Deep fried something topped with slaw and side of your choice" is a pretty accurate description of what I have had here. It seems like their seafood by default deep fried which kills the flavor of the fish. Deep Sigh.  Their menu is huge. And I would even say, too big. Their offerings are all over the place - they have barbecue, chicken, beef, pho, gumbo, wings and the list goes on... What an identity crisis! I have to admit that the chicken and chipotle beef tacos that I have tried are better than the seafood ones.  Which makes me think that name "Krazy Fish" is misleading. It is definitely not a seafood place because otherwise the seafood dishes would be the best things in their menu. and they are not.   In sum, their food is alright. Good spot to visit for convenience. I don't think I would visit during non-happy  taco hours though.

elZi3mmX9QC-LrbU5wWZ7A.text: Well after seeing Krazy Fish was offering a groupon I wanted to try them out, since I have been hankering for some fish tacos. I checked Yelp and their website and discovered that they had great specials, 1/2 off of tacos from 4-6pm and drink specials as well. People also dished on their mac and cheese, and since my hubby is a mac and cheese connoisseur I figured we should grab an early dinner.   Well what can I say about the decor......its funky and looks like the things that Goodwill rejects. The server was very patient and friendly with good suggestions. She suggested that I get her fav which was the Blackened tuna with Asian slaw and pineapple salsa with the creamy cheese grits. I also ordered the pineapple mojito. My hubby ordered the southern fried fish roti with lemongrass curry and mac and cheese of course. She even brought out the sauce to sample before he ordered.   Well the Mojito was subpar and not much of a pineapple taste and the tuna tacos was good, but cold. Also The grits was luke warm as well. My hubby ate only half of the Roti but all of the mac and cheese!! He did enjoyed that.    Overall if you are looking for a deal on tacos, then go here, but I think that my quest for great fish tacos is still on!!!

pRPo7obeTCF_8NnhjYhsSg.text: My diner partner and I arrived around 2pm. The place was practically empty. Service was kinda slow but the food was great! My companion had the Big Dixie chicken and i had the bulgogi beef sandwich. The beef was full of flavor and the bbq sauce was spicy. I would definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Beef Bulgogi with mac n cheese
Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quest trio,

p1IlPnztKVgpsFZO4bdEsA.text: 1st visit: Very impressed!  The green muscle curry was AWESOME and as well as the other items (which I forgot the name of the dishes).  2nd visit: I decided to order take-out.  I order the cajun chicken and it was just regular (blah).  The chicken seemed like it was a piece of frozen chicken breast out of the bag and seasoned with regular seasoning.  This dish wasn't flavor and I was pretty disappointed.

Bqfohx7-TwUAUcHNnurSGQ.text: We saw this restaurant on Diners Drive Ins and Dives last weekend and thought it looked delicious.  So we went at Friday around 7:30 and were afraid it would be packed but there was no wait!  Lots of seating and two bars and live music outside.  The service was awesome and food was soooooo good and fresh.  My husband was very happy with the selection of local craft beers also!  We loved this place and will be going back many times.  We highly recommend!  A local gem.

UkBCNaNxBa6u7TtTbT3Aig.text: The food was okay. The mixed drinks, however, were very good. Our waitress was very friendly even though I got a fish taco when I ordered shrimp. Just know before going here that most of the food is fried.

rl5JnrOvek3tR5TJfpr5fQ.text: Krazy Fish has a cool aesthetic going on... it reminds me a lot of a couple Outer Banks places, such as Goombay's or Tortuga's Lie. It's colorful, cluttered, and kinda fun.  The service was friendly. Somehow, I managed to spill my drink (apparently I reverted to childhood), but the waitress handled it with good humor. This is worth a couple points in my book.  Our meal took a little while to arrive, which seemed odd, given that we were having a late lunch and there were only a few other customers.  Once it did appear, however, it was satisfying. I ordered the salmon tacos, which were on special, and I demolished them in short order. Even more delicious was the jalapeno cheddar grits casserole. It was more like just grits than a casserole, but it was amazing. Thinking about it is making me crave another serving.  I hereby endorse Krazy Fish with 4 whole Yelp stars. It's good to know there's a relatively convenient place to get my fish taco fix. No more going to NoDa just to get 'tude from the Cabo staff.

cQcGrdWd7eMQCAKWc5aV_w.text: I really want to like this place, but I'm not sure that I can.  First of all, it's LOUD. We were meeting some friends there, and I walked in to see if there was a wait (and if so, put our names on the list). The hostess asked if she could help; I looked around and saw a few empty tables, so said "no thanks, I'm meeting some friends". She asked me to repeat myself, so I did. She still didn't hear me, so I repeated myself again. She asked yet again, so this time I almost screamed "I"M MEETING SOME FRIENDS AND WANTED TO SEE IF WE NEEDED TO PUT OUR NAME DOWN". She then gave me an "eat s--t" look for (I suppose) "yelling" at her. If it wasn't so loud, I wouldn't need to say it four times.  Our waiter was super-friendly, but almost comically incompetent. He went around the table asking everyone for their drink orders. He told a joke to someone, then walked off without asking if I wanted anything. He walked by several times, oblivious to me trying to get his attention. He brought out the beers for the rest of the table, but never looked once in my direction. So I had to get up, walk to the bar and order the beer myself. I don't believe he ever even asked if it we wanted another round, either. So I guess you're only allowed one beer per meal at Krazy Fish. The old man would later bring our checks as five different checks (oh, I guess he COULD see me when it was time to pay the bill!). We were two couples and a friend; I guess he could have simply ASKED how wanted them separated, but no.  OK, so the service sucks... but how's the food? I got the fried shrimp tacos. They were tasty, save for the "pink gold salsa", which the menu describes as "yogurt, honey, chipotle chilis and lime". To me it tasted like yogurt, corn syrup, high fructose corn syrup, cane sugar juice, liquid glucose and hot fudge sauce. Yes, it was overwhelmingly sweet, like a shrimp taco liberally doused in liquid cotton candy. It was gross. The mac and cheese, supposedly some of the best in the city, was OK. Perhaps I've heard too much hype, but I can make significantly better mac and cheese at home myself.  I've been back a couple of times, and the experience was slightly better service wise, but I think this is the most overrated food in Charlotte.

RU6meE1Lfugz5QW0n8Kgmw.text: Loved this place so quirky yet very clean.The wings were to die for.The tacos and their Krazy Slaw make your mouth water.The staff was just amazing their suggestions,spot on .Can't wait to try more we went for lunch,next visit dinner and drinks.

T26VSUcyoq1lSHL3pDzQgg.text: This is a hidden gem and one of my favorite spots, super friendly staff, welcoming atmosphere and great food - much better than Cabo Fish Taco in my opinion! Try the tacos and the Krazy Grill.

BE4mmcHe_webqA4gst_7RQ.text: So a ton of friends recommended this place to me- I finally went and I was not dissapointed! It was really delicious. I got the salmon tacos- and my husband got the buffalo shrimp taco- it was also really amazing. From the outside you might think idk this looks like a meh place... But trust me just try the food and you'll realize it's a fantastic place. Our waitress was also incredible.

gHpwXe589oCvUK9ymtMeRg.text: I swear this place should be called "7 Seas".   Do to their seafood based cusine combined with thier Roti menu (indian) and they sauce varieties, this place can serve any pallet accordingly.  I am first-generation american from India and I love their indian sauce with the roti.  I took my parents there and they loved the potato filled roti with indian sauce.  They loved it!!.  Also as part of daily specials, they offer Thai and Chinese based recipes with a seafood fusion.

2bF2pNptQoQHuxm8yIU_Ow.text: For a place that has a fish in the name they do not even serve fresh seafood. I ordered the mussels and they were disgusting and pink in color, which is common of mussels that have been previously FROZEN!!! I also ordered the mac and cheese and lets just say easy mac tastes way better. To top everything off, we experienced horrible service from the on staff "manager". When I explained the mussel situation to her, her response was, " well what do you want me to do. Our mussels come to us already prepared, we just saute them." She said to me that she was not even sure why she was asked to come and speak to me regarding the matter, as she did not see a problem. I thought it was quite strange as well that on the menu, it states their policy, which is -if your food is cooked through, they will not issue any refunds-. WEIRD! GROSS! TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY! They heavily advertise chef and host of the show "diners, drive-ins, and dives", GUY FIERI. I am CERTAIN he would have been most disappointed in our experience as well.

CdQwcWwVIdNI_OPkEvqV1A.text: DISGUSTING. Haven't even reviewed a restaurant in so long but I had to come on here to review how disgusting this place was. To the point I had to use the restroom minutes after (sorry, TMI; not sorry). Okay I did take out so maybe dinning experience would be different ... or maybe it should still be as great. I threw everything out after 5 bites and each bite was to try a bit of everything. I had the beef Krazy grill dinner. First of all, the worst grits I ever had, the cheese tasted so old that when I smelled it; it smelt like the cheese had been chillin under the bed for months, just disgusting I dont know how else to describe the grits. Mac n cheese? Terrible. They try to make it like a southern style with the crispy parts of it, gtfoh. Easy mac is better. What's next .. corn bread. Dry as hell. Bland. Basically pointless. I dont know what kind of fusion restaurant this is. Bulgolgi was too wet, try again. Gumbo wasn't bad though, I mean I still only gave it one bite but it was a lot better than the others. Out of everything, the grits had to be the worst. I'm all about giving 2nd chances, not this time. I was so pissed, I called my mother just to tell her about it.

e-yT-et_OJi3vhRfzHwKew.text: My friend and I went here last Friday night before swing dancing.  The waiter was attentive and friendly.  He allowed us to substitute a big bowl of queso for their queso and salsa sampler appetizer.  We basically filled up on the scrumptious cheese.  I had the shrimp tacos, which were very tasty.  The shrimp had just enough breading and was cooked through.  The squash casserole was not my favorite side though.  It was a bit spicy, even though the waiter assured me it would not be, and mushy as well.   The restaurant was quiet for a Friday night, which allowed for my friend and I to visit with each other.  The decor is very interesting to look at, with old toys hung up here and there.  It looks like Guy Fieri has stopped by this place too, which is pretty neat.

ioxdAe6-ffdlsYB7G58yKA.text: Awesome food!   I didn't really know what to expect because it's definitely a hole in the wall.   The server was really nice! One of my friends didn't like their side, and he switched it out with no problem. He also provided excellent recommendations!!   I went with my friends, and collectively we got the calamari as an appetizer. It was really good. Not too much batter, and the flavor was good.   I got the shrimp and grits. Their grits are jalapeno cheddar and they won an award in Charlotte for them. And they taste like they deserved it! It was really good and the peppers and slightly sweet (I think it was mango salsaish) was a nice twist.   My friends got the schezuan salmon tacos! AMAZING! The salmon was cooked perfectly. Sauce was great. It also had a vegetable blend on top. The portion was good even though you only get 2 tacos and a side. The tacos were pretty large.   My other friend ordered the something Willy poboy with fried shrimp and scallops. I didn't get to taste it, but it looked really good and she said it was good. It was pretty big too.  Definitely recommend it!

uKwtRm6YLTtqQuZBalBBEA.text: I'm always impressed when I come here. The array of options (including vegan ones!) is stunning. Pro tips: order the $1 mystery beer (not on the menu) and be sure to check the bottom of your receipt (there's a coupon for next time!).

w8c6ejVsSncwxu466EMjAA.text: Stopped here for a bite to eat. Atmosphere is fun and funky, just the way I like it. Food was delicious and with lots of options. If I lived here I would come here all the time.

ZHbTFnrNLEVdAd-_XfH1XA.text: Why has it taken me so long to review Krazy Fish!? I guess it's in line with so many other reviews of mine where I wanted to pitch my opinion as best as possible for a place I think is so awesome. And that it certainly is.  Out-of-towners? This might be one of my favorite places to bring them. Especially if they're an out-of-countryer. This joint is so whacked-out. Think...remember the peyote cactus trip from the Beavis and Butthead movie? Yeah that. They've got some bizarre decor you really just have to see to believe. And outside they've done well to turn integral parts of cars into flower-like metal sculpture, a necessity to any tripper's garden.  But where their garden lacks in legit, earth-grown greenery their kitchen does not. Vegetarian or vegan you can find an option. Plenty of cilantro, plenty of tomatoes and peppers. That's just a start. Seafood tacos are the way to go. Any fish you can imagine they'll have it in here sometime as the daily special. Sea bass, scallops, tilapia, shrimp. Fry it, grill it, broil it. Then toss it with veggies into a taco shell and coat it with a house made sauce like the pink gold - yogurt based sweet & spicey - or the blueberry chutney, which pretty much speaks for itself in excellence. If you're looking for a real fusion southern favorite, stand firm with the jalapeno cheddar grits which might well be their biggest claim to fame.  Waitstaff is helpful and informative about the menu in general. In fact we were delighted with the friendly waitress who just plops right down beside you and guides you through the menu as if she were your new BFF. In reality I'm sure she just can't stand watching everybody else enjoy the food while she works. My only qualm is the location of Krazy Fish. Either Plaza Midwood needs to get to expanding down in their direction or Krazy Fish needs truck shop up beside all the goings-on. Imagine all the late-night Common Market drinkers that would wander in to binge!

VCxmIGRH2w5FoV4QEVzqzA.text: I should've ordered the gumbo. They're known for their gumbo. I got shrimp tacos and they were just okay. The restaurant itself is quirky in a fun way. If I go back I'll definitely order the correct thing this time.

-vWy5VfEik96i-lcM1bmGQ.text: The management should be ashamed for having one server who doesn't know how to treat people who are waiting to be served. We were waiting to at least get glasses of water but we didnt even receive that. We sat there for 30 min, it was not that busy and we didnt even have appetizers. Just because the food is good, doesn't mean that the service should be trash. Waiter should be fired, and management needs to be smarter and more diligent in their worker hirings. I would never recommend this place solely because service quality should match the food quality.

DBhUmBqiUSSFOnOrUjrS5Q.text: Sorry, but this place does not live up to the "DDD Guy F" show.  I ordered off of the "Featured DDD menu", spicy gumbo type dish and my wife ordered the shrimp and grits.  All of the seafood was sub-standard, very small pieces of seafood, mini shrimp, mini scallops, I couldn't even tell they were scallops because they were so small. Shrimp and grits was super oily and had way too many pineapples in it, it stated it came with jumbo shrimp, NOT! It came with the super tiny frozen shrimp you buy from Wally World. And sorry, the cornbread was terrible.   The service was terrible, people walking around not doing anything, 1 guy working, three girls just walking around aimlessly.   Please take down the "DDD" poster in your restaurant, if you're not going to make the food like you did in the show, if you're going to cheap out, then don't claim it on your menu and on your wall. People come to your place because of the show.

MYn5bdfJ4rE9FqQV5gMXBQ.text: Went for lunch with Baldie today.  We were pretty much rushed in and not even before we were seated, we were asked if we "knew what we wanted to drink yet".  No, we don't! Can we sit down first?? We asked to be seated at a booth instead and the big tan guy rushing us seemed annoyed. Too bad. Our server was really nice, but I think they were short-staffed, so she rushed through the specials. I forgot what they were! Anyway, we ordered the Shrimp Gazpacho. It came with a boatload of nice sized shrimp, probably U/15, really fresh and tortilla chips. I could've sworn they were supposed to be homemade, but they weren't. It was very good, nice and spicy, but it was a little too sweet, with orange I believe. They should've used more lemon instead. We then ordered the tacos. Now, mostly everything comes with their "Krazy Slaw" and my Sweet Chili Fried sea bass tacos were no exception. I wasn't aware that the slaw had cumin in it and although I like cumin, I don't want it in my fish tacos. The fish was good, just didn't like the taste. But they're HUGE! I should've split with Baldie, who got the Bulgogi tacos. I loved those, although they could've been more tender, but really good and they came with a diced cucumber salad on them. Great flavors. The tacos came with choice of a side. He got Mac and cheese, boring and just ok. But my jalapeno cheddar grits were outta this world! We'll def go back for dinner and try an entree. We weren't Krazy about it, but it definitely deserves another chance.

cioigJroj4Gzw_bc32iV4g.text: Let's get Kraaaazzzzy!!! Found off of Central past Plaza Midwood, Krazy Fish is truly a hidden gem and a hole in the wall- but it's Krazy good! Instantly when you walk in you're greeted by the smell of fresh seafood so be prepared to get a little fishy- however they do have two outdoor patios.   I always opt for their tacos with the jalapenos grits. One thing I love about them-They stuff the tacos!!!! They are huge! Plus, they always have delicious specials with my favs being the jalapeno grouper and the spicy pineapple Mahi. On the drinks end, they have $1 mystery beers and pretty cheap mixed drinks ($5-$7).   Overall, Krazy Fish is a great low-key place to try! If you're ever bored just come and check out their krazy decor inside and outside on the front patio! It's Krazzzzzy weird.   Ps. Some of their tacos get a little "drippy" because of the marinade the fish is cooked in. I recommend putting your tacos on a napkin and draining your taco before eating it so the shell doesn't break.

KKnCxMIR-7sx5o6zlqju_g.text: We saw them on diners drive in and dives and had to try it out. The bugogi beef tacos were incredible. The shrimp and grits were the best we have ever had. The gumbo was spot on and the chicken sandwich that my daughter had was perfect. We definitely will be back, and when you come here get the beef tacos they are a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Krazy Fish - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great lunch

gNMEPd8MlPyC_zzRVnVqOQ.text: You can't drive pass this place, the building design and features are artsy and unique. They really captured the essence of the name "Krazy Fish". The inside decor was hand splattered seats and benches with an assortment of colors and different fun objects hanging from the ceiling . I loved the artist approach , my daughter even stated it felt like she wasn't in Charlotte.   The food was just as interesting , I asked the server how the owners/cooks thought of the menu and specials bc they had a special "kimchi Mahi" . He stated the owners loved Asian cuisine, seafood , Spanish,  and Creole flavors so they had dishes inspired from what they experienced and enjoyed. I mean who doesn't love kimchi and Korean beef Bulgogi ;p . Since I can eat Korean anytime I ordered the Cuban chicken with a combo of yummy tofu, two sides , etc . View my yummy pics :)   Enjoy everything we ordered . I'll definitely be back , especially since the great service was the icing on the cake .

EOdR_3-fhTeAwPskR3vh2w.text: I had a really unpleasant experience at this restaurant tonight. I found it odd that a restaurant that supposedly specializes in seafood, mainly serves popcorn shrimp and pollock fish... anyway, there was hair at the bottom of our calamari dish. The manager did nothing about it. For my entree, I ordered the popcorn shrimp platter with Mac and cheese, cornbread, and slaw. The shrimp were uncleaned, the slaw was super dry, and the Mac and cheese was cold and bland. When I alerted the manager, she didn't do anything. She didn't fix the issue and listen to us, the paying customers. I've worked in food service in the past and know this is not the way restaurants should operate. I'm visiting from LA, and this restaurant is a poor representation of the Charlotte culinary scene.

2P0ds0yB91Y038_7xInVCQ.text: Wow am I glad I finally checked this place out. I don't know if it's the name or what but it was never at the top off my must try list. I wish it was though!  I had a hard time choosing what to order but ended up going with one of the specials that day, Mahi Kim Chi tacos with a side of Jalapeno grits. The flour tortillas are lightly fried and taste homemade. I can honestly say that the tortillas are the best I've ever had - ever. The fish was cooked just right and the Kim Chi added the right amount of kick to put this dish over the edge for me. Those on the fence for which side to get go with the Jalapeno grits - you won't be disappointed.   The ambiance is certainly eclectic to say the least. It's nothing that will prevent you from coming back but I found myself squinting and grinning multiple times as I looked around and the decor.  Is the artistic flair "out there"? Sure. But with food this good you can get away with it.
